description:
First time here. My fiancé and his best friend raves about this place, so finally we made it. Let me tell you, what yummy food! If you're into delicious homemade food with friendly conversation and good beer, come here!

The sausages are very delicious. Definitely one up and get the fried egg as well. Homemade chips were also superb! It's a smaller spot but definitely worth the trip. Try the pretzel role. Should probably ask to sub the regular bun with the Pretzel role.
author: E C.

description:
Normally I pass these type places, afraid it's going to be just too pubby for my tastes. Today I made an exception, and it was a fabulous call! Not that I get the props--all I did was heed the "we serve lunch" sign, and Hogwash did the rest.

I should have known, just by the sacrilegious name. This place specializes in sausage. If you like sausage, keep reading. If you think sausage is evil, keep reading (because you know you're intrigued). 

Among other things, they create several sausage types and serve them up as sandwiches, with exotic things like fried avocado on top. So are all you anti-sausage people back with me when I mentioned avocado? I thought so. Unless you think fried is evil, and I can't help you there. But keep reading for the same reason you read until now.

Nearly choosing the Burnin' Brock, which is habanero chicken sausage with aforementioned avocado, I settled on the intentionally vauguely named All Day. This vixen is comprised of pork/maple/ginger breakfast sausage. Breakfast for lunch...and dinner...never a bad choice.

So imagine that, throw in arugula so my wife thinks I ate healthy, then...then...top it with a duck egg. Oh, and add a side of housemade fries. Can it get better? Maybe, if they added truffle oil, but I won't complain.

This was an excellent choice, so glad I made it, but you can't go wrong with anything from what I could tell. There's even a Hogless with garbanzo beans (my favorite named bean), for the vegetarians among us.

I'll try really hard to return, maybe when it's not mid-day and  I can partake in the libations.
author: Paul V.

description:
I mean this place has a vegetarian sausage! Everything we ordered on the menu was good but the grainy mustard on veggie sausage was amazing!!

Good beer options and decent wines.

The vibe is hip and cool! But don't come on a sunday afternoon, unless you want to be the only person at the bar! ;)
author: Nidhi M.

description:
HOLY COW THE CURRY FRIES WITH A DUCK EGG WERE AMAZING!!!  I wish I hadn't ordered a salad afterwards because the salad felt so...unsatisfying afterwards.  Be sure to eat anything else you've ordered first orrrr just get TWO servings of the curry fries and duck egg, if you're hungry.  My boyfriend ordered the vegetarian sausage; we liked the sauce but the it was also only just-ok, relative to the curry fries.

The bartender was very helpful in selecting a beer for me, as I'm not very big on beer (more of a wine lover).  I'm sure the beer selection turns over a lot (can't find the beer list on the website, so unfortunately I can't tell you what I had... I just know it was 10.5%).  If you aren't sure what to try because you're new to beer, Hogwash is a great place to go.  

The space is huge with high ceilings in the very front with communal seating and higher tables on the side for groups of 4.  The bar is at the back.  If you sit in the front area, you have to order your food at the bar.  I recommend sitting at the bar if there's only 2 of you, so then you can chat about with the bartenders about beer.  I definitely want to come back with a group of friends though; the big wood tables looked very inviting.
author: Elle W.

description:
So here's my take: Hogwash is a clever name for a great concept with a wonderful tap selection and standout service. It's a great spot for happy hour beers or people who just like to belly up and talk about beer. Where it's lacking, in my opinion, is their signature draw - the sausage. 

The food overall was solid, but the chicken habanero sausage in my wife's "Burnin' Brock" sandwich was dry, a very odd flavor and filled with very long stringy bits of fennel (or something else green) that was off-putting. I liked my Hog Cobb salad very much, with a delicious combination of butter lettuce, soft boiled quail eggs, blue cheese, bacon crumbles and tomato. But the dry smoked chicken sausage it came with didn't seem to match the rest of the dish. The best sausage out of the three was our sons beef, cheddar and bacon, which we only had because they were out of the chicken hot dog that usually comes on the kid's bun. 

Maybe my fam just doesn't like chicken sausage, or maybe it was an off day. Overall the food was tasty and the beer selection solid, so that's enough for a return visit.
author: Alex L.

description:
I came here during lunch on a weekday after reading the fantastic Yelp reviews. The restaurant wasn't that busy at around 11:30am and I was able to easily find a seat. 

I asked the server for her recommendation and she recommended the Burning Brock. The Burning Brock had a chicken habanero sausage, fried avocado and pickled cabbage on a roll with a side of chips. The Burning Brock was tasty and had a nice little spicy kick to it. 

The service was decent but it was mainly due to one person working during the lunch hour. I would definitely come back to try the other items on the menu and give it another try.
author: Michael H.

description:
Amazing spot! I was visiting from Florida checking out this beautiful city and then I came across this place! What an amazing vibe and I love the selection of beer! Love the ambiance, great decor and very clean. Staff is also super amazing and very helpful. 

I got the sheepish sandwich comes with a lamb merguez sausage on a soft roll with a blue cheese sauce and pickle cabbage. This sandwich is so delicious, the flavor from the merguez mix was amazing!! To wash my sandwich down I got a refreshing blueberry ale. I also sampled a few of the other beers that were on tap and it was hard making a decision on which one I wanted. 

I will definitely stop in here if I'm ever in the San Francisco area again. It was such a great time and great food.
author: Yonette B.

description:
I came here w/ some folks during a work conference at the Westin. Super walkable and the place felt and looked clean. 

They have a good amount of beer on tap (I think it was 32). Their sandwiches are pretty much a sausage dog on a yummy roll.

I ordered the duck egg sausage sandwich. I was very pleased. Their homemade chips were surprisingly delicious as well. I really wanted French fries but it's not available until 4 PM. 

All in all, it's pretty darn delicious ! I would come back if I am around.
author: Wil L.

description:
OK, wow!  I came here because I was in the area for a work meeting, and it is a nice walk from FiDi where I work. Plus, I gotta say the reviews were great, AND I love a good sausage.

Loved it and will come back often.  It was difficult to choose, so I went for an artery clogger with the duck egg sandwich and home made chips.  Delicious stuff.  

Service was fast and the place is nice and clean/trendish.

Must try.
author: Massimo M.

description:
Every once in a blue moon you walk into the right place. For me, Hogwash has it all, great selection of beers with hipster bartenders who serve as friendly guides through the evening's possibilities: beers and high-end sausages with tasty side dishes.

For my first visit I had a Fieldwork IPA and a Burning Brock Chicken Sandwich with a side of Curry Fries. Delicious!

Ryan was my bartender for my second visit, and I had the Cobb Salad and started with the Fieldwork IPA and then enjoyed the Ryan's recommendation of the Gulden Draak 9000 Belgian Ale, which has a deep amber color and quickly transports your mind to medieval Europe.

Even more, Ryan wrote out a list of restaurant recommendations, including Nopa, which will be my next stop! Thanks Ryan.

For a modern gastropub / tavern in the Union Square area, this is the place to hang out. I look forward to many happy returns.
author: John H.

description:
Hogwash brings me joy because the host/front of house staff. I didn't catch his name, but he's extremely helpful, friendly, and professional. We went during the Warriors Finals to watch the game and he kept everything clean, organized, and was sure to greet everyone who came in with proper information.

We didn't get a chance to eat any food, but my husband got a German beer and I got a wine. Affordably priced for how gorgeous the venue is. Long community tables, huge projector, two screens in the back towards the bar and lights that'll make you daydream.

30 beers on tap and a variety of wines to choose from. This place is my go to for drinks out in the Union Square neighborhood.
author: Patty B.

description:
I really dig this place. Offering a plethora of handles for mostly local craft brews and a few international ones, too - there's a poison for everyone here. If you're looking for cocktails, you should probably stop reading now.

An ice cold beer was all I could think of after walking around town in my heeled booties all afternoon. Going back a few blocks to get here was worth it after walking into a very inviting vibe of calm earth tones and a somewhat historic feel from the interior. I went straight for the IPAs, sampling a few before locking down on the Barebottle Peach Milkshake IPA which is an SF brew. Quite impressive with a slight heaviness on the hops and beautifully complimented with refreshing citrus notes. Their sours are aplenty, too and I know many who are into that. Serving some red, white, sparkling, and dessert wine, I think that's all they have when it comes to the bar. I wish I could confirm if they had food or not. We only came for drinks and they served us well. What a find!
author: Marissa S.

description:
The Burnin' Brock chicken habanero sausage with fried avocado was my favorite of the two sausages that I tried. The sausage was surprisingly spicy and juicy. The veggies on top of the sausage tasted fresh and the sauce was good and not too heavy. 

The Sheepish lamb sausage with blue cheese sauce and beets was also pretty good, but the sausage was a bit dry. I think they tried to compensate for this dryness by layering on a bunch of blue cheese sauce (so much that the bun was soaked and dripping). While the sauce was undoubtedly good, it seemed a little bit unnecessary to put so much on the bun, especially because it did not hide the dryness of the sausage at all. 

Don't bother with their hot sauce - it was bland and didn't have any kick to it (even when I doused my sausage in it).

They have a lot of different beers on tap, however it was not the best selection the day I went there. I ended up choosing a Fieldwork hazy IPA, which was delicious.

Hogwash has a great vibe - pretty low key and easy to talk to your friends, while also being lively in the background. Food and drink are easily ordered at the bar and are delivered to your table pretty quickly. 

If I am in the neighborhood again, I will definitely considering coming back here and trying their other sausages!
author: Haixing K.

description: Great beer list and even better sandwiches made from house-made sausage. It gets pretty crowded but the staff was on it and stayed friendly and engaging even through the rush. The beet appetizer was super good. A buddy ordered fried pickles, which I've never been i to, but were different. I'll definitely be back.
author: Kirt W.

description:
Love this place so much!
Came here on a Friday night with friends.
Good beers, good vibes, and good friends made a wonderful night.
This place hits all the rights spots for beer and sausages. 
Nice to eat and hang out with friends, casual, not too loud.

Good location, near Union Square. 
Food was good, beer was so great.
We ordered sausage plates and curry fries.
We also tried lots of their beer here.
Two Rivers Apple cider was my favorite.

Service was good as well. 
Server was friendly and attentive. 

Would come back again and again to explore their beer menu. 
Come check it out and if you are looking for a cool spot in town.
author: Naiyun W.

description:
On a recent trip to the city we found ourselves on Union Square and wanted a cold brew and a tasty snack. After a short survey of the area, we opted for a good choice of frosty beverages and a variety of house-made sausages. 

This is a cool smallish tap room with an extensive listing of regional brews, ciders and small but tasty menu of sausage sandwiches, small plates and fresh salads. Lots is family style seating with a few lounge areas, and window bar stools with counter tops. 

I was traveling with my registered medical service animal, and initially the hostess didn't want to allow us in. After a few minutes of conversation we were able to sit up by the front windows for a meal (there obviously needs to be an update on policy and training with this establishment as it's against federal ADA laws to not allow my RMSA with me) This initially confrontation with the hostess and shift manager? made me feel uncomfortable and the need to defend myself for being a disabled veteran and having my registered seizure animal with me.

Walk up counter service for both food and drinks. We decided on what we wanted and ordered at the bar, got a number and sat down. Our drinks came quickly, as did our food. My wife went for the Sheepish (lamb sausage with blue cheese sauce and cabbage)sandwich and myself the Abe Froman (beef, cheddar and bacon sausage with thousand island dressing, romaine, pickles and tomato) along with the Asian pear and arugula salad.

The sandwiches are huge and could definitely be split between two as well as the salads. My sandwich was tasty a nice combination of flavors with a great bacon cheddar overtone, and the pear arugula salad was a nice portion of fresh spicy greens and sweet pears and it was delicious and large enough to share.
My wife said her sandwich was very good too, the lamb sausage was nicely seasoned and the sharpness of the blue cheese with tangy pickled red cabbage, and it was more than she could finish.

All in all a good place for a bite to eat and a cold drink, worth a visit as long as you're not traveling with your service animal. 

3.5 Stars - rounded down instead of up for the initial reception, it's hard to take that first minutes of a bad experience away regardless of the meal.

May go back but most likely will not.

00526
author: Ray F.

description:
Great chicken, so-so merguez, blasé curry fries (like poutine without the curds) ...

AND beautiful sours.....

BUT...washrooms were sloppier than a truck-stop in Hopland. Male staff were using the women's restroom. Makes me wonder about the state of their kitchen.

Front of House was friendly, courteous, efficient.
author: David S.

description: Great choice of craft beers and helpful staff. We were able to satisfy our need for several nice stouts and porters.
author: David B.

description:
Great beer selection and the sausage was fantastic!  Curry fries w// a duck egg to die for!
Wash it down with a great beer!
author: Jules S.

description:
Hogwash:  Meaningless or insincere talk, according to the dictionary.  As far as pubs go, this place is not hogwash.  It's a block from Union Square, and although we were tourists, it does not seem touristy.

The decor is minimal, but the on-tap beer selection is fabulous!  Our group of four was thirsty, not hungry, and beers were our only order.  Mine was Boulevard Tequila Gose, oddly named but very tasty.  Most selections were in the $7 to $8 range for 7 to 16 oz. pours. Comprehensive barely describes  the variety of beers on tap.

Drop by during off times, because it gets really packed later in the day.  And that ain't hogwash.
author: Bert G.

description:
I don't even like sausage, guys. 

I came here with my boyfriend because he loves meat (er, he's intensely carniverous?? Is there even a graceful way to say this??).

Anyway, I like this place. The sandwich I got was more like a sausage-y cheeseburger, and all the sandwiches on their menu seemed to be sausage-y takes on completely different sandwiches, which I thought was unique. They pull it off quite well. I also like that you pay before your meal, so you don't have to worry about waiting for the check at the end.

The dessert was also heavenly. I wasn't expecting a place like this to have such a stand out dessert, but oh, did it ever. We got the chocolate banana bread pudding and I probably won't ever forget it. 

Overall, this isn't my thing, but it was pretty good.
author: Claire C.

description:
I'm digging this hip, open and communal setting with meat sausage variety! 

Beer is of great selections and I adore the charming lights hung around the restaurant.  It makes this a warm and welcoming place!

Curry fries are a must get with their savory sausage delight!

They have other delightful bites, but one can't go wrong with sausage and beer!  Yum! 

Great place to gather and chat!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Bustling gastro pub with great choices from a simple menu. 

Saturday night, solo diner, I got the last free seat at the bar. Straight into a saison and some fried pickles. So much sour, so much goodness!

My main course was the lamb sausage, augmented with a fried duck egg. Awesome!! Tasty sausage, spicy accompaniments and the outrageously rich duck egg connecting it all. 

I went for a black saison during the main - pleasantly surprised by a fuller body that retained the lighter, sour taste. 

I should mention that the lady seated next to me went for the sausage platter - eight of their best, with pickles, on a tray. She told me it was too much for a solo diner but well worth taking away - which they arranged for her.
author: Richard L.

description:
Cool little bar (with some food) that has a unique style and really friendly bartenders. 

I had the huckleberry cider, which was their only one on tap. It was crisp and sweet. I also tried some of my friend's beer (an IPA whose name I'll never remember). 

I like the communal tables and the upside down xmas tree they had here (I came during the holidays). 

Overall a nice bar with a lot of drink options and a friendly staff! 

Stay Cheerful ;)
author: Garen A.

description:
This place is definitely NOT Hogwash! I shared the Burnin' Brock and Abe Froman. Sad to learn the curry fries are only a dinner item, but hey I guess that's an excuse to be back. The sausages were made of quality meat (the guy at the front said they make 'em fresh every day!).

The Burnin' Brock was a chicken habanero sausage with harissa aioli, pickled cabbage, fried avocado, fennel and apple. I didn't really notice the avocado or fennel, but the pickled cabbage paired really well with the sausage (like the pork version of The Bird!). The sausage had good flavor and was pretty moist. 4/5.

The Abe Froman was a beef, cheddar, and bacon sausage with chopped romaine, tomato, and pickles. This felt a little closer to a fancy schmancy hot dog. The bacon and cheddar flavors didn't shine too strongly on this. It was definitely a bit heavier than the Burnin' Brock. 3.75/5.

The duck egg I got on top of the Burnin' Brock was so good! Crispy sides with a perfectly drippy yolk that really brought the rest of the sandwich together. The chips accompanying the sandwiches were freshly fried (that fresh chip taste, mmm!) and a bit thicker cut than normal without being too oily. 4/5 on chips.

The interior was industrial yet comforting, lots of dark wood and polished surfaces. Their bar is beautiful! Service was friendly and the guy at the counter made a point of greeting everyone who walked into the store. I'll be back!
author: Nicole H.

description:
A cool bar in Union Square. Was starving and wanted something quick. You order at the bar and they bring it to your table. 

I had the pork sausage sandwich with the fried egg. It was quite cute. A bit salty. Had a side of fries. Tasty and salty too. Not a beer drinker but my friend liked hers. 

Quite a busy place.
author: Mitzi W.

description:
Got the All Day sandwich which came out pork maple ginger sausage, arugula, and fried duck egg.

The bread was good - crunchy and toasted well. The sausage was juicy and had a good flavor - strong on the maple. The duck egg was only okay - didn't taste special. 

Fries were average. A lot of good beer selections.

One negative - three of us ordered food at the same time but my friend got his food 10 mins before all of us. I wonder how often this happens..
author: Sang P.

description:
This was a very nice experience for us, the Abe Froman was delicious, and we had great company for lunch. Our host was friendly (should I say, "teacher friendly?") and was very amenable to changing our ale should we not be satisfied. This will be a stop during our next visit... Freaking YUM!!!

Okay, so we sat around for a few extra minutes and suckered ourselves into desert. How can you go wrong with pecan, chocolate,  , and vanilla ice cream?
author: Monsieur F.

description: Amazing service and amazing food! I forget what the woman's name was but she was on top of my order and was quick to refill my framboise after I guzzled the first one. I got the first thing on the menu, a spicy sausage with slaw and fried avocado. Insane.
author: Melissa S.

description:
That was great.  Come in and engage with the staff on what you like and want.  They will make sure you leave happy.  

Large selection of drafts, and attentive bartenders that are knowledgeable and will help you hone in on your favorite taste.  There were 2 bartenders covering 15 patrons, so there was little delay in getting their attention.  

I started with a Lagunitas Sour Cherry.  When it was time to order food I had a Cesar Salad (Kale instead of Romaine) with a chicken sausage added.  Delicious.  To finish things off I ordered a finished with a Little Creatures Australian Pale Ale and I split the fried pickles with another patron (amazing).

I would recommend discussing what you like with your bartender\server as they did not hesitate to make recommendations and adjustments.
author: Gary G.

description: Love this place. Visited with a colleague for late drinks. Incredible beer selection and unique menu. Be sure to try the pretzel roll! The staff was friendly and attentive, and the owner treated us like VIPs. Highly recommended.
author: Vaughn S.

description:
Cool spot near Union Square. I liked that they have someone in charge of seating. So unlike other places where you have to creep on tables waiting for them to empty, there is a host taking care of the seating. 
There's beers and there's sausages. The sandwiches are good but a little on the expensive side.  I believe a lot of work went into making them but they were just ok. Still it's a cool place to hang out, get some casual food and have a drink.
author: Veronica L.

description: Great beer selection along with sausages that are tasty. The Curry Fries are solid for sure but the beer selection is always great. Most of the list is local CA.
author: Shawn M.

description: Excellent food for a bar and I like the growing concept of 'order at the bar' which simplifies things a lot. Also good selection of beers and cosy atmosphere, maybe a little on the loud side but you can still make a conversation. I like this place and will probably come back when I'm in the area.
author: Gil S.

description:
Came by for a casual lunch with a friend on a Thursday for lunch.  There were a few people but not busy overall. There's a few larger bench tables for bigger groups and a few high tables. You order at the counter and seat yourself. Water is self serve. I'd be very comfortable coming here for a weekday lunch alone. Parking in the area can be difficult but it's not too far from the BART.

For our meal I got the Sheepish, my friend got the Burnin' Brock, and we shared the Hogg Cobb.

Sheepish: Very very tasty. I don't even like beets very much but turning it into a relish offset the earthy flavor and it's sweetness worked well with the blue cheese. The lamb wasn't too gamey but did give the whole thing an extra kick of flavor. Only downside is the size. With the chips it's a light-average meal (4.5/5)

Burnin' Brock: I only took a small bite so I can't fully judge but the sausage itself was tasty and not too spicy initially. It does have a kick afterwards but not so bad where I feel like I'm running for the milk. The pickled cabbage on top works perfectly with it. I still preferred the sheepish but that's just preference (4/5)

Hogg Cobb: The only disappointing part of our meal. For $12 it's just not worth it. I would've loved more butter lettuce. There were a lot of salty components but only 5-6 large leaves of lettuce. There were also only 2 quail eggs. Between the bacon crumbles, blue cheese, and a very salty smoked chicken sausage, I really needed more lettuce or eggs to balance it out. I wasn't a huge fan of the sausage in general. It was salty and a bit tough. (2/5)

Overall, I did enjoy my meal here though. Moral of the story is pass on the salad and get the sausage sandwiches.
author: Vivian C.

description: Their curry fries and fried pickles were tasty. My friend and I ordered the Burnin Brock and the Abe Froman. The Burnin Brock came with a chicken habenero sausage and Abe Froman came with beef, cheddar & bacon sausage. I liked the toppings on the Burnin Brock better (fried avocado! harissa aioli, pickled cabbage, fennel and apple), but the sausage in the Abe Froman better. I thought the chicken sausage in the Burnin Brock was a little dry. Still overall, enjoyable meal and good beer selection.
author: Annie L.

description: Comfortable neighborhood bar with tasty bar food.  The beer selection is excellent. The fried pickles are outstanding. The sausage selection is varied and each is very good. This is a great place to try a few different beers and eat with friends. The seating areas are comfortable and the staff is friendly. One you eat here, you will eat to return.
author: Alan L.

description:
We decided to stop here since we were starving when we got out of the Color Factory. It's right across the street.

I didn't know anything about Hogwash, but I was very happy to see there was a non-meat containing sandwich option. It came on a toasted brioche bun, if I'm remembering right. It was crunchy and delicious. I stuffed myself silly with the flavorful pickled red cabbage and vegan meat. It also came with some awesome kettle chips. 

Though I'm usually pretty good at stopping when I'm full, I downed this and ended up with food coma. It was that amazing.

I also tried one of the sour beers from their list. Pretty damn good.

 I can't tell you more specifics on anything that I ordered since they don't have their menus online right now for me to reference: but it was DELICIOUS.
author: Melanie P.

description:
Hogwash is a refined and hip bar in downtown SF and was a great place to host my team happy hour after visiting Color Factory across the street. Props to the staff for being so accommodating to my group reservation the week of and keeping me up to speed with the status of if it went through. 

This bar has a great selection of house made sausage sandwiches, sausage platters, small bites, and beers. You order at the bar and they'll serve the food as it comes out of the kitchen. Overall I had a good impression of the sausage platter but didn't try most of the food as I was only there temporarily. Apparently the drinks here are pretty strong, especially the Ginger Beer.

We had a positive experience and if you're looking for a place for good sausages & bar food this is the place to go!
author: Chelsea W.

description: Food smells delicious, was not there after 4pm when they have fried pickles  not hungry enough for other food. Beer selection was good and they let you taste anything, I was prepared to buy flights, yay me, didn't have to buy beer I didn't want!
author: Elaine P.

description: Man, I do like this place. After hitting up the color factory the crew strolled across the street to grab a snack.This is your typical gastropub nice and hip. You walk inside you see a few tall tables on the left and a few lower tables on the right. Its spread out enough so you don't feel cramped. That's a good thing because this place gets packed after 5. So let's get to the food and drank. We ordered the curry fries and the Burning Brock. Love how crisp the fries are and the curry was not to overpowering. The Burning brock was spicy but not too spicy and all the ingredients were fresh. The drink I ended up getting was the pineapple cider damn that was nice and refreshing. This is a cool spot to hit up if youre in the union square area.
author: Tony B.

description: My friend and i came from NY to San Francisco for the first time and the one place i was told by all my friends to visit was Hogwash! After looking at he menu (since we're both vegetarian) and confirming with others that we MUST go here, i have to say the place didn't disappoint. The food was extremely flavorful and delicious and Paula was so nice! She recommended some great options for us and was a sweetheart to talk to! My recommendations if you go would be to definitely try the Herb roasted beets (because who doesn't like beets) and the vegetarian sausage and of course the Bread Pudding!!! This is one place i know I'll be back to try again and will recommend to my friends over and over :)
author: Urvi T.

description:
The Burning Brock is absolutely out of this world. I was originally going to eat HALF and take the other half home but once I started, I couldn't stop.

Lots of beer selections and you can't go wrong with any of their sausage sandwiches or dishes.
author: Alicia L.

description:
Modern, gentrified bars are a dime a dozen in the West Bay these days, but at least some places like Hogwash are differentiating themselves from what's otherwise increasingly homogenous competition by putting on decent food offerings. 

While spendier than, say, places like Rosamunde or Top Dog, Hogwash's sausage sandwiches hold their own, especially the All Day, a delicious pork, maple, and ginger breakfast sausage topped with arugula and a sunnyside-up fried duck egg. Furthermore, if you're a beer lover, Hogwash doesn't disappoint. They've got 30 brews on tap, and they're all good choices from all over California and the world.

Service is attentive and professional, and the overall venue and ambience are both sleek and casual. A solid choice just off Union Square.
author: Vincent L.

description:
My experience here wasn't anything spectacular. The restaurant is cozy and there is someone who greets you immediately after you walk in. Their tables are all communal and since we chose a high top (just the two of us), the staff member told us that we would have to share the table if anyone else came in, as the high top can typically fit 6. Luckily, we were able to dine alone while we were here. 

You order at the bar and they give you a number and bring your food out to you. I got the Burnin Brock while the bf got their Sheepish. While my sandwich was ok, I though that the sausage itself was only ok. It was a little too salty for my taste and was pretty small compared to the amount of bread that it comes with. The bf was very disappointed with his Sheepish as it was filled primarily with beets and he ended up scooping a lot of it out. We also ordered an appetizer of the beets with warm goat cheese to start, which was good, although I didn't like that the goat cheese came like a dipping sauce. I was expecting it to be plated, but warm and gooey. Decent, but not sure I'd get that again. 

Because our expectations for this place were high, our overall experience ended up being underwhelming. Not a bad place to go by any means, but not really our cup of tea.
author: Anita L.

description:
After the color factory we were hungry and wanted to grab a quick bite before leaving SF. Since Hogwash was across the street, we decide to go there. After looking at the menu, the bf and I shared decided to share the burnin' brock and fried pickles since we had dinner plans in a few hours. It was honestly, the perfect amount of food without feeling gross or overstuffed. The sausage had a nice kick, I really like the aioli and of course the deep fried avocado. My only compliaint about the burnin's brock is that it's a little too bland. The fried pickles were way too oily. I didn't like the oil socking batter but the sauce that was served with it was bomb.com.

Great spot for a quick and easy bite!
author: Judy V.

description:
We came here for the third stop of our impromptu pub crawl of Nob Hill about 7pm on a Saturday. We were immediately greeted by a young lady who asked us where we would like to sit. She seated us and handed us a menu and directed us to the counter to order. 

The decor is a cool industrial vibe and is clean and inviting. There message at the bottom of the menu states they are a sausage and beer bar and the menu looks great. The food we saw delivered to other tables looked really good as well.

We weren't hungry so i decided to try a new beer with a cool name, Dust bowl taco truck amber lager from Turlock, CA. My wife simply had water since we have at least one more stop. 

We would like to come back to try some of the house made sausages.
author: Mike B.

description:
I'm a huge fan of gastropubs and this one did not disappoint!

If you like the idea of beer and homemade sausage, then this is the place for you!  They make all their specialty sausage in house and have a plethora of recipes!  If you can't decide on just one, they have a sausage sampler platter that will let you get in on all the sausage action.

I am personally always enticed by anything that has a fried egg on it, and the All Day breakfast sandwich boasted the option of a fried duck egg.  OKAY.  Don't have to twist my arm!  It was wonderful!  The pork sausage was slightly sweet with a hint of maple and had a slight tingle of ginger.  The arugula added an element of peppery surprise!  Lastly, the duck egg was cooked perfectly.  White all the way cooked and crispy around the edges with a slightly runny, messy yolk that coated the entire sandwich.  

I also dined on a side of french fries and fried pickles.  The fried pickles were hand dipped and had a crunchy, hard coating.  They were not super salty and the mayo based dipping sauce had a little bit of heat to it.  They were awesome as well and my beer washed the bite of the heat away with ease.

This is a great local spot that is doing something different in the craft beer scene.  I can appreciate it!
author: Lenzie G.

description:
The perfect spot in Union City to quench your thirst... for beer that is. Choose from a wide selection of draft beers in 16 oz, pint or in a ginormous 55 oz, hog-goblet. 

They make scrumptious house made sandwiches. Rolls taste fresh and the house potato chips is really good. 

Burnin' Brock is by far my favorite here. It has everything you want in a sandwich. The chicken habanero sausage, aioli sauce topped with fried avocado and pickled cabbage, fennel and apple combined together is a whole lot of deliciousness in every bite. 

Abe Froman is another favorite. This beef, cheddar & bacon sausage with thousand island dressing, chopped romaine, tomato and pickles is not only tasty but it is full of flavor. 

A great place to drink, eat and chill. I will definitely be back on my next visit to San Francisco.
author: Christine G.

description:
I've been recently here with my family and I was greatly surprised. Everything was so delicious. I mean, I expected that it will be good, but still, you won my heart. 
But the sausages are the best. If you come here, I strongly advise you to try them. You wont regret. 
As a whole, the bar is very comfortable and kinda cozy inside. I really enjoyed that evening. I want to thank the kitchen stuff and the chef for such an amazing food. 
Definitely wanna go there again.
author: Claire S.

description:
Love this gastropub. Casual, not too loud, eclectic collection of immaculately selected beer, and solid food. 

The diners are super nice. Two people gave up their  spots at the communal table to sit at the bar to accommodate our group of four. 

I had the tinneman framboise - excellent beer for non beer drinkers. A hint of beer well balanced with raspberry flavor. Unlike other Belgian version, this one is not too sweet or too sour. Just right. 

The fried pickles are also fun to try. Fries are solid.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Excellent places serving great craft beers and house made sausage hoagies. Super friendly staff. Our bartender, Chris, was very friendly and engaging. I had the hot chicken sausage and the taste was great. 

This place was close to our hotel so was within easy walking distance.
author: Bill B.

description:
I want to give this place 3 stars for its just sausages, fries and pickles ...oh and beer. So you really got to like sausages because that... really...is ...the focus on this menu. 
I'm not a sausage fan so Me? I am like meh. 
Where as My friend loves sausage and was in absolute "hog"heaven.  
So I give it 5 stars because even a non sausage lover as myself; this place rocked out the flavors in the sausage. 
It was 65$ for two of us including ;
8 sausages 
1 beer 
1 iced tea
author: Cory P.

description:
Tried the house made sausage sampler, wasn't that impressed by any of the sausages really.  The one that stood out was the lamb. It was pretty flavorful. The rest were pretty bland. The chicken one was super spicy. For the price, definitely not worth it to be honest.  

We came by during lunch hour, they only had one server for the entire place. So service was pretty slow.
author: Michelle N.

description:
We really enjoyed this place. It was a little loud, but that was expected because it was a bar! We ordered the habenero chicken sausage sandwich, which was perfect spicy for me, but a little too spicy for my fiance. It was tasty and a good snack for us. We also got the ceasar salad, which was served as full leaves. I am unsure if we liked that or not, but it was tasty once we cut it up using our knife.

Service wise, the bar tender were quick and polite. No complaints. And they didn't rush us out even though we were only drinking water and sitting at the bar. 

Definitely a nice spot to go with friends at night. It wasn't too roudy either for a bar. I recommend and would go back.
author: Okapi C.

description: Great find in Union Square. Brian our bartender is da bomb. Has the rolled pretzel (bread) and roasted beets with goat cheese -- outstanding!
author: Patricia H.

description:
Very pricey for what it is. 
The food was okay but pretty different. I ordered the habanero chicken and it was pretty good. The fries were also very good and crunchy- that was probably the highlight of the meal. We also ordered the fried pickles which were different but very good. Overall a pretty filling meal if you're willing to buy a side to your meal. Otherwise you'll pay the price of a full meal ($13) and you probably won't be full with just the sandwich.
author: Samantha M.

description: I'd give it 3.5 stars but rounded up.  This is a quick service type of restaurant: walk up to the bar to order and they deliver it to you.  The sausages tasted good and was surprisingly not too oily IMO.  It was a little pricey ($12.50 for a sausage), so not a great value place.  Draft list had a good variety for the group that I was with.
author: Marc D.

description:
Excellent sausages. Small wine selection. Impressive beer selection. No-frills, limited food menu. 

Sausage sampler, soft pretzel, plus two glasses of wine: $66 before tip.
author: Kristen S.

description: A clean, modern bar that offers a wide selection of beer choices can never be a bad option for an afternoon or after word drink. The proprietor and the bartenders took a lot of time to help offer beer suggestions and offer samples before ordering a drink. This was nice as their beer menu was very extensive so looking at it got a little overwhelming. My partner and I also split the chips during our beer drinking adventures and were happy with the handmade morsels. With such a good experience, I can't wait to go back. The staff have definitely made me a believer in this casual bar.
author: Patrick G.

description:
Enjoyed a relaxed lunch with coworkers. Shared pretzel chips and roasted beets. All very tasty .  Their selection of beer and  non alcoholic drinks is inspiring. Lunch was a shared plate of their house made sausage and sides . The guys favored the habanero flavored links. Had to try the vegetarian Hogless sandwich as it too was a house inspired recipe. Nice mix but would have liked  the patty seared to add crunch.  Friendly and informative service. A great place to meet a client or friend. 
This is a YES for my fellow business Road Warriors.
author: Jane Q.

description:
Really nice local bar to get some great beers on draft. Came here on a Friday night to catch up with some friends and was impressed by the wide selection of beer options at this place -- a place that has 24 beers on draft is how you know that they're serious about their beers. 

They have an okay food menu - I wasn't a big fan of it but it looks decent. Mostly sausage sandwiches, salads, and some small bites. 

I got the Harmonic Kolsch and it was quite tasty. Overall, the prices here are really reasonable despite being so close to Union Square. Nice vibe and quite a chill place. Would recommend if you just want a casual drink or craft beer.
author: Jasmine X.

description:
Good sausages. Very nice staff. I guess ordering at the bar is becoming common in SF to keep staff costs down but we got or apps after our main course and our salad after that. Still 4 because Hogwash really worked to make things better. Comped salad (we really hadn't complained so much as answered honestly when asked how everything was) and I guess because we were good sports, rather than whiners, we were treated to a free yummy dessert. 

Good value, good food, great hospitality with a little awkwardness of presentation.
author: Kirk M.

description: Love this place! Great beer menu and awesome sandwiches. Right around the corner from the JW so a great spot to stop in after checking into your room. Friendly service and good atmosphere.
author: Michael C.

description: Have only gotten drinks here so far, but service is good and there is a solid beer menu.
author: Lillian B.

description: Excellent beer, top notch bar level food with a friendly chill/ hipster vibe. Would recommend and go back.
author: Giuseppe E.

description:
i came back a couple of months ago and had a good time. I'm not a big beer drinker, but they have a couple of good wines. I was pescatarian at that point in time so the veggie options were great! 

Kind of busy, but a good amount of space in the restaurant.
author: Nina Y.

description: Ryan is the best bartender ever. He is so helpful and friendly.  Also, the food is delicious. I really liked the Habanero Cesar salad. Spicy but tasty.
author: Tanya G.

description:
Hogwash is a pretty cool place to stop by for a beer connoisseur. Variety of beer on tap and the bartenders are knowledgeable and will recommend beers for you based on your likings. Beers by the pint are around $7-10. 

Beer places need to have food in my opinion. Hogwash has a german beer haus kind of food. We go the Wurst Fest and we really enjoyed the 4 different kind of sausage that was offered. 

The environment is really nice, it got real crowded around 6pm on a Monday night.
author: Jean K.

description:
My wife and I stumbled upon this delightful gastropub on our way out of the Union Square area and it was the best decision we could have made. The atmosphere is perfect with just dim enough lighting and an upscale, but not stuffy vibe. 
We headed straight to the bar where they had a ton of local beer on tap served by friendly bartenders. Shoutout to Scott who took great care of us!

The sausage sandwiches are the star here so we ordered the lamb one and the beef one and just split them both. They were super flavorful and fresh and definitely filling. We also got a side of fried pickles, which tasted good, but had a little too much batter for my taste. The sauce it's paired with more than makes up for it though. 

Overall, innovative ingredients and impressive menu and service. 

Resist the tourist traps and go to Hogwash. I know we'll be back!
author: Tyler G.

description:
eh, this place was just ok. I can see how it could get packed but when I came with some co-workers it was right before the evening rush and we were able to sit down quickly (first come, first served cafeteria-style seating). The hot pretzel was pretty good and the veggie sausage I got was just ok (it was dry with too many lentils IMO... I've definitely had better). Others at my table had the more traditional meat options which they seemed to really enjoy. The wine selection was relatively basic.

Overall it was a meh experience for me. I left filled, but not satisfied. On one hand I went to a restaurant called hogwash and chose the veggie options and wine (probably not the best move?).... but on the other hand they have veggie options on their menu and I would have hoped/expected that it tastes as good as their more inclusive meat options.

In either event - if you're a meat lover I'm sure you will love it. For me, not so much...
author: Ariel J.

description:
Great selection of beers and sausages.  They have whole grain mustard in a squeezy bottle on each table so I can unabashedly smother everything in it.
I'm not much of a beer drinker so I got the huckleberry cider.  Very drinkable and I got pretty tipsy off of it.  Double whammy.
We ordered the sausage sampler and the curry fries.  The sausage sampler gave you a taste of every sausage (except the veggie one) that they have on the menu/use in their other items.  It was well worth and enough to serve both of us.  The curry fries were great as well.  Perfect drunk food.
The service is fast and friendly and there was no wait on a Friday night.  Overall I would come here again.
author: Amy X.

description:
Life is stressful--- Thank god for Happy Hour! 

We arrived a few minutes before it opened but as soon as it hit 5 pm, we were seated promptly and given menus literally hot-off-the-press. That was pretty cool since it seems they refresh their beer offerings often.

=Curry fries with duck egg: 3.75/5 Not as much curry flavor as I expected but still tasty. Eat this fast because the fries get soggy pretty quickly.

=Wurstfest: 4.5/5 Everything they have on that platter is house-made (including the pickled veggies). Fresh and flavorful, I would recommend this!

=Fried housemade pickles: 3.5/5 Fried pickles aren't normally my jam but who doesn't love anything deep fried?

We ordered a bunch of beers and all were great. We ordered a Goblet and they ring this cowbell if you do ;D

Fun spot to hang out and have a great time!
author: Sylvia Y.

description: The bar had nice atmosphere but being that I was still working I came to grab a takeout order. I had the burning brock sausage sandwich and fried pickles. The brock was good it had spicy chicken sausages topped with pink slaw, apple slices, and fried avocado pieces. It was an interesting combo of flavors that mostly worked for me. I did knock off like half of the slaw for a better meat ratio but it was filling and certainly not short on meat. The pickles were my favorite part. Lots of house made pickles in a thick crunchy beer or tempura style batter with a good dipping sauce. Loved those things! Its a good spot ill have to return and join all the drunk bankers next time lol.
author: Sean G.

description: Burnin Brock paired with beer is a MUST!! Add in some of their mustard and your mouth will get all kinds of flavors! ALL KINDS!!!
author: Jake Jayzon L.

description:
Bf and I came here for a late lunch/ early dinner meal. I got the only vegetarian option and he opted beef bratwurst which came with bacon and overall the food was alright but the portion is rather sad. The sandwiches don't come with a side of anything so $12 per sandwich is rather extreme.

Would I come here again? NO!
author: Tenzing T.

description:
​House-made brats with an excellent, curated beer selection? Yes!

I've been here a few times while passing through and have never been disappointed. 

They have a broad selection of sausages, ​and they are all excellent. 

If you're in the area, then you need to stop by and have a bite and a brew.​
author: Felix C.

description:
Go early- and do some research on what you want- because while the menu is focused there is a wide variety.  This place fills up at night and it's tough to get your food if you don't want to wait.

Only one vegetarian option, but good.  The sausage also comes on salads as well.  

They have many beers on tap and some are good to pair with the sausages - so be sure to ask what works we'll with what you've ordered as the beer menu changes.

Venue is well decorated and the seating is bench or high top.  All comfy and suits the theme of the place.

Lastly, the spicy sausage isn't as habanero as you'd think, so experiment and try something new!
author: Aaron A.

description: Fantastic food. I had the Sheepish. You won't regret it. Between the savory lamb sausage, the tart pickled veggies, and the creamy saltiness of the blue cheese to tie it all together made for a spectacular dish. Stop thinking and just order.
author: Cristian S.

description: What a great find.  Delicious food, great tap list, nice atmosphere, vibe and friendly folks.  The Burnin' Brock and Swine Cookies & Cream were epic.  Cheers!
author: J B.

description:
Hogwash deserves 5 solid stars! 

After stumbling through downtown San Francisco, I found this gem hidden off Sutter on late Monday evening. Immediately upon walking in I loved the atmosphere. Rich woodwork, exposed brick, and modern light fixtures hanging from the high ceilings! Someone promptly greeted us at the front door and kindly welcomed us, then showed us to a table immediately There are community tables, which is great for groups or for starting conversation with those around. They also offer space at the bar and high top tables for two. 

Upon seating us, the host/waiter explained a little bit about the restaurant and gave us instructions on how to order. After perusing through the menu, we walked up to the bar to order our beer and food. They offered a variety of housemade sausage sandwiches with a unique twist. They also have an endless list of beers on tap. They happily offer samples so you can make the best choice! I went with a peanut butter stout, which had a unique taste and was something new. For food, I ordered the Abe Froman - This was fantastic! After telling the waiter we were from out of town, he surprised us with a dessert on the house. We devoured the Swine Cookies & Cream within minutes! This was a sweet ending to a great meal. 

If you are looking for a quaint atmosphere, great beer and food. Stop into Hogwash!
author: Shelby N.

description:
Needing a place to grab lunch for seven people by Union Square, we fortunately found Hogwash (well fortunate that we let Yelp guide us) for a great lunch.

We entered a little past 1 pm on Monday afternoon and we were able to grab the long community table right away. Place your order at the bar, take a seat, and wait for the deliciousness to be delivered to your table.

Food: I went with  the Burnin Brock sausage sandwich. Great combination of the spicy sausage, crunchy cabbage  and veggie toppings and the the fried pepper. The bread was soft and went very well with fillings. Served with a side of chips this was a great lunch for this weary traveler on a cold San Francisco afternoon.  The rest of our party ordered a variety of menu items and everyone was delighted with their food. They also have a number of great beers on tap to satisfy any taste.

Service: Good service but it was midday and the restaurant was empty as it was a little later in the afternoon. Staff was friendly, fast, and treated our party very well.

Atmosphere: Hard to gauge as we were just about the only group in the restaurant at the time but I liked the layout of the restaurant. We sat at one of the long table which worked great for our party and it was a very relaxing lunch.

Value: Pretty good value for a cool restaurant right off Union Square. The Sandwiches came with freshly made chips all for around $12. Add on a beer and you have a tasty lunch for around $20.

Overall: I would recommend Hogwash to anyone who wants inventive sausage meals that provide good value and large complement of craft beers!
author: Don N.

description:
We walk past here often and always wanted to stop in but it's usually pretty busy but one evening decided to brave the crowds as a snack and drink sounded like a great idea. It wasn't too bad that evening so we managed to get in and place an order. The drink menu is pretty expansive so there's a good range of options if you're picky.

We ordered the fried pickles (which was something I'd been dying to try for awhile) and the curry fries (which sounds delicious!) We grabbed a seat right at the window and soon both came out. The fries were crispy and the curry not overly spicy but just right. The fried pickles were definitely the winner for me though and it hurt my heart to leave two behind (I was full after eating almost all of them). They go perfectly with the harissa aioli but are also delicious on their own. Paired up with a beer or cider and I was in heaven. 

I'm glad this place is right nearby and I'm happy to stop by again for more drinks and food. They have several options for sausage on a bun including a vegetarian one, so I can definitely count on coming back to check it out.
author: Cassandra J.

description: This place it great. Good food and good beer. It feels much less touristy than most of the places you'll find near Union Square. My friends and I met at 5:30pm before a 7pm performance at SF Playhouse and it worked out perfectly. I'll definitely be back.
author: Cierra C.

description: This place is awesome! On a trip to San Francisco,  we went to this place daily! Ryan was the best bartender! Drinks and food are on point!
author: Heather Q.

description: I was in SF on business and this place caught my eye on the way back to my hotel.  They have an amazing beer selection.  I had a hard time deciding what to drink and they were happy to let me sample a few choices to make my decision easier.  I got a sausage that came with an egg on top and although it was messy, it was oh so delicious. On top of that I got a bread pudding dessert that was absolutely wonderful.  I can't wait till my next business trip to stop here again.
author: Kailey S.

description:
3.5 stars :)

Easygoing vibe and a great place to hang out with friends or go on a date.  You order everything at the bar on your own, at your own pace.  Conveniently located near Union Square

- Roasted Beets w/goat cheese: Standard flavor, but excellent texture of the beets.  Had more of a bite, as opposed to the super soft or soggy texture that can sometimes happen.
- Double-fried French Fries - crispy of course!  You can taste the extra layer of fat dripping down the back of your throat, haha.  Delicious, but honestly didn't blow me away.
- All-day Sausage sandwich:  Pork sausage topped w/a fried duck egg.  Good, but wouldn't bring me back for it again.  Could have been juicier and more flavorful.
- Hogless sandwich:  I'm not a huuuge veg fan, and hate it even more when I have to pay the same price as a meat item....but damn they make a good lentil/garbanzo sausage.  Really flavorful, and balanced by a creamy white sauce and pickled onions.  I'd get it again!
author: Mon T.

description: Very lovely, helpful employees made this place most memorable. Dimly lit place... very clean. We ordered the burnin brock with a pretzel roll and crisps. Was yummy. Just coming from a German sausage garden that specialised in meat and kraut made it tough for this place to compare, but I still liked it. The parking was the biggest headache of all. Worth it if you can walk to it, though. Good price for what you get.
author: Attosa C.

description:
Surprisingly, they had great vegetarian options! My food was really delicious and my friend said hers was great, too. The staff was really friendly and accommodating, food came out pretty quickly, and our drinks were great.

Vegetarians, don't be scared off by a place purporting to be all about pork. Food was great!
author: Marcella D.

description: Ordered a take out last week. It taste better then it looks. I had the lamb meat sausage sandwich, very juicy meat and taste great! Will be back in the future.
author: Zill K.

description: This place is awesome. 30 craft beers on tap. Limited, but awesome food menu. Small wine selection. Ordered Ana All Day and Hogless. I love the All Day. My wife said the Hogless is the best sausage she has ever had. The staff is very friendly. I plan on coming back.
author: Scott A.

description:
Came here on a whim with my friend since I was getting hangry and the reviews definitely impressed me. I had the all-day, some fries, and the roasted beets.

I loved the sausage! The roll was soft and fresh, the sausage was warm and tasted great, and the egg. The egg on top was PERFECT! The fries were also terrific and tasted amazing (probably because they're double-fried). The beets were alright -- the ones we had were rather bitter and the goat cheese didn't really improve the taste that much.

My friend had the meatless, and seemed to enjoy it pretty well! The drinks are a fair price, considering the neighborhood with a pretty healthy selection available.

Food: 5/5
Staff: 4/5
Atmosphere: 4/5
Value: 3/5
Overall: 4/5
author: Evan K.

description: We stayed the weekend in San Francisco for a girls getaway. We repeatedly came back to Hogwash to see Ryan. This place has good food, good service and an amazing vibe. Can't wait to visit this city again and come back.
author: Kristal T.

description:
I dig this gastropub.

The reasoning is simple. The atmosphere is conducive to both fun and relaxation, and both food and drink quality are great.

The spot is casual but well kept - a rectangular room with a few tables to seat smaller parties and then large benches where multiple groups can share. You may get chummy with the stranger next to you if you're seated at the benches, which I suppose fosters the communal feel, although my preference is still to have more personal space.

There's a fairly extensive list of beer and less so for wine. If you're not a beer drinker, than perhaps you'd be less appreciative of their alcohol selection. As for the grub, all sandwiches came out piping hot with juicy and fat sausages. I had the beef sausage sandwich, which had simple favors. I mean simple in the best way possible, which I felt, show cased the quality of the ingredients.

Friendly servers made it a sweet night.
author: Cici T.

description: Surprisingly not as many good bars in this neighborhood as you'd think. This is an oasis for mid-level fancyness bar seekers in the neighborhood. Def. recommend.
author: Jonah K.

description:
Meh... very average, but be skeptical of this review  since I don't like small noisy spots, or beer.  Also, A/C is probably a must..? 

Why go? giant beer mug might have something to do with this!
author: Marianna K.

description: Good food and good beer!  What more can I say.  The lamb sausage was excellent.  I will return!
author: Chris S.

description: This place is super-hipster, but in a good way. The staff are friendly, the beer selection is fantastic (lots of stuff I've never had before), and the food is really unique and dee-lish. There are two TVs over the bar if you feel like watching a game, but they're not gaudy and obtrusive. This place fills up on weekend evenings though, so arrive early to ensure you get a seat. This will definitely be a staple for me when visiting San Francisco from now on.
author: David K.

description: Cozy atmosphere, good place to meet with friends. The beer list is superb. The only downside is that the sausage sandwiches themselves are a bit overpriced for what they are.
author: Maria J.

description:
The Bomb great place to visit service was awesome
Food was awesome!!! The pork chop was amazing!!!
author: Dan N.

description: This is a great stop for a quick bite that is quality food without breaking the bank in Union Square. I had the lamb sausage sandwich ($12.50) and a craft beer ($7). The service was not friendly but the food was excellent.
author: Mary F.

description: This was a great find, the barbecue was amazing and even though we didn't have the chicken, having it served to the people next to us was quite the experience. The wine and liquor list is extensive and the people are very keen to giving you the perfect tip for a pairing, even if you end up buying a hard cider to go with your ribs.
author: Santiago A.

description:
delicious fresh yummy food
friendly staff 
clean 
STRANGE decor with emphasis on sex sex sex sex nudity sex sex and sex
not a family place 
for straight men more likely???
author: Jeene L.

description:
I've been to Hogwash twice in the past two days as a pre and post dinner spot. The beer selection is good, not amazing but there's a decent amount of variety with a little something for everyone. They even had a few sours and barrel-aged beers from craft breweries around the country. There were a number of places I didn't really recognize so it's a great way to try something new. 

The high tops and communal tables are reserved for people who order food so both times we got some dessert or an appetizer. The rest of their food is kind of singular in that it's primarily sausages and while they look amazing, sometimes you just want something different. 

On to the food:

Fried Cookie dough w/ Three Twins Vanilla Ice Cream (5 stars!): Amazing! The cookie dough balls are a tad small for my own preference but have great flavor with the mix of the bacon, pecans, and chocolate. Grab a little bit of the cookie dough with a spoonful of the ice cream and you're in heaven. If any other ice cream were used with this dish, I really don't think it'd be as good. The use of whole Madagascar vanilla beans instead of vanilla extract definitely adds a whole other dimension to the flavors to this ice cream. I would come to Hogwash just for this dessert- seriously, no joke. 

Bread Pudding (4 stars): Also a quite good. The bread pudding is flavorful and contains a few different textures with the crunch of the pecans (which they don't mention on the menu), the gooeyness of the caramel, and the fluffiness of the bread. This dessert comes out warm and could also pair excellently with a scoop of vanilla ice cream if it were an option. 

Fried Pickles (4 stars): Some of my coworkers specifically seek out fried pickles and these ones don't disappoint. They come out fresh from the fryer and have a nice crunch and tanginess from the pickles. The sauce that it's paired with also has a slight kick in flavor so it's great to just dunk in a slice. 

All in all, I'm quite happy with my two experiences. Even if we were "forced" to order food so we could sit at a high top, I walked out completely satisfied both times. =D
author: Liza X.

description: Super cool place to hang out.  My husband and I were passing through and wanted to grab a few drinks.  We order had some great beer and left.  Ended up coming back because the next place wasn't nearly as good.  Had a few more drinks and some food.  Food was great, beer was great as were the people.  Will definitely go back next time we are in town.
author: Whitley J.

description: Fun spot.  Sausages are awesome.  Nice beers.  Grt the beef and bacon sausage.  Double cooked fries - skip.
author: Jim M.

description:
Goblets of beer & assortment of sausage and bun. Need I say more?

Upon entering the door, I see three beer consumers by the window each with their own goblet. My initial thoughts: what is THAT? After being told there was a wait for a table, I was lucky to swap two seats by the bar. Apparently, the goblets are 40-50 oz each and that was way too much liquid for me in one sitting. I opted for a pint of the Heif and was satisfied with how it complimented  the Burnin Brock. And note, all spicy lovers, Burnin Brock is your sausage. Deep fried avocado and habanero sauce which chicken-induced sausage leads to a delectable creation. Would come back. Lowkey reminds me of Mikkeler bar nearby.
author: Carissa G.

description:
This place gets very packed, considering it's a relatively small place. My friend and I came on a Friday night and instead of having to wait probably an hour for a table, we were able to snag a seat at the bar instantaneously. 

Very cool place! They offer a 55 ounce cup of beer! It was tempting but seemed like a lot of beer at the moment. We ordered the curry fries and the burnin brock sausage sandwich. The curry fries were good, although I wish it was a bit more flavorful. Similar consistency as gravy. The burnin brock was excellent! The sausage was so spicy and very good. I liked all the toppings too, especially the fried avocado. Definitely would come back for another sausage sandwich and the 55 oz beer.
author: Annie H.

description: Very nice gastropub in downtown SF. I just went for the beer so can't comment about the food, but it sure looked tasty. They have a extensive tap list, with beers from all over, with a higher concentration of west coast breweries.
author: Sudipto G.

description: This restaurant/bar was so amazing last night when Brynn served me that I returned today for lunch and brews. Ryan's service was so outstanding that for a second I wish I lived in San Francisco. Even when people started strolling (lunch time) in he was attentive and gave me options for my taste buds. I was also pleased to find out they have a vegetarian sausage sandwich on their menu. Ryan was very friendly to all the customers and I am looking forward to my next visit to SF. It's also refreshing to know that in the midst of SF he is a diehard Dodger fan!  Yay!
author: Dee G.

description:
Server was very helpful with questions about selections and super friendly. Bartenders were friendly as well. 
Smaller spot but Very relaxed atmosphere and it was easy to hear in there. Curry fries were a little salty in my opinion but the sauce they make was tasty.
author: Hannah P.

description: I got Abe froman and it destroyed my desire for hot dog forever. Super heavy and salty. I didn't feel I was eating hot dog. It was just a very oily and salty protein. I couldn't finish it and even I could I would rather not.
author: Hana H.

description: Food was really underwhelming. Skip the sausage and go straight for three or four of the killer Firebrand pretzel rolls with mustard and house pickles. Very comprehensive beer selection, but they will only serve you the size listed on the menu, which seemed kind of strange to me. Overall, nice non-touristy spot close to union square.
author: Adrienne K.

description:
Yum!  A group of us stopped here on a busy Friday night, and we were luckily able to be seated immediately.  We were starting to get hangry, and this was the perfect place for us to grab some delicious sandwiches and a beer.

Beer lovers, rejoice!  This place has a ton of great beers on tap.  They will even let you try one if you can't decide.  We immediately received our appetizers after ordering- fried pickles and french fries.  Both were delicious.  The fried pickles weren't soggy like I've had in the past, but the batter on them was nice and crispy.  The fries cured my hangriness, and were equally delicious.

The sausages were surprisingly good!  I've never been a HUGE fan of sausage, but put it on a fresh roll with yummy toppings, and apparently I'm a fan!  The one I had was a little spicy, and I think I would've liked the breakfast one better.

My only complaint is having to order at the bar.  Maybe that's just because I'm lazy, but I hated being seated only to find out I had to go place an order and make a decision about leaving my card open or closed at the beginning.  I probably would've ordered more beer if I had a waitress and didn't have to go back to the bar.  Oh well- the food was totally worth it!
author: Meg W.

description: Great little spot close to Union Square! We had their Wurstfest sampler of house-made sausages and pickled veggies, which was just phenomenal. It's a lot more than you think! Also had a great sample of beers, which changes all the time so just find what you like and roll with it. They're great about giving you samples of any beer, so try them! We'll be back for sure, it's a nice spot. Heard a lot about the curry fries, but we had no room for them! Next time...
author: Dave S.

description: Neat atmosphere and polite staff. Judging by food and atmosphere alone, I would give it 3 stars, but the beer list earned it another star. Good selection of IPAs, sours, and variety of other things with some "local" focus. The food menu looks good, but spicy chicken sausage sandwich wasn't anything to write home about.
author: Nikola I.

description: This place is awesome! It's small with various options to sit. I like the fact that when they are all booked up they sit you with other people definitely family style! I love that part because it gives people the opportunity to mingle and meet new people! I ordered a habanero Caesar salad and added sausage and an egg on top! So bomb! They have a lot of options as far as beer on tap and a good wine selection!
author: Laura C.

description:
Great gastropub/beer bar! 

We wanted a quick bite and drinks before heading out of the city. It was a Sunday night so most restaurants were closed (something we're not used to being from Vegas.) Found that this spot was open and kinda near a BART Station so it was a win-win.

It's right across of The Color Factory and would be a great stop for some drinks after. 

Menu is not too big but still stacked with a lot of great options. All orders must be placed and paid for at the bar. 

We ordered the CURRY FRIES and the ALL DAY sandwich to share. For drinks, I started with the Mexican coke (a bit pricey at $4) and he opted for a beer. 

I recommend both dishes. They tasted great and big enough to share. They double fry their fries which is the best thing ever. Nothing better than perfectly crispy fries. The curry fries did not get soggy at all despite being smothered in sauce. 

Hogwash would be a great place for date night or for food and drinks with friends.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
I've ended up at Hogwash several times before heading out to evening activities in San Francisco. Whether you're rushing in and out or lingering at the bar, my experiences here have been great. Lots of varied seating accommodations, not too loud despite an open floor plan, and solid food and beverage suggestions.

Not to be prudish, but I'd say my one gripe is the gratuitous nudie portrait on the back wall. Kinda clashes with the rest of the decor, and I'm not entirely sure what the management's getting at.
author: Joe M.

description: The meal we had was good I had the habenero chicken sausage which was really tasty and not as spicy as you might think.  The beer selection was good and the fries were good.  The service was good you go to the bar to other then they bring it to your table.  I would go again if ever in San Francisco.
author: Susan R.

description: An amazing twist to a sausage, we were in love as soon as we arrived for our late nate rendezvous. I would highly recommend and when the opportunity arises, we will find our way back
author: peter r.

description:
Will admit, we choose the place based off of it's name. Location-based search, of course, but when the name showed up and 'gastropub' we were sold. And we were NOT disappointed.
It was a late lunch and we got lucky and stumbled in before they closed for a few hours. Even though they were closing shortly, we still fell welcomed and the bartender was kind and helpful. We didn't even notice that they were closing until everyone else left....
It was adorable and quaint. LOADS of draft beers to choose from. I told the bartender that I like less hoppy beers and he made an excellent suggestion. We both ordered their special - Shrimp and Andouille Sausage. It. Was. AWESOME. The presentation was SO pretty. Not something you'd expect from a 'gastropub'. It also tasty yummy, too. And it included a plate of home made potato chips, which were excellent. Not greasy, just the right amount of crisp, and the perfect side for our yummy dish.

I don't usually mention veggies - but we were served PICKLED GREEN BEANS. Green Beans. Pickled. Holy super yummy surprise in your mouth, Batman!!!

If you're in the area, I highly recommend you give this one a try. Of course, if you're not into sausages (I believe all are home made) or beer then this probably isn't the place for you. If you're into that stuff then this IS a place you should try.

Why are you still reading this? Hit the map up and go find it...... just go!
author: Sharron G.

description:
Ryan (bartender beyond awesome), this one goes out to you--I've never attempted karaoke in my life, but will briefly sing your and Hogwash's praises, to the tune of many, many other fans.

I didn't expect to fall so hard for a meat-heavy menu. As a lifelong vegetarian, no, I have no real idea what I'm missing. But, years of enjoying veggie stand-ins has taught me that if a restaurant puts care and creativity into a solid veggie option--one that fewer people are likely to order--you can count on them for almost everything else.

Hogwash falls into this category, and manages a solid 10 landing.

Their vegetarian "Hogless" sausage is creative and addictively crispy on the outside, thanks to the crackly coating of polenta (?) and lentils (?). It doesn't pretend to be anything it's not, such as a dining partner's delicious (so they tell me) "Sheepish" lamb sausage. Instead, it's hearty without feeling healthy, and generously topped with condiments that run the gamut of textures and tastes: pickled cabbage, wispy frisee, smoked creme fraiche. I thought this was sufficient. Then, I discovered the table-side homemade mustard and spicy-ish ketchup (essentially). It was like the difference between a 4.0 and a 5.0 GPA--so good that my dining partner regularly eats the other half...

And the beer...! I've tried several options, and liked every one, but keep coming back to the Hefeweizen or Weizenbock. Not an expert, so won't pretend to wax eloquent here. But hearing the cowbell ring every time someone orders a particularly ginormous glass of beer just adds to the generally cheerful mood. 

Don't miss:

-The herb roasted beets. They've endured an intriguing pickling and roasting pilgrimage to reach your plate, and are perfectly offset by the creamy goat cheese and crunchy herb (thyme?) leaves.

-The seasonal salad. I'm not a fan of salad dressing in general, but learned to appreciate the way it brings flavors together (especially when it's the ever-excellent fresh peach dressing). I never miss a change to order it.

-Ryan, naturally, always in good cheer, fantastic with beer recommendations and conversation.

-Occasional Chuck Berry album playing.
author: Midori Y.

description: Wow!!! That was interesting...... in a GOOD way!! Very different but very good. Reasonably priced, lots of great beer on tap, no nonsense staff, AND reasonably priced. Highly recommended.
author: Eric M.

description:
Great joint for hot dogs and a solid beer list up on Sutter on a stretch where good food options get a little bit few and far between. That's probably why it can be kind of a pain in the neck to get a seat. If you're in a group bigger than two, prepare yourselves to share picnic tables with a neighbor. (That's not so bad. They're nice folks.) 

Prices are reasonable -- not cheap, not outrageous. 

The menu changes semi-frequently, but the range of beer is pretty great and I haven't gone wrong with any of the sausages. "Abe Froman" is a favorite. The vegan one's solid, too. Skip the fries unless you've got a real hankering; they're salty, a serving isn't super-big, and you're better served leaving extra room for more sausages. 

Another small piece of advice? If you're looking for a change of venue, you can order at Hogwash and take your number next door to PCH if cocktails (and dogs) are more your speed. You do you. (Plus, it's back up in case you lose the seat lottery at Hogwash.) 

Another big piece of advice? Any of the hot dogs that include deep-fried avocados are great. It's not on the menu, but you can order deep-fried avocado by the basket and it's... REAL good. 

tl;dr version: it's good, skip the fries, get deep-fried avocado.
author: Jim M.

description: Open for lunch, great selection of Wurstfest Sausage Plate, with pickled veggies & Kraut. Friendly staff Brynn helped me with Sour beer selection, landed on Victory Sour Money Wild Ale from Downington PA, next fav Calicraft Sour Zinfandel from Walnut Creek
author: Aloha M.

description: Excellent selection of craft beer and homemade sausage. Abe Froman, beef, cheddar & bacon sausage is heavenly! Excellent service from the bartender. Perfect spot for lunch!
author: Jim S.

description: Great sandwiches, good beer, and amazing bartenders. A good place to dip in for lunch
author: Ray B.

description: Love this place!! Best hot dog / sausage place in town. My favorite dish is the sheepish! The beers are amazing and the recommendations by the bartenders are superb. The bartenders are super friendly as well!
author: Yumou G.

description: Great place for beer and food! The appetizers pair wonderfully with the selection of beer and wine they have. Check it out if you are looking for a great time!
author: Dustin W.

description: Been here twice (both times during lunch) already and the food is pretty good.  Definitely need to come back for dinner service.  Really good beer and wine selections.
author: Patrick C.

description:
Excellent. We review it on yelp then came on in for lunch, we were disappointed that the items we had picked were on the dinner menu... BUT the nice bartender/waitress arranged for us to have what they could prepare from the dinner menu. 

I am certainly coming here again and bringing friends. 

We had pretzel bread, sausage platter, chips, and the Cobb salad. All great!
author: Steven W.

description:
I was focused on food, not beer.  Had the sausage plate, with four kinds of artisan sausage, and also ordered a pretzel loaf.  Pretzel loaf was amazing, and a couple of the sausages were very good, the other two were good.

Not much seating as others have said - I had a small table in the bar area.  I did not like that I had to go to the bar to order, and leave my credit card to run a tab for my meal.  When I was done I had to go to the bar to close out my tab and pay.  Being as the bar area flowed directly in to the small dining area, with no walls or obstructions between them, I think there should have been table service by the wait staff, as there was a distance of four feet from my table to the dining area tables.
author: Stewart G.

description: Friendly hip place for unique house made sausage sandwiches and salads. Extensive tap selection with some rare regional selections.
author: John L.

description:
5 stars for the food
5 stars for services
4 stars for the ambiance
