Stop by this place for lunch with my significant other. I was craving for hot dogs/sausages and was lucky to find this place via Yelp near by. Service was great, since its our first time the person taking our order recommended some of the popular items on the menu to us. The place is really nice. Great seating and lighting. The ambiance is really nice. 

We end up ordering...
Firebrand Warm Pretzel Roll. It was a nice appetizer indeed. Noting to rave about but I do like their in-house pretzel. Perfect enough salt dripped with their house mustard sauce. 

For the housemade sausage sandwiches. I ordered the Abe Froman and my significant other ordered the All Day. It is SO GOOD. I definitely got my sausage fix cover. Can't wait to come back and try other items on the menu. It was perfectly cooked and the flavor was all there . Must top the meal off with a beer of course.
author: May N.

description: Limited menu of sausage sammies. But try them all. Serious. The lamb was out of this world. Beers to pair them with. Good bar area to hang out and just have s beer as well. Loved it.
author: Lochin S.

description:
I've found that I'm motivated to leave a review when the experience is bad. Hogwash is worthy of taking to time to leave a good review.  

It starts with then staff. The bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable. They know their beer. 

This place is cool, laid back, and worthy of a positive review.
author: Brian T.

description:
I ate here twice in very different circumstances. The first time I had a quiet weekday lunch of the most fantastic lamb sausage sandwich - The Sheepish. The sausage was fantastic, yet it broke my heart that the bun was microwaved rendering it doughy and damp. I was so disappointed because it wouldn't have been much more trouble to put the bun on the grill! Please stop abusing the bread! I heard the microwave door opening and shutting repeatedly - no excuse for microwaving bread.
I came back on active evening   - the beer selections are great! Fantastic even! The dining room was packed and it was very, very noisy. With a probably drunk crowd like that, there might not be so much discernment about the food - still, I have to say that I had one of the better side dishes I've ever had in my life! The roasted beets were lemony with fresh thyme - fantastic. I had the special with pork sausage - I have to say that they really nail sausage here. But the black-eyed peas that were served as a side dish were semi-cooked. Sad. When I pointed it out, the person at the bar happily refunded me half of the entree price.
author: Patricia S.

description:
Great food. Could hardly finish my wonderful
meal. Be sure to drop by anytime you are in San Fran.
author: Ed Z.

description: Great pork. Great pork. Great pork! Sausages were out of this world, and plenty of beer selections to keep anyone happy!
author: Eric J.

description:
Beer and sausage, beer and sausage......plus a few others things.

They have a big beer selections. I tried a few different flavors of the blonds and ale's, great stuff.

They menu consists of a few apps and like sausages with some unique meats. Each hot dog or sausage sandwich has unique and creative flavors on top. 

I was here with two of my friends and we got a few of the sausages to share. I forgot the specific names of the ones we got but all were tasty and opened my eyes on how creative sausage sandwiches can be.
author: Tim R.

description: Excellent! They have a great sausage sandwich. Super fresh tasting and the sausage is quality! Oddly enough I thought their table hot sauce was the difference maker. Super good, and a great beer selection. Chill and minimal gastro vibe. I'd come back!
author: Derek G.

description: Nice place to grab a drink and sit with friends. They have a huge selection of drinks and the workers are super friendly. Also a really clean bathroom (always a plus, especially in San Francisco where a clean bathroom is rare!)
author: Danica F.

description:
The food was decent. The portion of curry fries we received was pretty sad, but it's San Francisco and I paid $4 for a shitty black & white cookie down the street, so, whatever.

The sampler plate would have been cool if the gross sheep sausage wasn't involved. Would try the sandwich with the fried avocado wedge if I go back.
author: David D.

description:
Hogwash is one of my gotos in the city for good beer and good food. This should not be passed up, it's excellent.

The sausages are excellent, though there is plenty of competition in the city at similar bars. Abe Froman is my favorite if I had to choose just one. Fries are excellent but the fried pickles are a real gem. Do not pass them by unless you dislike pickles, and if so I'm sorry.

Beer rotates frequently but the selection is balanced and there is always a solid number of excellent choices. Come early if you want to sit down.
author: Jim S.

description: The beer selection of pretty balanced on the types but I think there might be a room for improvement. The fact that you are being seated and then someone needs to go and place the order seems a bit odd and inconvenient to be honest... we tried a few of their appetizers which were good! The pretzel was actually a pretzel loaf and not its classic shape. Also I wish they had some meat appetizer option and not just in the sandwiches or a whole plate of sausages (I think that was an option) everything else was great and I chuckled over their lettering on the back wall! Love a place with a bit of wit!
author: Ketie A.

description:
Review is on service and food, didn't have any of the beers. 

Came here on Saturday, December 30 after a comedy show downtown. Promptly were seated by very kind hostess. We opted to sit at the bar since it looked comfy.

Bartender Brynn was incredible. She provided us with a perfect mix of attentiveness, service, kindness, and conversation. I really felt taken care of by her!

My fiance got the burnin brock which he loved. We split he 2x fried fries. and I got the hogless. The BEST part of the night was when I had my fiance try my sandwich (he resisted since he usually is against eating my vegetarian fare). He LOVED it ! he said that my sandwich was better than his! I was so stoked. I also loved my meal. If I lived in SF I would be getting this food all the time. 

Thanks for a great experience Hogless and Brynn - I really appreciate it!
author: Lizzy D.

description: Had the Abe Froman and wife had the Cobb salad. Both very good. Service was great and really made you feel special.  Good beer selection as well.
author: Dennis R.

description: Surprisingly not busy at lunch in the downtown district, but people don't tend to migrate up if they're hanging by the cable cars. They've got a lot of beer and meat up for grabs. It's actually a great space to meet a group of people for lunch or even maybe a working casual lunch.
author: Theresa D.

description:
After a disappointing meal, we found when we expressed our discontent with the owner, part of the meal was comped (what the kids didn't eat). I received a message from the owner re: my yelp review. I appreciate him reaching out to me & asking how he can make it better.

The vibe was good, wish we would have liked the food more. But I'm pleased with the customer service.
author: Leah L.

description:
If you're a fan of sausages, this place is for you! The sausages are juicy and moist. You can definitely taste the difference between this and the store-bought kind.

Must get:
* Curry Fries: Hogwash fries smothered in curry + duck egg
* All Day Sandwich: Pork breakfast sausage, maple, ginger, arugula topped with a sunny side up fried duck egg

YUM. Anything here with duck egg is delicious.

Service:
* Super speedy. 
* You order at the cashier near the kitchen and they bring it to you once it's ready.
author: Jenny H.

description:
I'm not a huge sausage/hog dog lover, but the promise of curry fries lured me into Hogwash. Of course, I had to get an order of curry fries, and added a duck egg, natch. The fries were perfectly crispy and the curry sauce had just a hint of spiciness. The egg was delicious as well, but what's up with duck eggs everywhere?? They're basically the same thing as chicken eggs! My mom and I split the All Day (breakfast sausage + duck egg) and the Cali Club (chicken/bacon sausage + lettuce, tomato and avo) which were both really good. Again, sausages aren't my favorite food so I didn't think it was the best thing I've ever eaten, but I still really enjoyed it. Actually, what I really liked was the Almanac Meyer Lemon Gose which was light, refreshing and fruity. Perfect for a non-beer drinking, lightweight like me!

Service was great. The hostess was super sweet and you order everything at the bar. I would recommend Hogwash for happy hour or a casual dinner after some shopping at Union Square!
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Man Damn. This has become one of my favorite places to eat in the city. I have to drive to Union Square once a week from Marin and every time, I stop in for some great beer and even better food. Staff is great, beer selection is awesome (changes often) and the sausages/sandwiches are incredible. Oh. The beets are pretty ridiculous too. Just wish they had the currywurst during the day for lunch. 
Cheers!
author: Chris T.

description:
I came here for a few drinks two days in a row during my last trip to San Francisco. I came in mostly because of the name and it was also really close to the hotel where I was staying. I came back the second night to celebrate a little after running the San Francisco Marathon in the morning.

*Almanac Vanilla Cherry Sour*
This was a very good tasting sour. Nice and tart!

*High Water Stella Blue Sour*
I got this per the recommendation of the bartender. It was not bad, but it wasn't as good as the Almanac.

*Altamont Maui Waui IPA nitro*
I liked this beer since it's made with Citra and Mosaic hops. It's got a good hint of tropical fruit flavors. Having it on nitro just makes it better.

*Curry fries with fried duck egg and pork sausage*
The fries were a bit hard and crispy for my preference, but it had a good taste with the curry. Adding the fried duck egg and pork sausage made it more of a meal and definitely improved the fries.

*Harmonic Kölsch*
Nice refreshing beer. This style of beer is growing on me.

If you want a better dining experience and service, I would suggest finding a seat at the bar. Otherwise you will have to walk up to the counter to place your order each time you want something. The bartenders are nice and knowledgeable about their drinks.
author: Emil C.

description: Very good food and friendly service, stopped in for a late night dinner while visiting SF, had a sausage sandwich of course, and it was delicious.  They also have a full bar and some interesting beers on tap, so tried a few drafts as well.  Everyone in my party of 6 enjoyed their food which is a testament, though we were all tired from a long day of exploring and didn't spend much time here.  But I will definitely try to stop back in when I'm in the area.
author: Douglas W L.

description: Stumbled upon this place after trekking down the crazy San Francisco hills. I had the Burning Bock and a local beer that i can't remember. The portions were large and the meal was delicious!!! Spicy yet flavorful, and the beer was good too. Definitely recommend this place for a quick, unique bite of food.
author: Colleen S.

description: One of my favorite places in SF.  I travel there frequently and am generally at one of the hotels nearby and have found this to be one of my favorite watering holes.  Excellent beer selection and the sausages never cease to amaze me.
author: Chris M.

description:
Ok so hubby and I were looking for a place for a quick bite with some good beer and we found this place Yelp, close to Union Square.  We decided to give it a try, and it was a great choice.  
The place is smallish, with trendy decor and country music.  The woman serving us was cheerful, friendly and helpful. The beer selection is terrific, about 30 on draft.  Hubby had the Hog Cobb, the chicken sausage in that salad was stunning.  I ordered the roasted beets and the barley salad (too much sausage over the fourth to face another so soon), and both dishes were great!! The beets were pickled with a spicy brine, then roasted  and served warm with a warm goat cheese & herb dip.  Truly one of the best beet dishes I've ever had!  The barley salad was yummy, with diced fresh veggies and a spicy lemon vinaigrette.  Delish!  Highly recommend for lovers of beer, handmade sausage and fiery food!
author: Alison M.

description:
Two tourists searching Yelp to find something "different" to try in SF... and we stumble on Hogwash. We are pork lovers (sausages, ribs, brisket, you name it, if it Oinks we eat it). So it was a no brainer... pork and 5 stars from Yelpers, lets get Uber and go, a 10 minute ride from the marina district to Union Square.

The place is small, but smartly decorated, with a long bar with about 30 handles for different beers and many tables. 

Basically there are NO WAITERS.. yep, you select what you want (food and drinks), go the bar and order it, and in about 10 minutes they bring it to your table. Efficient!

We ordered the following:

- Wurstfest: four different house made sausages (total of 6 links), a bit expensive at $31, but the flavors and spices were unique, I was impressed.

- Curry fries with a duck egg on top: very tasty, the duck egg is a nice finish on those tasty potatoes.

Here are the brews we tried, all excellent:
- Dale's Pale Ale
- Hofbrau Helles lager
- Two Rivers Apple Cider

Desert: The swine sundae (vanilla ice cream, crispy bacon, bourbon stout caramel sauce)

For hog lovers this is the place. It also has a fun atmosphere, service is ok (but not spectacular), prices are fair.

Recommended!
author: Alexandre H.

description:
As a vegetarian and a wine lover, its safe to say that I was pretty skeptical about a beer bar that specializes in hot dogs...but Hogwash 100% surprised me!! On a Saturday afternoon, this was the perfect place to escape the cold, eat some good food and watch NBA All-Star Festivities!! 

Ambiance: Small place, with a lot of communal tables. Can get loud but not so loud that you cannot carry a conversation. Don't be surprised if you end up sharing your table with a few different parties! Once seated, both food and beer orders are placed up at the bar! 

Service:  The staff here are so sweet and are more than willing to talk about their different beers! The waiter stopped by our table several times to check on us and just to say hi! 

Food: Since we came mid-afternoon, we stuck with fries and beer, and these fries hit the spot! Make sure to ask for a side of their chipotle aioli, it makes all the difference! I plan on coming back to try their sausages - it is so rare to find a gourmet sausage restaurant with a vegetarian option! The group next to us was also raving about their curry fries, yum! 

As far as the beer goes, I am usually one to stick with a lighter ale, however I even surprised myself by ordering a stout this time around. I HIGHLY recommend the Belching Beaver PB Stout, it was so creamy and had great chocolate/coffee notes!
author: Alyssa P.

description:
Had lunch at Hogwash in mid-December after dropping family off at SFO and spending a few days in the City.  We hit at just the right time, no wait and the bartender said we could sit anywhere.  We opted for a table for 2 across from the bar.  

The Mister had the Abe Froman and a Huckleberry Cider.  His sandwich was delish and not dry as other reviewers had mentioned.  I sampled his Huckleberry Cider and it was crisp, sweet and tasty.  I had the butter lettuce cob salad and a Mexican Coke.   The salad was very good, if a little hard to eat since the Bib lettuce was not chopped but whole leaves.  The sausage and quail eggs where perfectly cooked.  Food and drinks came quick and we were in and out in about 45 minutes and $50 bucks later.  

Hogwash is on my list of go back places next time we are in the City.
author: Beth A.

description:
The name about sums it up.

Food was bland and ill textured. I was not impressed by the offerings on menu but was less impressed after tasting them. My Abe Froman sausage was tough and flavorless. It tasted of grease and beef. I felt like I was eating a hamburger ground up into a sausage- not in a good way. 

Dessert was just okay. Swine cookies were passable. The ice cream was the best part of the whole meal. Disappointed to pay for parking, trek it here for there.
author: Rae I.

description:
Absolutely delicious! The burnin' brick sausage sandwich may be the best sausage sandwich I've had! It has the right amount of spice, freshness, sauce & crisp! It has chicken habanero sausage, harissa aioli, fried avacado, pickled cabbage, fresh fennel & apple... It's so delicious!

We also had th curry fries with fried duck egg & sausage. Also delicious and great for sharing. Would get it as a side to share (it's a large portion) absolutely delicious! The fries are perfectly crispy. I recommend the spicy sausage 

They have local drinks, it's a chill atmosphere, great for some food/drinks with friends
author: Rose H.

description: Such a awesome place the beer , the pretzel, the curry fries are so good. Came here for late nite eating and I was very happy .
author: Raven L.

description:
The place is not crowd that day so we decided to stop by. We ordered Holiday Special and Burnin Brock. 
Really satisfied with the Holiday Special's sausage. It was pretty good and juicy. The mushroom sauce is perfect with the green bean. Little bit plain with bread pudding. 
It was so so for Burnin Brock. 
In additional this place got good music! :)
author: Tanta V.

description: Hogwash is a cool little place located generally downtown.  The beer selection here is particularly good, a nice mix of lighter fare (Gose!) and heavier (QUADRUPEL!) options, all with great service, some fun pig decor, and an ambiance that allows you to hang out all evening and have a few drinks with friends!
author: John L.

description: Family style seating, good beer selection prices so so. The buns were super soggy .I was asked if I wanted to leave my card open, and I replied no because I had to leave relatively quickly. I was served my beers and didn't realize it wasn't given my card back. I went back the next day to get my card and they had charge me an additional nine dollars even know I had told the waiter to close my account right after ordering. I think that's crap and I'm never going back.
author: Devin D.

description:
Perhaps Hogwash a new take on a hot dog stand or a bar with quality sausage snacks.  Either way, it's a great place with a terrific selection of beers just a short walk from Union Square.

While Hogwash is not particularly large, I was there on a Monday evening and I easily found a place to sit and the noise level to be acceptable.  The food selection is a variety of gourmet takes on sausages including chicken, beef, pork, lamb and vegetarian, with a variety of tasty small plates.  There is enough substance to consider the choices dinner and not bar snacks.  The merguez lamb sausage was delicious.  The small plate of beets was fantastic.

The beer choices are equally impressive - 30+ choices all on tap.  Guests order at the bar and take their drinks while the food is brought out by servers.

Hogwash is not an inexpensive hole-in-the-wall joint but prices are in line for SF.  If I were local, I'd be back.
author: Dan S.

description:
Came here for a low-key Santa Con stop. Thoroughly enjoyed the selection of beers (and the fact you can choose your size of glass), but my favorite was the peanut butter bread pudding. Was just sweet enough to not overthrow the taste of my beer. 

Service was speedy and helpful.
author: Kathleen M.

description: The sausage sandwiches here are absolutely amazing. I got the burning broke, very nice flavor. Great selection of beer, I got the Amber Lager from Richmond, CA.
author: Daniel T.

description: Great beer selection and delicious, refined bar food. Nice place to spend a bit more than you want but have a great time.
author: Sarah M.

description: First time in, and it did not disappoint. Superior beer selection, excellent staff, delicious food, and the glassware was impeccable. Can't wait to come back for a pint soon!!
author: Rachel R.

description:
Sat at one of the high tables and loved the ambiance. The food took a very long time (two sandwiches) but it's a comfortable environment to hang out and wait in. 

I thought the portions were good and the sandwiches were yummy, but nothing was so memorable. In fact, about a week later I have no idea what I ordered (and there are only 4 sandwich options I would've considered). I'd come back if I was in the area, especially with a group.
author: Ke D.

description: A great place to stop for a couple beers. There sausage selection is pretty good. This place would be so much better if they had a couple burgers to choose from too!
author: Nicole K.

description:
Hogwash made me thankful that I gave up bread for lent because now I can try their sausages and not crave a bun!

We came in on a Thursday night with no reservations. It was around 615pm and the restaurant was entirely packed! We were eventually seated at the bar and presented with their large beer and food menu. I wanted something light and sour to compliment the sausages so I chose a  Cider. It was a lot lighter than I am normally use to, but I would be lying if I said I didn't feel a buzz coming on quick!

For food, we ordered the deep fried pickles and the sausage sampler. The deep fried pickles were pretty good! It's what you expect it to taste like. I really liked the thinly sliced pickles with the thick batter of deep-fried goodness! The sauce that was included was a great finishing  touch to this dish. The sausage sampler was amazing as well! It came with a pork, beef, chicken and lamb sausage. I was surprised with how full I got from one sausage (might've been the cider too). But my favorite would have to be the pork! It was sweet and chewy with a kick to it. The craziest one would be the spicy one. I don't remember if it was the lamb or the chicken, but one of the skinnier ones... BEWARE! It threw me off guard and numbed the right side of my face for the rest of the night.

Hogwash has a young, laid-back, and nonchalant environment. The service wasn't over the top but the food sure was!
author: Linda K.

description: I loved coming here !! Scottie the bartender was so fun that I had to come back the next day. But then I met Ryan...... he was even better!!! This time I ate too, and the food was good. Great atmosphere, and beer selection. I will be back next time I am in town
author: Kori B.

description: Great bar service from Scott and Chris. Wonderful appetizers! Chicken sausage sandwich was spicy but not over powering. They always have great music going. Highly recommend for people looking for a great beer or local wine paired with down home cooking! Food is inventive but not pretentious!
author: Shelly H.

description: Awesome vegetarian bratwurst with French fries! Tried to order the pretzel roll but they were sold out. Nice choice of beers to compliment the chill and relaxed vibe of this restaurant.
author: Neisy H.

description:
I'm a quick guy.

Quick wit
Quick to the point
Quick worker

I just hate when I have to wait on others, and that's one reason why Hogwash gets my vote.  During lunch, they recognize the worker who needs a quick bite to eat, but without sacrificing quality.  Don't start thinking this is a fast food joint, it's far from it.

If you're in the area and need a quick lunch at reasonable prices and good beer, then head on over here.  You won't be disappointed.  I just wish they had fried pickles during lunch!
author: Ron L.

description:
Came here for a happy hour with my boyfriend. I've been wanting to try their food here, looks super interesting. Place is pretty small, but cozy. We got here when it opened so we got a seat right away, but after awhile it started getting super packed. Service was great and you order/pay in the front and the food will come to you later. They had a wide selection of appetizers and very interesting kinds of beer. 

We ordered:
Bourbon Vanilla Stout: Pretty good beer, had a strong vanilla flavor and not too bitter  
Curry Fries w/ Duck Egg: Pictures looks better than it tasted. I was kind of disappointed. I was expecting better. Fries weren't cooked too well, curry was eh, the only thing that was good was the egg (which I mean eggs can never do you wrong)
The Sausage Platter: Delicious! Highly recommend ordering!  It has the pork breakfast sausage, the sheepish, the burning bird and chicken sausage. I really enjoyed it and the flavors were very good

Overall pretty good place to eat snacks and get a drink!
author: Natalie L.

description: Amazing lamb dog and home made chips. Perfect spot for lunch. The space is well decorated with laid back staff and fun music.
author: Chris P.

description:
Great experience on a recent weekend to San Francisco.  It was within walking distance from our hotel which was a plus.

We were helped by Paula and she really made the experience, she was welcoming and informative.  We felt like regulars even though we were from out of town. 

My husband found a good sour and I loved the weizenbock.  We split the burning Brock which was surprisingly good with a fried avocado and slices of apple.  Pretzel was also very tasty!

Wish we lived closer as we would definitely make this a regular place to go for some good beers and food.
author: Jessica M.

description: The burnin brock was delicious. Love the fried avocado on top. The flavors were so well balanced plus good quality bread. The ratio of ingredients were spot on. Not to mention the great selection of draft beers. Feel free to taste before you buy! I ordered the einstock witbier-very refreshing with some citrus vibes-good light beer for lunch. Will come back again.
author: Parin P.

description: Amazing smoked sausage Cobb. Ryan offered good advice. Good variety Beers and ciders on tap. Burnin Brock and All Day were solid. Clean plates.
author: Catherine A S.

description:
We got some dogs and a salad to go. They bring stuff to the cocktail bar next door, but some miscommunication made me think I had to go pick the stuff up.

The veggie dog was unique, though I prefer a more traditional field roast style to a fried dog-like thing.

I got a special chicken lemon sausage, it was pretty tasty.

We also got an avocado dressing kale salad, which was good but the avocado didn't come through as strong as I wanted.

Solid spot, great that they bring food next door b/c they had a 30 minute wait the wednesday we tried to eat there.
author: Ari F.

description:
Want beer?

San Francisco is very blessed with a wide variety of great waterholes for the thirsty masses and Hogwash is one of them! Their collection of beer is commendable and there is something there for everyone. I tried a glass of a dark beer with Coconut flavor and it actually tasted real good! Odd, right?! My friends were equally happy with their picks and one of the brews his own beer, so there is a lot to be said about his endorsement! 

On the food side we only ordered French Fries and a plate of Herb Roasted Beets; both were awesome. I would love to visit again and try some of the other plates. Their homemade sausages looked delicious, but I was not hungry this time around. That means another visit I guess!
author: Afshin A.

description: Hogwash- it has it all. Visiting from nyc and ended up here more than once. All the food, all the beers, all the conversations. Great energy. I'll be back :)
author: Jennifer L.

description: Great vibe.  Low key with delicious food.  I'm a vegetarian and the veggie "sausage" sandwich was delicious.
author: Tracey B.

description: Very intimate place with great service. The food and beer selection was phenomenal. Very impressed.
author: Deepak S.

description: Really love this place!  Great selection of draft beer and very good sausage plates - reminds me of the times I visited Germany, and the bartender is super friendly.  My wife and I like to hang out here when we're out shopping in Union Square in between stores.  Check it out.
author: Rob R.

description:
The first time I walked by at 6 on a Monday, it was packed so I just kept on walking. I returned on a Thursday around 1:30, and there was plenty of seating to be had. 

Hogwash serves up fancy pub fare--dogs and such-- and It's order-at-the-counter style. The bar tender let me try every beer I enquired after (3 in all), which I appreciated. The two beers I had, a sour and a black lager, were both great. 

But the true star was the sausage. I had the lamb (Sheepish I think it was called?) and it was amazing! Super sloppy, and a little tricky too eat (why torture me with the wide bun?) but the flavor was amaze-balls. Spicy, sweet and sour all at once. Served along side some salty, peppery crisps (i.e. chips) it was a pretty spectacular tube of meat. 

I'd go back for the meat tube alone, but pair that with a solid beer list and I get why it was packed the first time I walked by.
author: Josh G.

description: This gastropub hits the sweet spot for me - interesting flavor combinations, reasonable prices, a lively but unpretentious atmosphere, and a high quality selection of beers on tap.  Based on other Yelpers, I ordered the Abe Froman and fried pickles, both which I highly recommend. The vanilla stout I had turned out to be a good choice too. The flavors are top-notch.
author: Samuel G.

description: Great vegan sausages and tons of beer options. Delicious even for vegetarians! Close to union square. Always a fun place in the evening due to all the beers on tap.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
Rainy day in San Francisco...walked past this place and did a double-take. The simple rustic-modern appeal of the entry matched seamlessly with the somewhat spare yet hand crafted menu.
We sampled two of the appetizers-- the pretzel roll (wow...large, hot, and incredible with the best beer mustard ever) and the house made chips...
The beer menu was comprehensive and interesting (we chose a bourbon vanilla stout)...
A place we will definitely return to to sample one of their signature sausage dishes!
author: Margie N.

description: Just had lunch at Hogwash and had the Burning Brock habanero chicken sausage sandwich and it was amazing, I was afraid of the fennel but Ryan the bartender, talked me into it and I'm glad he did, absolutely delicious. And the added plus is the amazing beer selections on tap and Ryan was ok too, jk Ryan, thanks man.
author: Steven H.

description:
Recommend: Curry fries add duck egg and sausage (your choice.
Great beer, cool people.
author: Patrik B.

description:
If you're looking for a lunch or dinner spot right now, just come to Hogwash.

There are several killer sausage sandwich dishes, with flavors that will make your tastebuds come alive. Order some of the appetizers (I recommend the beets). The food here is so damn good.
The selection of beer is also incredible. Order your favorite or try something new. They had beers from several local breweries that I had never heard of. Ask your server if you need help pairing a beer to your meal!
Last, the restaurant design is real well done. This is the kind of restaurant to head to if you want to impress someone with your knowledge of cool spots.
author: Alex L.

description: A quick business lunch turned into a couple of hours because a) the food was excellent and b) the person I was with became fascinated with the range of beers they have on tap. He pronounced the range of taps "well above the average" as he was on his fourth. Mostly I was marveling at the fact that even the home made hot sauce was worth coming in for. I mean, how many places make their own hot sauce? Plus, the service was friendly and fast.
author: John M.

description:
Hogwash gets 3 stars for food, and 4 stars for beer.

The other day I meant to go to Del Popolo with a friend but didn't realize they were closed. We went around the corner to Hogwash instead. 

I loved the vibe (hipster, modern but casual), and I appreciated their lengthy list of beers. But I wasn't very impressed by the food selection and would recommend Hogwash only for drinks and snacks.
author: Jess C.

description:
Ordered the burnin Brock and the breakfast sausage hot dog. The internet and overall ambiance of the restaurant felt hip and classy. Service was friendly and fairly fast!

Was not a fan of the Burnin Brock. The chicken sausage was really dry and crumbly. Furthermore, felt like the fried avocado didn't really compliment the flavor and vibe of the hot dog. On the other hand, the breakfast sausage was juicy and delicious. I love the toppings and the duck egg was a great addition. Furthermore, the buns here are outstandingly soft and they have a wide selection of beers that are worth checking out!

I don't recommend coming during lunch time, came here for the curry fries and sausage platter but they don't serve those until 5pm. Will revisit to try those two dishes again!
author: David H.

description:
I came here because of the creative menu I found online. Not the same old stuff. 

I enjoyed my experience because the food was unusual and very flavorful. And the service was excellent. The bartender, Scotty, took his time to guide me through some of the sandwich offerings and he was also highly knowledgeable about the beer.

Ultimately, I tried a Burnin' Brock. Chicken habanero sausage, harissa aioli, fried avocado, pickled cabbage, fresh fennel, and apple. And I added a duck egg. So good!

Highly recommend.
author: Erik F.

description: Great beer selection and tasty bites. Fried pickles were delectable. The roasted beets were amazing. Comfortable atmosphere, friendly service that even allowed me to charge my cellphone at the bar.
author: Monica D.

description: Sandwiches are good and have always hit the spot whenever I've gone their.  It's never super crowded and you order at a side counter instead of over people's shoulders at the bar.  Great beer selection as well.
author: Doran I.

description: This place was amazing! What a gem in San Fran. We shared an assortment of small plates and tried many of Jr local beers. I love the concept !!
author: Jason T.

description: Took a friend here for a couple beers. We didn't eat. I have no complaints. The beer choice was great and the help was as well
author: Rich M.

description:
Dinner review. 

Curry fries - 3/5
Fried pickles - 2/5
Lamb sausage - 3/5
Chicken sausage - 2/5
Breakfast sausage - 4/5
Beef and cheese sausage - 4/5

Good beer selection. 

Overall, "I'm a fan."
author: Mark O.

description:
This place is amazing!! Lots of great taps of beer and the food quality is on point. I came here for a yelp elite event and was able to try different taps of beers and wine! The bartenders and staff are super friendly and you can see the passion they have for this industry. 

I would definitely come back here again. Great house made sausages and perfectly cooked and it is served on a freshly baked roll. All types of sausages are good so you can't go wrong with any of them to be honest. Surprisingly I actually enjoyed the fried housemade pickles and I HATE pickles. Hogwash has been only opened for a year! Keep it up.
author: Jenn L.

description:
Well this hipster eatery definitely has its swag, we came here on a Friday morning and it was pretty empty, however don't let that fool you everything here is pretty on point.

Let's get straight to the point (the food and beer), I got the sheepish, my friends got the burnt brock and the all day. One complaint I have for the brock and the sheepish is that the sausage itself was pretty skinny and for 11 bucks I was expecting something along the lines of a bratwurst, however the flavors were definitely on point, if you do want to get more for your money get the all day sandwich which comes which a pork sausage (which is quite thick) and it also comes standard with the fried duck egg, which is a $3 dollar extra charge for all the other sandwhiches.

All in all this place is not too shabby at all.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: Maybe a 2.5.  This place was our first San Francisco pick and while it was fine, I didn't love it.   The menu is pretty specialized - not for the picky eater for sure.  I'm not picky and was between two choices.  We ended up ordering both and splitting them.   The chicken sausage with fried avocado was the better of the two.  The lamb merguez was too gamey for me.   Both were really messy and hard to eat.   Also, the chips that came with were SOOOOOOO salty.  And I love salt.  Fast casual style ordering and a bunch of stools with no backs.  Just not my thing.
author: Kristy A.

description:
I already like this place for opening late until midnight. 

I love it even more for their delicious sausage especially the Burnin' Brock with fried avocado on top. Can't forget their curry fries. YUM!

For a gastropubs place, they sure serve delicious bites and beer on taps. Not to mention, the staff is awesome and very welcoming. I definitely would recommend this place to my friends. 

I hope you give this awesome place a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: we tried the food here via delivery to PCH. we got the fried pickles which were overdone and poorly seasoned, the sausage which was delivered cold and the pretzel which was not only cold but totally doughy. the roasted beets were the only saving grace. for $28 we could have had a real meal elsewhere!
author: Alexandra K.

description: They are in my 'hood !!  Am I lucky or what. Just had the chicken habanerao sandwich with their great home made slaw-type condiment, fried avocado, and home made potato chips. Fabulous. Hope they are here forever as things change too fast in San Francisco.
author: lynn s.

description:
Hogwash. 

It means nonsense. 

Slang? B.S.

When the word came about mid-15th century, the original sense of use was "kitchen swill for pigs".

WHAT?!

Fast forward to present times, there's no way I'm feeding that $28 sausage platter to pigs. Not even my dog. (if I had one ...)

First of all, you get a variety of sausages: the pork breakfast sausage, the sheepish, the burning bird and Abe Froman. Second of all: it's MMMeat. You need it if you're gonna down a couple of brewskis. The names are cute and my two pals don't like lamb so I had the sheepish all to myself! (yay!)  The blue cheese, pickled cabbage and beets really went well with the lamb and tamed down the strong flavor of the meat. 

Another thing to get is the Hogwash fries. Hello gorgeous fried sticks of carbs! Substantially thick and well salted, there's no doubt this french fry connoisseur had a field day with that small portion.

Back to the craft brews. There are 30 choices on tap. Basically, that's enough golden liquid to flood Sutter St. I'm not a master cicerone, but it's safe to say these guys take their beers seriously. I stuck with bubbly (they had Gloria Ferrer) but I wish they had a proper flute. Wah, wah. 

The guys behind the bar are engaging and a few are quite the talker, so all the single ladies! Snag that bar stool and park your pretty little self there for an hour or two. After you're done enchanting your bartender, they'll be putty in your hands.

And that's no Hogwash.
author: Janice C.

description:
Satisfying portion - but not too much.  
Tasty meat selection keep you coming back to try more. 
Good beer selection to pair w/ pork.
Healthy and complimentary toppings make these brauts stand out over other dog joints. 
Space is dark but mood is warm.
author: Lane J.

description: So good. The best beets and goat cheese, pretzels and Brussels sprouts. Great service.
author: Xela C.

description:
Sadly, couldn't try the fries or sausage platter since they didn't serve those until after 5pm (for dinner menu). 
Got the Burnin' Brock and All Day sausages. For the Burnin' Brock--I loved the soft bun, it tasted so fresh. The items inside the bun were good too, except the sausage itself. Sadly, the sausage was so dry that the meat had a crumbly texture. It tasted so bland. However, the All Day sausage was better!
I loved the decor and service at Hogwash, but the sausage itself was a bit of a let down. Overall, I'd only come back if I was in the area. Not worth a long drive.
author: Ranice L.

description: Not so great...they were out of what I wanted that's ok but what I ordered along with the rest of my family was disappointing maybe we got them on a bad night the service was excellent the food not so much and don't eat the pickled orange things still not sure what they were carrots or what but they taste how garbage smells...the beer selection good maybe go there to have a drink
author: Jamie C.

description: This place was great! Happened upon it for a drink and ended up staying all night. Chris x2 and Nebiel were great bartenders. And the beers were awesome! Would definitely come back for beers, and to try the food.
author: Colleen B.

description:
A group of 7 of us were looking for somewhere to watch the warriors game. After finding no tables at GGTR we decided to give Hogwash a try and I'm so glad we did. 

The space isn't too big. 10-12 high top tables that can hold 6ish people and a long large community table. 
The menu is small but had some great sausages options. I ended up ordering the special which was pork sausage with some beans and other great stuff topped off with fresh strawberry salas which was delicious! The coolest part of the drink menu is that the menu lists where each beer/cinder comes from. SO AWESOME!

It's always great to find a place that makes its easy on larger parties when it comes to the bill. Another reason I loved this place is that you order at the counter and then take a number to your table. Super easy. 

We went to watch the game and they had a huge screen playing the game in addition to some smaller tvs in the back. 

Overall every person who we encountered at HogWash was kind and helpful. Service was quick and food was delicious. 5 stars. We will be back.
author: Roxy N.

description: Extensive beer selection and good place to get a drink, but don't go here for food unless you love sausage because that's about all they offer.  My husband and I came here for dinner but ended up just having a beer and heading elsewhere for food.
author: Robyn B.

description: Simple menu but manages to have a good variety of options including chicken and vegetarian sausages.  We had the breakfast sausage and the beef which were both very tasty.  However, two sausages, a beer and a coke should not cost $50, even in SF.  It is convenient to Union Square so I assume that's why the prices are so outrageous.
author: Liz R.

description:
Delicious new (to me) restaurant! I liked the vibe and decor - metal and wood, sort of industrial. Once you're greeted at the door, you end up at a common table (unless you score one of the very few two tops), and then order from the bar.

My friend and I split an order of the fried pickles (who can resist?!?!) and the wurst sampler. The fried pickles were a last minute decision as I stood at the bar - the girl next me had an order and they looked GOOOOOOD. And they were! A light batter reminiscent of tempura, great flavor, and a delicious dipping sauce.

The wurst sampler was also a good choice - we got 2 skinny chicken jalapeño sausages, 2 skinny lamb sausages, and 2 big fat sausages (all-day breakfast and chorizo). It comes with housemade pickled veggies. The sausages were great! It's hard to pick a favorite. The chorizo was super tasty and perfectly spiced; the breakfast was unexpectedly great, with a sweet yet complex flavor, and the lamb was amazingly spiced! I didn't love the chicken, but only because it wasn't quite as good. Still good, though.

The accompanying pickled veggies were only ok. None had a particularly great kick or complexity of flavors. I think they need to rethink their recipes on this front. My friend and I also thought that a side of bread would have been good for the sampler - it was kind of weird to have no bread to smear our sausage and mustard on.

This would have been a 5 star restaurant but for two things - it was stiflingly hot in there, and the common tables. It's a little too close to wedge that many people into a table.
author: Deb G.

description:
Was in town for a convention and hit up the nephew who lives near by for some food suggestions - this was at the top of his list. 

Didn't disappoint nephew! The fried pickles are a must and I had the All Day Sandwich and it was tasty! These guys know how to treat a sausage!

Get the pickles!
author: Greg S.

description: if you like beer and bar food; this is your joint. they have a pretty extensive list of beer, and unique nom noms. I had a spicy chicken sausage sandwich with fried avocado, fried pickles and a sour ale. nice, casual space and very lively with a bar in the back. great for dinner with buddies!
author: Tiffany L.

description: Sat at the bar with a friend to grab dinner and a drink! We ordered the fried pickles and the chicken sausage sandwich and both were amazing! Add in their homemade mustard, great service and good beers, this is a great place to come to and I will definitely be back!
author: Rachel N.

description: Great restaurant.  Awesome sausage, great design, incredible beer selection, and the staff clearly takes pride in their product.  Can't wait for me next trip to San Fran to enjoy in again.
author: Eric E.

description: Very friendly staff.  Great service.  Impressive beer selection.  We had fun!  Husband loved his sausage.  My salad was good.
author: Amy S.

description: Our server Ryan was great. He was playing good tunes the whole time. And he made sure we always had a beer. Food was killer. You can tell the chef cares about his menu with some interesting sausage options.
author: chris h.

description: Fantastic place for happy hour. Lots of sausage dishes of course but we ordered off the snack menu and  got a pretzel that was so fresh and fantastic that I'm sure their other dishes are great too. My husband loved the variety of beer on tap and I had some pretty good wine. We tried this place closer to dinner time and it was too packed but during the day seems better
author: Jessica L.

description:
Came here with a few friends after a few cocktail the other night. Frankly (HA - get the frankfurter pun?), I was unaware this place existed until I took to Yelp from the Tunnel Top.  

It was pretty crowded about 7:30 on a Wed. Most of the tables are communal. We got lucky and one opened up for 5 about 2 mins after our arrival.

You order everything at the bar. We got two orders of curry fries (Yum) - Wish I had know to top it with an egg.

We also split a sausage sandwich and a salad.  All was good. It was pretty loud in there.
author: Amy W.

description: Wasn't sure what to expect. Cool casual atmosphere, friendly and prompt staff. Great selection of beers. The food--PHENOMENAL. Roasted beets were quite good. The Burnin' Brock topped with a fried duck egg was out of this world. So simple, yet it tastes like 5-Star dining. From the truly freshly baked roll, to the fresh spicy chicken sausage, fresh picked and raw veggies to the out of this world fried avocado spear! Yes fried avocado. So delicious! What a great experience. Must visit anytime you are in SF.
author: Sev C.

description:
Hogwash is a solid happy hour/weeknight spot with delicious food. They are one of the most reliable places in the neighborhood in terms of a great beer list. They offer a wide range of mostly local beers, and the bartenders are helpful when it comes to making a recommendation. The vibe is pretty casual and everything has to be ordered at the bar. 

I haven't tried most of their food, but I can attest that their Burnin' Brock a DELICIOUS (but also incredibly messy). Picture this: chicken habanero sausage, harissa aioli, fried avocado, fennel apple slaw w/ housemade chips. Trust me, this thing is massive and filling. Partner with a class of cold beer, and really what more do you need? Beyond food and drink, service is pretty hands-off and the vibe is decent (not too quiet, not too loud). Definitely a great, convenient spot to grab a post-work beer and snack/meal, but not a place I'd spend an entire evening hanging out at.
author: Regina L.

description: I was in San Fran for a week for a conference and then a mini-vacation. There are a ton of options for food in this city and it is very hard to pick a place. I got lucky and my husband found this spot for us for dinner and I so happy he did. It is a small restaurant tucked away in the Nob Hill area. You order food and drinks at the bar and they give you a number to place at your table. There is a great selection of craft beer which is always a plus in my book. It is Bavarian style brats and general pub fare. We ordered the deep-fried pickles, curry fries and two of the brats. I went for the breakfast brat. It was served on a delicious sourdough type bun, topped with an egg that broke perfectly and drizzled down over the maple syrup flavored brat. I would order this one every time! The deep-fried pickles were decent; I am from the Midwest and have a high standard for deep fried pickles and compared to home they were fine. However, the yellow curry fries are worth every calorie! French cut style and golden yellow; these fries were a perfect match for the thick yellow curry sauce that was drizzled over them. I would order this again in a heartbeat.
author: Megan H.

description: I had an amazing experience at Hogwash. I was in town to visit a friend and he recommended we try Hogwash. He told me of the good beer and great sausage that can be found here and I was immediately sold. Everything met my lofty expectations. First the service was tremendous; the owner even stopped by our table to say some kind words. Next, the beer selection proved to be very good, especially for me as I live in the Midwest and many of the breweries on the menu were new to me. Last, and most important, the food. I had the Sheepish, which is lamb sausage, blue cheese, pickled cabbage and beet relish. Super tasty!
author: Ian D.

description:
Solid place, but I would not recommend for lunch.

I had just left the dentist and wanted a bite downtown. Saw - and smelled - Hogwash. A gastropub sausage and beer for lunch? I'm down!

You order at the counter with a limited menu of 5 sausage sandwiches, a few salads, some snacks, and a few other items. But more impressive is their beer selection - some locals, some internationals, but with over 30 taps definitely something to find.

I went with an Abe Froman and an Almanac Farmer's Reserve Sour. The sausage sandwich had a lot of flavor, but size-wise was definitely smaller than something you will get at Rosamunde. The homemade chips weren't bad but nothing to write home about. The beer was excellent.

The reason I say not a lunch recommendation is all this came out to $25. That's a bit steep for a sausage and beer lunch. Late night, definitely worthwhile or pre-gaming downtown and sharing stuff. Would probably go again if drunk downtown.
author: Michael C.

description: Excellent hand crafted sausage, homemade chips and great selection of rotating beers on tap. Would highly suggest visiting
author: Nate D.

description: This place was good but not great.  My friend got the habanero chicken sausage sandwich, it was really tasty and the perfect spiciness.  I had the beets and they were ok, not great.  Service was a bit slow.
author: Jessica I.

description: Ha, I was a little apprehensive about a brat restaurant but everything was delicious. The unique combinations all worked well and the service was quick and friendly! Try the chicken habanero sausage! Also, a great beer list!!
author: Angela W.

description:
Solid beer list with hit or miss food items. 

Great spot to meet a friend, a tinder date in a casual ambience. Has a bar area for the single folks or the travelers. 

Come for a pint, a snack or dinner if Tacorea's line is bad. 

Fun spot!
author: Etienne D.

description:
The family and I went. My wife and I plus two of my daughters got the Abe Froman, one daughter got the All Day. No complaints from anyone, all voiced their love for the sandwiches. 
Great beer selection too!
author: Dan G.

description: I was in SF for work and my boyfriend joined me when I extended through the weekend. Hongwash kind of reminds me of Wurskutche in DTLA. We shared the CURRY FRIES  AND THE BURNIN BROCK which was the chicken habanero sausage. It was so well complimented with the fried avocado and that amazing harissa aioli. I'd definitely go back again when I'm back in town. ENJOY!
author: Darlene Y.

description:
I was thirsty and looking for a place to quench my thirst. Since I was walking with a girlfriend toward her place, she suggested Hogwash. I ended up meeting Peter L here on Wednesday, July 29th at 6pm. Well, I got there at 6pm. He got there closer to 7pm.

*Gulden draak 9000 Belgian quad, 10.5%, Belgium ($9 for 9oz)
*Verhaeghe duchesse flanders red, 6.0%, Belgium ($11 for 9oz)
*Deschutes fresh squeezed ipa, 6.4%, Bend, OR ($6 for 16oz)

I know nothing about beer, so I just picked the Gulden draak as my first drink. I liked it as it was strong and seemed to remind me a little of drinking coffee. Plus, it's named after a dragon! I love dragons! The second beer I picked was the Verhaeghe duchesse. I didn't like this as much as it was a sour beer. Reminded me of drinking beer with pickle juice in it. I made Peter finish it.

We didn't try any of their food as we were going to meet up a group of friends at another bar. Maybe I can use this as an excuse to go back as I loved the feel of Hogwash. Chill and laid back. Til next time.
author: Elena N.

description: We ordered the pretzel and one of us started choking; the sauce was so gross it was so sour and right now I feel sick to my stomach then the olives came out nothing great the green stuff tasted like some kind of seaweed slime thing it was disgusting then the kids meals came out and well let's just jut say they all spit it out so they took the dog out and had a ketchup sandwich personally I think even my dog wouldn't eat it and in the beginning my daughter went up to order the food and she waited there for like 10 minutes in the front of the line and then a probably 30 year old lady came up and she got helped right away so I am was unhappy about that. But the service was wonderful they were very helpful but I don't think that makes the food taste any better. Over all it was pretty bad
author: Callie D.

description: In town for the weekend and I saw the restaurant while looking for the parking lot for our hotel.  I instantly needed to have a sausage sandwich for lunch.  I got the Chicken Habanero Sandwich while the little man got the Sausage Sampler plate.  The food was awesome and I am so glad I spotted this place!
author: Christine K.

description: Probably would have been more liking there if the service was better and you didn't have to order from the bar, which took awhile but the Abefroman sausage dog is the best. Food so trumps the service!
author: Tammy C.

description: Very good food for what it is, but the beer on tap selection is where it appears Hogwash shines.  Really wish I could have enjoyed some of the selections of beers, but was only there for a quick lunch on a break from a conference.  Would have been 5 stars for sure but the hipster douche behind the bar didn't take too kindly to my ice tea order in lieu of a beer...
author: Robert F.

description:
Went here with a friend for dinner since it was so close to where we were shopping in Union Square. Definitely a win! Service was fast, and staff is very friendly. We split a salad, sandwich, and fries. We saved room for dessert -- bread pudding. 

A few minor details that I thought could have been a bit better -- the fries were way too salty. But they were super fresh and hot. And the bread pudding needed to absorb the liquid more -- the bread was too crunchy. But again, it was super fresh. I think with just a few tweaks this place would be a solid 5 stars. My friend and I had a great time and we will definitely go again!
author: Lori M.

description:
Hogwash is a cool gastropub in downtown. The service is great, and the Burnin' Brock is the best chicken sausage sandwich I've ever had. Fried avocado is a really interesting add to it, and it's pretty delicious. We also had the curry fries with an egg. I wasn't a huge fan of these, so I was hoping to get another Burnin' Brock, but they ran out. I was really happy I was able to try it. I can't stop thinking about it, so I'm going to have to go back soon. The aioli is a great addition to the sandwich and makes the whole thing come together. If you haven't been to Hogwash for this specific dish, you are missing out!

We also tried the dessert, which I think is somewhat new on the menu. It's Madagascar Vanilla - Three Twins Ice Cream with fried cookie dough that has some kind of candied bacon inside. It was really good and unique so I definitely recommend trying it.
author: Radhika G.

description: This place was my favorite place in the area. Literally my go to local spot. All the workers are so amazing and the cooks make delicious foods. The Chef (Walker), from which the recipes come from, was so awesome too, unfortunately he abruptly quit recently. It breaks my heart to write this negative post. One of the owners Paula, came  up to me one night and literally gave me this verbal beat down that I'm still recovering from. Long story short she accused me of only going there to get things for free, she added how hard she has worked to build this place. I couldn't even get a word in and all I wanted todo was apologize for whatever I did that upset her so much. I too at the time was dealing with my own work drama and really wasnt paying much attention to what was going on around me. I never meant to offend her, but the most disgusting thing is during her rant she asks me a yes or no question. Finally I can tell her I dont know what happend and that i am so sorry. But she says "No, shut-up, just answer me yes or no! x 3." Like I worked for her or as if I was a child ( I'm 37) by the way. During this night I had 1 beer and got a pretzel to go. I left $22 on the bar and that is when Paula attacked me. I always thought of myself as an over payer/ over tipper. In the end Paula says you can have this pretzel and take your money. My heart was crushed and tobe chastised like that in front of the entire busy restaurant was humiliating. I will miss enjoying everything else about this place...
author: eddie k.

description: Great find for food, beverages and hospitality. The owner took the time to explain our choices. The house-made sausage was wonderful. As was the beer selection!  Unbelievable selection of draft beers to go with our meal.
author: Ed B.

description: awesome spot, swanky after work crowd on a Wednesday night. the beer selection was great and the bites we tried were delicious, especially their pickle selection. perfect spice and vinegar, well done!
author: Baby J.

description: They have overall good food, good service and the place isn't expensive. However the relatively small setting can get crowded and there is usually a wait during meal times.
author: Ava D.

description:
Everything you've read and heard is true about Hogwash. The sausages are fantastic; great snap and each one is bursting with unique flavors. Highly recommend the sausage platter, you get to sample all 4 sausages plus the pickled vegetables are a great addition.

Curry fries with duck egg - fries are crisp and plentiful, curry added a nice depth of heat and flavor but next time I think I'll stick with just plain fries. Egg was good but not a necessity 

Fried Pickles - coated nicely with a great crispy exterior and seasoned well. Well worth getting a batch to share

Variety of draft beers is solid and can suit anyone's needs

Just note, you order everything at the bar

Overall Thoughts

I look forward to when I can come back to Hogwash again
author: Eddie W.

description: This place was so amazing we decided to go back when we were visiting the city. The beer selection was beyond words and their plant based "hogless" option was delicious. My husband has the sausage platter and he was delighted. We will definitely be back upon our next visit to SF!!
author: Raean P.

description: Cool spot.  Great beers and food, but the food felt a bit on the pricey side.  At $12.5 for a sausage sandwich, that's a bit steep even if you consider that they're housemade.  If it came with sides that would be alright, but everything is a la carte.  I've been to similar places in the bay that offer up sausages for around the $7 price range.  Anyways, they are good, the big redeeming part was the fried avocado on my Burnin' Brock.  It really made it something else.  As for the beers, I really enjoyed their selection.  The inside is really nice, not too much seating, but we were lucky enough to get the last open table on a Saturday evening.  Good spot to load up on food before bar hopping.
author: Bryson L.

description: First time here was for a date night with the hubby. The sausage with duck egg was to die for and the beer was on point. I loved the ambiance and the fact that it wasn't super packed. Service was good, so I will definitely be back when I am down town again.
author: Tori M.

description: Stopped in with a friend after looking around for a place with good beer. They had a good selection (I was sad to see from an old menu that Hitachino White Ale had been rotated out) including Old Rasputin on nitrous, which was the selling point for me. I got a "Burnin' Brock", which I would heartily recommend to anyone preferring a chicken sausage over the traditional pork. Regardless of how trendy or hip a place is, I reserve judgment until I've tried their fries (they seem to be the weak spot for most establishments). Hogwash serves theirs in a cup, and I'm pleased to say they were fucking delicious. However, the unsung hero may in fact be their house mustard, which was perfectly balanced with horseradish to compliment both the fries and the sausage.
author: Darrell V.

description: Very cool little place to get a variety of beers and some snacks. The staff was humorous, if not friendly when asking for help with the beer list. Ended up with a sour, a Belgian and then a double IPA. All good stuff. Curry fries were good too.
author: Zachary C.

description: Place was almost empty. Ordered the sausage platter and fries. Over the hour we waited, the server walked by multiple times and saw we had an open order. Finally at closing time, she asked us what we had ordered. Apparently, the bar tender was able to take our credit card, give us an order number, but not actually enter our order. By then, it was too late to get food anywhere else. I highly recommend not going here. There are so many other places in the vicinity that will be happy to take your money and actually give you decent service.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
Great food. Good sandwiches. Even the veggie sandwich was very tasty and balanced. 

Best fries ever.
author: Sylvain D.

description: My husband and I came here during our visit to SF. Food, beer and wine were excellent! The service was great, atmosphere chill and wide beer selection.
author: Cecilia m.

description:
Fact: people have commitment issues.

People are either too lazy, too tired, too far, too full, or too busy with life that it makes it so hard to grab a bite to eat.  Sometimes it's best just to rely on yourself.

Curry Fries with sausage topped with Fried Duck Egg - Fries had a nice texture, the egg yolk mixed with the curry was good, sausage wasn't bad.  

I thought I would be able to finish the whole plate but couldn't.  Luckily a friend decided to drop whatever he was doing and come by.  A friend in need is a friend indeed.  The music was somewhat loud but nothing major to disturb us from deep conversation.  

Great service.
author: Linda N.

description: I am giving this place five stars because my whole experience was great! I came in with my boyfriend around 10 on a Saturday night we were greeted right away got drinks and our food really fast. We got the curry fries with egg on top and fried pickles very tasty!!!!! The vibe is very romantic they have candles on each table, dim lights. Would definitely be returning!
author: Alexis W.

description: Great place! It's a gem in a high tourist area near Union Square. The fried pickles are awesome! The sandwiches are very flavorful. They clearly thought the menu through because the pair gray with the beers. Nice variety of bears on the menu. The place  is very chill, nice spot after work.
author: Megan Z.

description:
After shopping in Union Square one weekend afternoon I decided to stop by Hogwash for lunch as I was craving a good meal and cold brew.  I was immediately greeted by the friendly staff and showed a spot at the bar.  The server was happy to answer all of my questions regarding the different brews on tap, they have a ton and the list is amazing, and even was offered a sample of one to see if I liked it.  I ended up going ordering a Little Creatures Juicy Pale Ale from Australia and the Abe Froman sausage sandwich.  The sausage was perfectly cooked and full of flavor and the beer was perfect for washing it down.

I can't wait until I get to go back to this place and try more of the many beers and sausage options.
author: Samuel R.

description: Wonder brats, and the sample platter is a must.  Great newest coast craft beer on tap selection and wine too.  Staff was very friendly and helpful on beer selection.  Bonus was awesome blues music played at an appropriate level.  Lighting gave a warm and friendly feel.
author: Leo S.

description:
Found this place on yelp while visiting SF during our honeymoon. Great ambiance, friendly staff, we got there early enough in the evening that seats were available at the bar. You have to like sausage or meat in general to eat here (hence the name). I got the special - a sausage sandwich with jalapeño peach jam. SO SO GOOD, and it's not a dish I would
typically order. Great drink/beer list. Would definitely return!
author: Julia P.

description: Great beer selection and vibe...bartender little pretentious...just saying...sorry dude
author: E G.

description: Went to Hogwash after having a cocktail next door out of desperation and hunger not expecting anything but the usual "Hogwash" found around Union Square. Wasn't impressed by the touting of house made sausages or the decor. But once seated and realizing the 30 some selection of interesting beers and after biting into my "Abe Froman", beef, bacon and cheddar sausage w 1,000 island dressing and xtras i was blown away! OFF THE HOOK!!
author: Steven B.

description: This place was a fun stop on our SF trip.  A great place to stop in for a drink or a casual bite to eat if you are around Union Square.
author: Alison E.

description:
In town for work and just wanted to have a nice relaxed dinner and hang out.    Found Hogwash!! And what a great find.    Open layout of communal table and and smaller group tables.    We sat in the bar area at a 2 person table.    This is where the fun begins.   The hostess ( so we thought) sat us down and went over the menu with and pointed what she thought was the best of the best on menu.   She also said that she knows BEER.  I would say about 30 craft brews on tap.  

So for food we went with her suggestion
Sampler platter of the sausages, curry fries, fried pickles and I threw in the baked pretzel.   

Did not ask for beer suggestion but walked up to the bar and ordered 2 

Then we ordered food but before the food came this young lady saw that I did not love my choice of beer.  She asked what I like and said I have the one for you.   She quickly replaced my beer with one that I liked.    She apologized for no reason

   
Food came 
Sausages all made in house.     Came with 4 different kinds.   Very tasty and full of flavor 

Curry fries were outstanding 

Pretzel came out hot and toasty with a great spicy brow mustard 

Fried picked were not bad  just a little doughy for my taste.    

As we were getting really full and up to our last sausage I notice it's a little undercooked.   I asked the server to re fire it for us.   No big deal.  

Here comes... Now we know her as Paula to again make it right.     We continue to talk to her and find out she is not the hostess but an owner.    

I was so impressed with her.     A young fun socially engaging businesswomen that knows that she wants her customers to enjoy every moment in her restaurant 

Please go to Hogwash and enjoy !!!

PS: she bought us a crazy good dessert of ice Cream with the chocolate bites of yumminess with salt on top.    UNREAL!!!!
author: D K.

description:
Get the deep fried pickles!! 

We tried the pickles and the sausage sample platter. Ever sausage we delicious. My wife and I had a hard time picking a favorite. 

The deep fried pickles are the best we've ever had. 

Great casual spot.
author: Josh A.

description: Nice place and everything I would expect from a gastropub beer bar. Had a drink and some tasty fries. Prices were reasonable. Ample seating, and good service.
author: James S.

description: Blah atmosphere, limited menu and over-priced. An 8 ounce coke with no refills for $3. It was a joke.
author: Rick L.

description:
While having drinks at Pacific Cocktail Haven (next door) me and my group were starving! The bartender suggested we go to Hogwash and place an order. Best decision ever! Had the famous curry fries with sausage and duck egg (adding both is a MUST). These were hands down the best fries I've ever eaten! So good, we actually went back and ordered a second round (don't judge). 

Restaurant ambiance was chill on a random Monday night and the staff/service was great. Will definitely have to come back and try some of the other menu options and beer.
author: Krystal C.

description: Wanted something relatively quick for dinner with cool vibes and this place fulfilled that want. Split the breakfast sausage with a side of fries. Fries were extra crispy (which I loved) and the sausage topped with a duck egg was different but delicious. Beer menu wasn't super up my alley and I didn't love the pomegranate cider I ended up ordering.
author: Kelly H.

description:
I've been to Hogwash twice now, and will probably make it a regular location of mine when I'm in the city. Their logo is a pig in a bathtub, what could be better than that? 

They have 30 beer taps and their selection is really amazing. Plenty of new and fun things to try to get you excited about the beer scene in Northern California (if for some reason you were visiting from Mars and were unaware). Bartenders are knowledgeable in the way that people who drink beer are, not in the way that servers who have been given a script to say are.

We only ate the beet salad, but it was such a fantastic combination of sweet beets, salty cheese, and herby deliciousness. I can't imagine why I didn't force myself to try one of the house sausages, but I guess that leaves something to try the next time.
author: Kristy C.

description: There's a little bit of a wait to get a table but we were able to finally sit down and it was worth it. We like the sides as much as we did the main, especially enjoyed the beets.
author: James R.

description: Could you possibly salt the food anymore, seriously?! I even tried the deserts and got mouths full of strait up kosher salt, fucking disgusting!
author: Adam R.

description: Stop by here with a couple friends.  Food was good, olives were great.  We tried several items and they were all good.  Good beer selection, even though they don't have waiters the service behind the bars was good and friendly.
author: Aaron C.

description: This is my favorite bar in the city. Great aesthetic, amazing food options, but what really keeps me coming back is the phenomenal staff.
author: Taylor H.

description: Great variety of beers on tap, unique tasty menu. We enjoyed the herb roasted beets with warm goat cheese. YUM!
author: Steve K.

description:
Great craft beer selection, and a good menu of pub-ish food. They do a great job of pairing your beer up to the appropriate glass instead of "everyone gets a pint glass". 

Was priced very well. The ambience was great, and it had a great vibe.
author: Ryan B.

description: So I tried this sausage and beer bar that I saw on Yelp!- just taking a chance, and checking it out (almost walked right back out because I wasn't sure if it's what I wanted)! Lots of craft beers to choose from- I think 30! I couldn't decide on beer so I had the server help me choose based on what I was order. I got the Sheepish- a lamb mergiez sausage sandwich with pickled cabbage and beet relish. This was adventurous for a number of reasons... I'm generally not a fan of sausage and I've  never liked pickled cabbage or beets, but I like lamb. I topped it off with a fried duck egg, sunny side up. Surprise, suprise- I enjoyed it all! The beer washed it all down nicely. I would recommend the  place- good vibe, not too serious. A nice lunch place or to casually hang out in the evening.
author: Moeketsi M.

description:
Cool place. In town for a conference and ended up with a free afternoon so Yelped for a good lunch spot. No wait with a huge selection of beers on tap. You can enjoy a plate of warm olives while listening to jazz in a cool atmosphere. Plus, their homemade sausage sandwiches are YES! I had the Abe Froman with the homemade hot mustard. Give this place a try. :) 

Pulled a star because they didn't really have anything except the sandwiches and the staff wasn't super friendly - efficient and accurate, tho.
author: Shannon H.

description:
Friend: "There's a place that does great hot dogs. One comes with deep fried avocado."
Me: *shoves friend aside recklessly and begins sprinting in the direction of deep fried avocado*

Not really. But if we were in a cartoon or a sitcom, something like that probably would have happened. 

We ate in the bar next door because Hogwash was full. Love that you can do that, plus the bar next door sells lovely drinks. (None of which I can remember, because avocado.) Or are they the same company? There are many things I don't know. 

There was a little bit of a mix up as the waiter couldn't find us for ages, although we were sure we'd let them know where we were at. Didn't matter, they were cool. The pickled veg plate was good, but not sure I needed so many vinegary veg in one go. It's a sharing plate, but even so we couldn't quite manage all of it. Who cares?! The hotdog!

Don't even know what it's called, but it was unreal. Brock? Mmm. So tasty. Here's what I actually do know: The sausage was wonderfully seasoned, cooked perfectly, and had a great amount of toppings, and it comes nestled in a fab, soft bun. However it really is all about that deep fried avocado. Crispy, salty, melty, delicious... Going to set up some kind of oil vat in my kitchen to try and recreate. Worth it.

Wish me luck.
author: Rowena H.

description: A really good selection of beer and some of the best olives and beet dishes in town, they now also have a super friendly and helpful host. For those craving cocktails instead, just hop next door but you can still get food from here.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
The informal definition of "hogwash" is "nonsense". But there is no nonsense at this gastropub! 

The place is awesome for beers. They have tables for 2 behind the bar, and communal seating in the front. The bar is a sight to see - with 30 beers on tap! Service here is memorable... and in a really great way. Everyone is super friendly and helpful. You order food and drinks at the counter. They'll hand you your drinks right away and bring out the food to your table when it's ready.

- House Fried Pickles with harissa aioli ($5): pretty typical dish, but I do like the aioli!
- Curry Fries ($6): the description said "Hogwash fries smothered in curry" but it was really like "Hogwash fries with a little bit of curry". This dish was pretty underwhelming.
- All Day House Made Sausage ($11): breakfast sausage, maple, ginger, arugula, and fried egg. Quite a messy experience eating this!

To be honest, I really like this place for the ambiance and the drinks. but not so much the food.
author: Christine S.

description:
Good beer selection and the staff was super friendly. 

Mix of long benches and some two-person tables at the back by the bar.

Convenient for a quick drink before a show, and it wasn't too swamped until later in the evening.
author: Kevin L.

description: My picture post says it the best, but all I needed was apps and a beer to make my tummy happy and the options were perfect! Thank you!!
author: Maggie P.

description: Great atmosphere and good energy within the restaurant. Beer menu was a bit limited. Good food menu.
author: Brendan L.

description: I was in the city of San Francisco with my family and we chose this place to eat lunch. The sandwiches caught our eyes! As this place is relatively expensive, the sandwiches were quite average.
author: Kayla N.

description: This place is great. I got the burnin brock and a couple of IPAs. The beer selection is great and the brock was one of the best (and cheapest) things I've eaten in my 3 days doing the Pacific Coast Highway.
author: Steve W.

description: Came here with my bf and friend. Great food, fries were good. Do not get the curry fries, I really DID NOT like them. The smell was way to strong and made it squishy and soggy. The service isn't that great, I asked for aioli, but it didn't ever come, even after requests. The sausages are on point, but for $12 or $14, its not quite worth it. Not much parking in the area. No wait there, they have beer but no cocktail.
author: Amy Y.

description:
OMG. I got an Airbnb on Sutter. I ate here the first night. I ate here the second night. I ate here again on the third night. 

I couldn't stop. 

The lamb merguez sandwich. 

I don't even drink beer.

I couldn't stop.
author: Russ G.

description:
I'd stopped by this place a few times earlier in the day, and was pleased with their beer selection. Quite a large selection on tap, with a lot of local breweries, and the staff is quite knowledgeable. But, alas, the fried pickles are only available after 5, so I had to wait. Until this past weekend. They were pretty awesome. Might be the best I've ever had. Curry fries were great too. But, I was pretty disappointed with my habanero caesar salad. Not even a hint of spice, and not that much flavor.

But, whatever. Getting beer, fried pickles and fries, if they miss the mark somewhere, it might as well be the salad.
author: masa s.

description: Cool gastropub in SF, friendly and nice craft beer selection, good music.  Only thing is they close at 11pm.
author: Glenn O.

description: After some wedding prep shopping, my fiance and I stopped in tonight for a libation and a bite and just had a really wonderful experience. As someone with bad hearing, going here right at 5 on a Sunday was the ideal setup noise-wise. We were maybe the second group to walk in, grabbed a seat by the window and ordered a Tank 7, glass of Chardonnay and the Wurstfest sausage sampler with pickled vegetables and kraut.
