The fiance is originally from KC so the Tank 7 was already a big hit, the chardonnay was delicious but the real winner was the sausage. So. Delicious. Eating this dish took us back to our trip to Munich and we just really enjoyed every minute of it. The folks that run this place really took an interest in making sure everything was satisfactory which is much appreciated. We'll definitely be back.
author: Emily S.

description: Fried pickles delicious!!  Also, had the laughing monk mango gose { LGB} 11.5 Oz Large Belgian
author: Lylie H.

description: Good eats. Great variety of beer and wine. Friendly informal staff. Music was a bit too loud. Appreciated the variety of seating. The sausage varieties offered could have been stronger.
author: Kendall M.

description:
I wanted to go for their special of the day, but no longer available, so it's good to know things can sell out.  That likely meant it may have been good?  As a second choice I opted for the Abe Froman, it was good, though it could be a little more moist, was on the dry side.  The condiments and sauce helped.

The pickled seasonal vegetables were a delight.  I finished it all on my own, though it probably looked like a dish which could have shared.  All the veggies were a delight, but the standout unique one was the pickled strawberries. 

Good choice of beers, though they have only have wheat beer, it was good!
author: Kent H.

description: Dropped by for a beer around lunch. Bartenderess was pleasant, knowledgeable, helpful & unrushed. Interior of restaurant felt clean & fresh. Enjoyed my beer sitting at the window facing the sidewalk and people watching.
author: Kent D.

description:
Really loved this gastro pub. Fun to pick a craft beer, pretzel roll and homemade mustard were delish. 
I had the thanksgiving gobbler November special sausage. Yum. Thanksgiving in a bun. 
The hubby had the spicy chicken sausage and loved it. 
House made potato chips were to die for. 
Staff was friendly and playlist was amazing. Great way to spend a few hours on a Saturday afternoon.
author: Kristy M.

description: Great atmosphere and an always changing beer selection. A great place for beer enthusiasts. The hostess Allie especially created a warm atmosphere as soon as you walked in.
author: Adam G.

description: Super cool little place with a great beer selection. I was in SF for work and decided to go out for a beer early. Definitely glad I did as this place fills up right around 5:30-6! I tried the Sunday Gobbler sandwich and it was awesome!
author: Kristen B.

description:
Wonderful beer selection and even better sausages. Was one of my favorite meals in San Francisco- 
 def recommend
author: Matt W.

description: The Burnin' Brock here is amazing. Spicy sausage with a fried avocado? Paired with some harissa aioli? Yes please! The fried pickles here are also pretty good, but I'd rather just order a second Burnin' Brock instead. We also had a dessert that had fried cookie dough on top of vanilla ice cream. Yes, you heard that right. Fried cookie dough. May your dreams become more blissful and enlightening now that you know that exists.
author: Jay R.

description: Very cool place. A little loud for getting to know someone but drinks and food were affordable, tasty, and delivered in a timely manner. Definitely recommend for happy hour.
author: Abie W.

description:
Absolutely a must!!! 
DRINKS-- They have a huge section of beer. If you don't know what to get, ask one of the bartenders. They are super nice and they would provide you a sample before you commit to a full glass size. 
FOOD-- Good luck making a decision. Everrrrything is sooo good here. I suggest coming with a group of people so you can share/ try a little bit of everything. Curry fries, sausages, even their salad- B O M B dot  COM.
author: Eliza L.

description: Pretty decent beer selection, and good sausages.  The staff was really cool and attentive.  Would recommend.
author: Matt M.

description: Went to get a facial on sitter and was waiting for my uber one I ran into this little gem. A smaller bar with a great variety of beers, great ambiance and gourmet bar bites. I love the artwork on the walls. It's definitely a happy hour spot for the FiDi crowd and would come back again.
author: Linda L.

description: I came here complaining being too full from the day we had binge eating everything SF has to offer. Since we were too full we decided to order the Burnin' Brock and the warm Bread pudding to share. Everything was so flavorful and the decision we made to come here was nonregretable.
author: Imesh G.

description: Wow... Can I just say wow? A true gem in the heart of San Fransico. This place is absolutely fantastic and I would recommend to anyone visiting the area. AMAZING staff, the epitome of hospitality, and great vibes. If you want great beer and even better food, you need to visit! Ask for Brynn, she is the best!
author: Joe L.

description: My favorite gastropub in the City. Great food and a beer list that is always interesting
author: Greg A.

description: I was personally very satisfied with my chicken habanero sausage hot dog (even though my friends didn't like theirs). It is definitely expensive for a hot dog, and I'm not sure if I will come here again until I make substantially more money.
author: Rei T.

description: Wonderful gastropub built around sausages!!!  Can't go wrong - had the lamb sausage with pickled beer and cabbage topping - amazing!!  Loved it.
author: Eric S.

description: My girlfriends and I came here last week specifically to check out their curry fries. The fries definitely did not disappoint. We came on a Friday after work, had great food, drinks and overall great conversation. The fries are worth the visit!
author: Tracy C.

description:
Great beer, great service, great atmosphere and DELICIOUS sausages. 

This place is an excellent stop along a bar crawl of the city or a prime starting point for an evening out. The prices are extremely reasonable given the location of the bar/restaurant and quality of the food. 

I highly recommend the breakfast sausage. It's incredible.

You can seat yourself and order food at the counter. They'll give you a number to put on your table and serve you food there. The friendly staff also take care of clearing your plates and are super knowledgeable about what to try. If you're overwhelmed by the menu -- ask them.

I've gone a few times and will definitely be back again :)
author: Andrea D.

description: I liked this place a lot. The service was excellent, the food was good (though the portions felt very small for my Texan sensibilities), and I am not very knowledgeable about beers, but I was given great recommendations.
author: Sao B.

description:
Does the city need another gastropub? Well if they have an impressive 30-tap system featuring really good beer and serve up homemade sausage, then the answer is yes. Welcome Hogwash to the neighborhood. 

Sausage and beer - truly a complimentary match. Hogwash takes it one step further by making their sausages in house. Even Rosamunde doesn't do that. I had the Sheepish which was a moist and tasty lamb sausage paired with some bleu cheese and pickled cabbage and beet relish. It was a flavor combination that, while a little sloppy eating, was really satisfying. Also stole a bite of the Burnin' Bird which featured a chicken habanero sausage balanced out by some fried avocados and apple slaw - it was pretty tasty but think I liked my lamb sausage more. Also you should get some of the fried pickes because the harissa aioli is totally bomb!

Now onto the beer and what a lovely selection they have. I tried the Ommegang Abbey Dubbel, Deschutes' Fresh Squeezed IPA, The Linden Street English Bitter, and shared a Hog-Goblet of Firestone's Bohemian Pilsner. Yes they do goblet-sized glasses here which are roughly 3 and some pints large. Really loved the Ommegang with its caramelized molasses and clove flavor - it hit the right spots for a wet cold night. 

From the folks that brought you Zeki's and food from Le Beau Market, the service is friendly and attentive. Being literally just open a night, I'm sure there will be some initial kinks to iron out but I'm looking forward to coming back post-work for some sausage and beer.
author: Jon L.

description:
Outstanding sandwich.

Got the Burning Brock and it was perfect.  

Great ownership, great service, great atmosphere . . . it's funny -- the better a place is, the less I feel the need to write about it.  A five-star rating kinda says it all.
author: Eric V.

description: The HOGWASH, great beer tinders, killer music, good food and a great selection of eclectic beers from sours, Belgiums to the preverbal IPA's.  Solid place.
author: Paul C.

description:
This was legit. If you are looking to try a whole smorgasbord of bomb beers and have some awesome food then you have arrived. 

I found Hogwash on yelp when I was in town for work. I am so glad I gave it a rip. Not only was the beer and food better than amazing but the staff was awesome as well. As an out of towner I felt at home. It certainly isn't a dive but if your family ran a bar/restaurant you would probably treat your guests the way that the bar staff treated me. 

I am bringing my wife to San Francisco next spring and we are definitely stopping here. 

The only downside was that one of the bartenders was a Dodgers fan. At least he wasn't a Giants fan. Go Royals!
author: B C.

description: Checked out Hogwash tonight based on Yelp's 4.5 star rating. Ordered fries and a hotdog but the fries came out long after the hotdog. Meanwhile the beets dish came out ridiculously charred and the fried pickles were more batter than pickle. All in all, the food was not memorable. Service didn't fare any better. Staff came off inexperienced, awkward, and lacking in customer service skills. One star for decor and another for the Warriors game on the big screen.
author: Nancy L.

description: Thought this place was absolutely fantastic. Great food, awesome selection of beers on tap, very friendly staff behind the bar, this place totally caught me by surprise and I'll be coming back again next time I'm in SF.
author: Dev S.

description: A great place for a bite to eat with a great beer selection. We had great service- our bartender was really nice and personable, and even gave us a round of drinks on the house when the food took too long to get out. Great first stop in San Francisco!
author: Amanda K.

description: Impressive selection of craft beer, fantastic unique sausage sandwiches and excellent service. Vegetarian selections available as well.
author: David W.

description:
7 out of 5 stars. Hogwash is bomb.

Went here for my partner's birthday on his own recommendation because he'd heard good things about the place. Absolutely loved it. 

Amazing beers on tap, though I'm not too much of a beer drinker. I'm into belgian ales and lighter beers. The bartender recommended Einstk Witbier. An Icelandic ale which totally suited my tastes. My partner got the Epidemic vanilla stout which he also loved. Good beer. Check.

Onto the AMAZING food. We wanted to go somewhere else afterward so we were truly looking for lighter bites. Omg. Amazing fries. Just plain fries!! We didn't even get the curry one -- which I will definitely be back for. The seasoning and crispiness was 10 out of 5.

Fried pickles. Game over.

The thing is that the owners of Hogwash had a vision OR maybe they hired someone with a vision and they totally nailed it.

My only tiny qualm is that they you need to wait in a long line to close out your tab. All orders and close outs are up front only. I'd suggest closing out your tab every time instead of leaving it open. If you have a dinner reservation or show to catch, you'll need to wait in line again. It's a tiny annoyance, but just something to mindful of if you're pressed for time. Also, the night we were there someone let us close out our tabs at our table which was really kind and genuinely appreciated. 

Service is great here all around.

ANYWAY. Hogwash, you had me at your pickle fry batter. I'll tell everyone about you and I'll come here again. I promise.
author: Priti K.

description: In a word I'd say awkward the staff seemed not to have restaurant experience, super timid and kind of looking like they don't know what to do. Their is a hostess(?) that seems unnecessary as you order from the bar. Why seat us just for us to get up again it's just a huge wasted move which will clutter a restaurant and give it a weird vibe. Fries came out after we were done with our food (happens so not tripping too much). I feel the menu is over priced for what it is. The sausages were skinny in a huge bun so it was bun beets and cabbage mostly it cost $12. They need to step their food and service game up. Very Millennial in their approach, which may be cool for tech people, but not for running a restaurant. I think they have potential if they beef up Their sausage game and train their employees how to handle customers. this is clearly on management and ownership not the staff.
author: Jamil V.

description:
Due to a TI-83 snafu, I tipped short.
IherebyOU $1-something next time.

(Now the actual review.)

Was super excited to FINALLY eat here since the times I'd visited either the kitchen was closed for the night or the whole place was closed for holidays.

As wowmazing as its ingredient roster was, my BURNIN' BROCK (the one with fried avocado) was surprisingly flavorless. Were my tastebuds still killed from NYE craycraydindin? Buuut I tasted my soda & fried pickles #wecanpicklethat, so why not the hothog? Strange.

Had considered ordering the WURSTFEST #sausageparty #nobromo sampler but no longer felt inspired to do so after the unflavor I'd just eaten.

Loved the MUSIC though. Straight Motown, plus every other song or every other-other song was Stevie Wonder, only like my favest musish ev.
author: Dan B.

description:
Hogwash blew me away!

After searching on Yelp for an early dinner, my partner and I ended up here. We waited outside during their closed period until they opened up and I'm so incredibly happy that we did. 

The decor is absolutely adorable, I loveeee the lights in the front of bar. And the overall ambience is beautiful. 

When given the option to sit at the bar or at a table we chose to sit at the bar, which was the best choice! With so many beer options we talked to the bartenders and we able to try different ones and I ended up getting the Crispin Cider which was SO good!!

My partner and I both got the curry fries and added duck eggs and the lamb sausage. Just writing it makes my mouth water and my tummy rumble. Such a unique mixture of food but created a storm of deliciousness in my mouth. I definitely recommend adding the seasoning on the table as well, it adds flavor that compliment the curry and sausages so well. 

The service was incredible there. Nick was helping us out and being very attentive. I'm not sure if he was the manager or owner or what his position was but he was phenomenal and we all had such great conversations. At the end he gave us free dessert that he was testing out for the menu and it was yummy.

Overall, Hogwash is a must! Next time I'm in the Bay Area this is going to be my first stop. LOVE it here.
author: Jacki B.

description: My husband got take out and brought it back to the hotel.  The restaurant was busy but friendly workers.  The chicken apple sausage sandwich with pickled slaw and fried avocado was good but messy.  The fries were too salty though.
author: Cheyenne P.

description: Our bill came out to $2x.59 (either $24.59 or $25.59) and Im pretty sure I gave them 20% tip (I used be a server as well. I always tip more than 20%) which totaled $30. But they charged $30.59 instead. I threw the receipt away but I remember clearly that I gave them $30 because I and my friend were going to split everything half on the trip to San Fran. I know it's only 59 cents and it's really nothing to me but I guess this meant alot to that poor server. I mean who knows these servers cheat on tips from every tables? Please be careful on giving them tips.
author: Monica A.

description: Great atmosphere- food and beer- would highly recommend it. The staff is friendly and great service - fried pickles are awesome !!
author: DA V.

description:
My husband and I love gastrobups. So when we heard of Hogwash we wanted to check it out ourselves. We were staying at a hotel near by, and it made it easy to walk. So, my husband and me with my 5 year old walked. When we walked in we  noticed the clean and sophisticated decor. All the tables are high top style tables, and the area was spacey although the restaurant is not that huge itself. We were placed on a waiting list, and quickly got in line to order drinks. As we reviewed the menu, we noticed many beers from San Diego. They have over 40 beers on tap! When it was time to order, the hostess approached us to tell us our table was ready. That was quick! So we ordered our entrees as well. 

We ordered the sausage platter $28, curry fries $7, fried housemate pickles $6, and the piggie $8 for my son. The curry fries were light on the curry, but they lacked flavor. Once they got cold, they weren't good. All the sausages were good. However, they were extremely spicy. This is what surprised me! I am not sure if this is how the sausage is here usually, or if they were having a off night. No joke it was spicy. Even the hot dog that my son received was spicy. Glad I tried it before he took a bite. I flagged the waitress down right away, and she was very friendly. I told her what was up, and she completely understood. She said it would take a few minutes before the new hot dog came out, and I was fine with that. The fried house made pickles were good, but again the dipping sauce they provided was just too spicy. 

Overall, I give 5 stars for customer service. The hostess, the waitress, and the bartender were beyond nice, and it stood out. The ambience was warm and welcoming, but the music was too loud. I had to yell for my husband to hear me. And, after 8 o'clock the volume seemed to go up. The food was ok. The part that stands out the most..spicy!

I cannot comment on parking, as we walked here from our hotel.
author: Anna C.

description: Hip bar located close to union square. Hard to get a private table. Most likely you'll be sharing with at least one other group. Good atmosphere. The food is decent. Obviously containing all types of sausage. Beer selection is great. Lots of beers you won't find other places.
author: Matt E.

description: The food tasted so good it helped me look past the harsh reality that I'm not hipster enough to dine here.
author: Lane H.

description: Really nice beer selection from Cali and the pacific NW.  Small menu w/~6 sausage based sandwiches of pork, chicken or lamb and some pretty stellar potato chips on the side.
author: Kacy G.

description: The pretzel roll is a must-try. The ambience is also great, and they have quite a respectable selection of draught beers, including some tasty local brews.
author: David L.

description: Super simple menu that is outstanding. Great beer choices. Really enjoyed the food and place.
author: Bill M.

description: Went here for dinner on St Patricks's Day last weekend and it was awesome. I got the Sheepish with lamb sausage, pickled veggies and blue cheese and it's one of the best sausage sandwiches I've had. My wife got the vegetarian Hogless and loved it too. The beer selection here was amazing too.
author: John G.

description:
Quick: An casual upscale bar and selective sausage joint in typical fashion. Good sausage sandwiches, a good selection of beers, communal seating and easy going staff. Hogwash is enjoyable, delicious and lives up to expectations.

Pros: Yummy sandwich, good salad and typical chill, loud bar atmosphere

Cons: None, they do everything you would expect

Food I Tried: Abe Froman sandwich, kale salad - Both tasty

Long Winded Review
Hogwash lives in that realm of modern gastropubs. That casual stylish feel that most gastropubs have. You know it's slick but also unassuming and everyone is chill. Seating is communal if you care for that sort of thing and the motif is exposed wood. You can picture it.

But the food, is quite nice. The menu is straight forward, you have your sandwiches all of which sound tasty. I went with the Yelp favorite, Abe Froman, Beef, cheddar & bacon sausage thousand island dressing, chopped romaine, tomato, pickles. This one worked, though I though the sandwich was on the small side, it is suitable for a modest meal. The sausage was flavorful and all the dressings added a bit of depth, to what can sometimes be a monotonous food item when we talk sausauge or hot dogs.

I went with the Kale Salad as well, seen in Yelp reviews and that guy is delicious. Evenly dressed, soft vinaigrette that punches flavor without being too prominent. It works best as a side unless you drop in a sausage on top or something.

Overall I'd say Hogwash lives up, is enjoyable and will meet all of your expectations.
author: Anh N.

description:
YUMMY!  The sausage are bursting with flavor and the beer selection is endless.  I got the chicken sausage sandwich, which I thoroughly enjoyed. It's filled with fennel and other unique flavors.  I also ordered a side of fries, which came with a curry sauce topping and a fried egg - which I wasn't too crazy about.  I had the Moonlight Reality Czech beer, it was perfect.

The roasted beet salad was good and large enough to share.

I'd eat and definitely drink here again.
author: Julie G.

description:
I'm sure many are thinking: sausage and beer... yeah right!

No fear, Hogwash is here! This spot is an amazingly non-crowded beer bar on the edges of Union Square (~4 blocks uphill from). 

Hogwash as a decent variety of beer on tap (-1 star because it could be better) and a pretty fun selection of sausage. It's a place you can take your vegetarian counterpart (leek sausage, salads, fries, etc...) and enjoy 4-5 different types of delicious meat yourself!

I should note, it took me really off-guard that you order at the bar and sit down. The look of the place is a server-only spot, but yet you're required to get up and order... Not a problem, just threw me off. I'm sure it wouldn't be immediately known to people walking in that you won't be getting a server!
author: Kerry G.

description: Just went here for the first time in a while and it was heaven in my mouth. Got this amazing honey lavender beer too. Sausage + fried pickles were incredible!
author: Rachel F.

description: Got off an Uber and found this nice Gastro pub for lunch. Very nice atmosphere. Staff was very helpful being our first time here. Ordered the Abe Froman and the Cali Club. Both were absolutely delicious!
author: Todd O.

description: Holy moly. Awesome sandwich. A very good place to go if you want something unique and local not to far from the touristy areas. The chicken sausage sandwich they feature is the bomb. Deep fried avocado... super nice touch.
author: Jeremy W.

description: Excellent quick bites before we headed to the Color Factory! House-made salt and pepper potato chips were fantastic! We ordered a side of them as a starter, not realizing our dogs would come with chips as well. I had the breakfast sausage with a duck egg and arugula, and the roll was tender and although the egg could have been runnier, it still made for an awesome pairing. Fantastic spot, not too busy on a weekday noontime.
author: Laura M.

description: Just had the best lunch. We were exploring something to eat as we were starving and just got to town. Such a great concept. Not too many options but makes it easy to choose. Beer selection is GREAT! The owner, Paula, was so sweet and helpful! Love supporting local business and we will be back!
author: Misty L.

description: We were so busy enjoying the amazing selection of craft beer and sandwiches that I totally forgot to take a picture of our sandwiches. By far my favorite spot near Union Square. If we lived in San Francisco we'd be regulars for sure. Loved it!
author: Alma A.

description:
Hogwash is a beer lover's paradise.  

Upon entering, patrons will notice two distinct areas: the front has high ceilings with funky space age lights, while the rear where the bar is located feels more cave-like. Whichever are you choose, you should be ready for a beer extravaganza. 

With more than 30 beers on tap, there will be a selection for even the most jaded beer connoisseur. The beer offerings are mostly from California, but there are a few from Belgium and one from Germany for europhiles.  For non-beer lovers, there are A few wines by the glass, but the star here is obviously the beer. 

If all the drinking makes you hungry, the house-made sausage sandwiches are a good choice. The "All Day" pork breakfast sausage, maple, ginger, arugula, topped with fried duck egg ($12.50) is a standout. Hogwash even thinks of vegetarians with a delicious "Hogless" sausage sandwich featuring butternut squash sausage, barley, sage, creme fraiche, cherry tomatoes, frisée, pickled cabbage ($12.50). Fries, a few salads, pretzel bites, and pickles provide good accompanying dishes.

If you are thirsty and near Union Square, Your destination should be Hogwash.
author: CJ G.

description: Visiting San Fran, I thought I would give this place a go. I had the sampler and a pretzel roll. The food, beer and bar tenders were great. I highly recommend it to anyone visiting the area.
author: Daryl M.

description: I always get the Burnin Brock and curry fries. There no waiters so you order your food at the bar along with your drink. Place does get packed in the evening and it is a bit loud but it is a must try if your in the city.
author: Sandy S.

description: Great vibes, clean, friendly bar with great sours and other choices of beer. Good service and progressive bar food menu.
author: Eric O.

description: Awesome food, really great service and try the Vanilla Sprout, really good!! Highly recommend it!!
author: Whizkid P.

description:
So you know how as a tourist you go to a restaurant and when you return to a city you want to go to a place familiar, and sometimes the second trip just does not live up to the hype or your memory of the first visit? Thankfully, this is not that place. This was my second visit and the meal surpassed my first memory. 
The Abe Froman is absolutely delicious, such a good mix of flavors, basically a burger but in hot dog form. Even the child's hotdog had such good flavor. 
The wait staff is very attentive, and the bartenders were very knowledgeable about their beers on tap. 
I will definitely return to this place during future trips.
author: Raquel B.

description: I can't imagine what anyone would not like about this place! It's fun, non pretentious, lively and the food is stellar. We always get the curry fries with a duck egg and their beer list is the best in town. In a sea of tourists, Hogwash is truly an oasis of beer and sausages.You can tell that they take pride in their offerings and the staff is always awesome. Go here now, you won't be disappointed!
author: Stuart T.

description:
Fantastic. Great barrel age dark stout and a super tasty Sheepish (lamb, beets, blue cheese)! Friendly outgoing staff. 

Whole lotta tasty sausage in the house.
author: marc s.

description:
Another 30-tap pub in the neighborhood, except this one has a mix of local, state, domestic, and foreign offerings, which is a departure from Hopwater Distribution and Liquid Gold Taproom. Nor is the selection brewer-focused like Mikkeller.

The food is good, though showing less variety than Hopwater or Mikkeller. The house-made pickles are great, both served straight and fried.
author: David S.

description:
Stopped at this place thinking that it was happy hour....the waitress informed us they didn't do happy hour? We got there a little after 5pm on a Monday. Not sure- but decided to commit anyways because we already had parking. 
We ordered some curry fries, beets and goat cheese and enjoyed there large selection of beers on tap! I had the Lagunitas Dark Swan Red Sour and loved it. Hogwash had a dark and cozy atmosphere. Kinda pricey (we were expecting happy hour) but it was a cool, casual place that I would go to again for drinks.
author: Abigail T.

description:
The sausages were decent, just overpriced in my opinion.  I had the All Day and while it was excellent that it was piping hot, the toppings didn't contribute enough flavor so it was overall a bit bland.  Maybe that's what the mustard and hot sauce are for, so I definitely helped myself!  My friend's lamb sausage, on the other hand, was much more well-balanced thanks to the pickled cabbage/beet.  

The beer list was pretty good.  But onto the fried pickles... kind of an embarrassment I think.  For $6 you get a pathetic little plate of sliced pickles.  There were probably 8-10 slices in total, seriously the saddest plate ever.  In terms of taste, they were just ok - the batter was crisp, but the pickles themselves didn't taste any fresher or better than Vlasic pickles.  Sheesh.
author: Beatrice W.

description: I love this place, but I wish their beers weren't so damn hoppy...
author: Lola P.

description: Great selection of beer, amazing food, had some strange options (like having pickled peach as a side) that turned out to taste really nice - all in all was great service, atmosphere, music. Everyone had a great experience.
author: Rory C.

description:
This is between a 3 and 4 star joint but I'll keep it at 3 for now.

When I first got here it was the tail end of the lunch rush and there were lots of people placing/picking up orders.

I sat at the bar and the two bartenders seemed a bit too engaged with just a couple of others at the bar.

After finally getting a beer I looked at the sausage menu and wasn't too impressed. It was $11 bucks for a sausage with chips, I believe. I've been to my fair share of sausage joints and I wasn't feeling this menu.

Luckily a bartender stopped by and gave me a try of a really tasty beer and he hooked me in for a second beer. We talked a bit about other breweries in the Bay and I was in a lot better mood when I left.

I'm glad that bartender took the time to engage me a bit, otherwise I would've left with a lot worse impression of the place.

I'm still not sold on those sausages but maybe I'll make another visit for the beer.
author: Art O.

description:
This place is awesome! They have an incredibly good beer list and the bartender Paula was super helpful and cool in making a recommendation on what to order.

French fries were on point. Will def want to visit this spot soon!
author: Eric T.

description: Their sausage platter was delicious! Went there with a few friends for beer and snacks. Everything we had was great. Great, chill atmosphere.
author: O K.

description: I think this is the best lamb sausage I've ever had. In many restaurants it's dry and overly spicy but here it was moist and perfectly seasoned. If you're interested in casual dining give it a try. We just happened to go here because we are staying in a different part of town than we normally do and we were looking for something convenient. Very good choice
author: David P.

description:
AMAZING!
I went for a casual bite on a Saturday night with a friend. We had the Abe Frohman, fried pickles, fries, and the dessert. It was all amazing! To quote my friend "they nailed the salty/sweet hot and cool flavors. 
It's a great place to sit and chat, the atmosphere is very casual and the food is great.
author: Mike G.

description:
Okay this place is actually really good but I'm giving in 3 stars in hopes for future revisions in 2 areas.  A) the music was way too loud.  I could barely hear myself think let alone try to have a convo with my group.  B) their vegetarian option is the worst.  I normally prefer vegetarian food, and upon reading the description it sounded delicious causing me to pick it over a meat option, but that was a mistake.  Super mushy, bland, and just not good.  Had to drench it in mustard and hot sauce to take it down, garnishes were good. I realize this place specializes in sausage, but in my experience even places as such are able to put out at least one good meatless option.

Everyone else in my group is smart and got actual meat, and the general consensus was that the sausage itself was excellent but the bread was just blah and almost took away from the sandwich (luckily they do allow you to order it breadless so this is no big deal!).  We also ordered the curry wurst fries and fried pickles to share, both of which was delicious.  

Would definitely go back, but hope they are able to make these small changes.
author: Sonia S.

description: Great food and great beer.  The staff is super cool and Paula is great.  A good knowledge of super good craft beer, and good staff!
author: Dan H.

description: The staff is incredibly friendly, and the Wurst Fest is magical.  It's near impossible to pick a favorite, so if you're stuck between sandwiches flip a coin and plan a second trip.
author: Mike B.

description: Hogwash is awesome!  Great beer, tasty food and a perfect atmosphere. I travel to San Fran a few times each year and every time I seek out Hogwash. I'm never disappointed.
author: Will T.

description: Great beer selection. The sausage plate was pretty good; freshly made links of beef, pork, chicken and lamb. Interior was designed pretty well too. After 4 they have fried pickles.
author: Daniel G.

description:
Wowza! I really enjoyed my visit to Hogwash.  Really cool gastropub in the Union Square area. They don't take reservations and they get busy, so get there early if possible. They have an extensive selection of beers to the point where I got confused and I said I would get whatever my friend was having. I am not beer aficionado, so I get confused easily. Don't judge!

The menu was full of sausage option...Hogwash...get it. The food was great. Highly recommend the sausage sampler. Service was super friendly and nice.  And oh..almost forgot...they only take orders at the bar, so don't wait at the table thinking someone is going to come to you.
author: Sunil R.

description: Grabbed lunch at Hogwash today. Great selection of beers, which was awesome. The sausage sandwiches were excellent.
author: Chad B.

description: Its lovely to have such a great atmosphere so close to the over-packed and touristy Union Square - but the food and beer selection is the driver.  Unique, tasty and a wonderful place to gather.  A big fan.
author: Matthew D.

description: Randomly walked into Hogwash with 3 friends trying to find somewhere to watch the NCAA championship, and this place was perfect: quick seating with large TV, great bar food, and solid beer list. You order at the counter and servers bring the food, so it's really casual, and it was nice and busy when we visited.
author: Nick D.

description:
Artisanal sausages and other fare. This place does it right. Great casual atmosphere for after work brew or weekend outing with that special one or ten. 

Impressive beer selection and great casual vibe. I highly recommend Hogwash and that's not hogwash.

Get the Abe Froman. It's nirvana.
author: James R.

description: The all day sandwich and homemade chips are great. Hogwash has a great selection of great local beers. Music and service is great as well.
author: Tiffani w.

description: Food was pretty good but a bit overpriced for the portions and not the best service. Cool vibes inside and a very well curated draft list of beers. Hoping for some small improvements and menu changes to make this place worth a return visit!
author: Andy L.

description: I met up with a friend on a Wed. during Dreamforce so it was pretty crowded.  However, our waiter was very attentive and got a seat for us right away, which I really appreciated. We also tried the curry fries, beets and pretzel, and I tried the cider, all very good, especially the pretzel and fries.  Great spot to go to for a drink and appetizers and great service.
author: a f.

description:
Just got into town so stopped in for a quick dinner. The place smells amazing - if you love the smell of pork. Lots of beers on tap as well 

We had the fried pickles with a habanero aioli, a Caesar salad and an Abe Froman. I think with a larger group, we would have tried the sausage sampler.  Also ordered the ice cream for dessert - topped with a caramel sea salt and small cookie dough balls. Nice finish. 

Restaurant got very busy around 7 pm. You could tell it was a popular spot. Community tables for some diners.
author: Nora B.

description:
As my step-dad always says, every good Yelp review starts with a story, so here we go. I was meeting this cutie for a date at a sushi place down the street. Long story short, she didn't show up. Defeated (I just got out of a 3 month relationship and thought this was a new leaf, a turning point) I asked Siri for the nearest bar. I don't particularly like beer, but pretending I was somebody else (who likes beer) made me feel a little less lonely. 

The one negative thing I have to say is that I got there at 10:15 and had to wait until 11am to enter the place. I studied abroad in Europe in college, so I know a real gastropub would be open by 10am. However hours of operation are well communicated, so I cannot hold this against the establishment.

With that aside, I asked the bartender to surprise me with a beer, as I don't really know my way around the ol' barley pops. I think he must have spilled a bit of peanut butter in the drink (possibly on the glass?) because it had a strong peanut taste, and tasted AMAZING. I've been back every day since. My personal tip: ask for peanut butter in your beer. You won't regret it. 5 stars!
author: Jeff C.

description:
Hogwash = Delicious beers and bites! Pretty simple equation, if you ask me.

Came here with some co-workers the other evening. The owners were kind enough to reserve a few tables for our motley crew of 10. The set-up is very simple. You go to the counter; order one of their many brews on tap; pay up; bring your drinks back to the table. Since I'm not a beer guy, I ordered a glass of bubbles.

Our group split a few menu items, including the fries, the beet salad, and my new favorite thing in the world... Fried Pickles! Where has this been all my life?! These things are highly addictive.

Hogwash offers a very clean, casual setting for true beer/happy hour lovers. I really admire what they've done with the space. Service was super friendly. All the customers seemed happy. Good vibes all around.

Although I'm not a beer guy, I'd def come back (if only for those Fried Pickles).
author: Kevin B.

description: Nice place to go. Delicious, amazing, don't walk by. I'm glad my friend brought me here. Good thing about this place is union square so close
author: Denny D.

description: Great beer selection! Bartender gave me a few samples to try when I told him I really like blonde beers. I snacked on the beets as well and they were sooo good! The olives were also very tasty. Their food menu is pretty limited, but it's a hip atmosphere and fun place to get beers & small bites!
author: Jamie L.

description:
Single ladies, take note: Walk into Hogwash with a fresh coat of lipstick and a cute gal pal, sit at the bar and attention will be all yours. At least for a few minutes.

I didn't come here looking for male admirers, but had a tiny little Scarlett O'Hara moment upon entering. Once you hit your 30's, those occurrences are few and far between, so cherish them as much as possible.

Even better than attention from the guys behind the bar? Beer and bites. Even a wino like Yours Truly can appreciate craft brew on tap paired with battered pickles and French fries. Hogwash does it right, not too light not too heavy. 

Love how Union Square/Lower Nob Hill keeps adding mid-level, classy-ish joints to the 'hood. They're not "raise your pinky in the air" fancy, but definitely an upscale alternative to what used to be lurking behind a greasy storefront. Definitely an improvement.
author: Abby S.

description: Nice place we found while out touring the San Francisco Union Square area.  Service was awesome and my husband had the Burnin' Brock and a beer and he loved it!
author: Alice E.

description: Unfortunately, my experience wasn't great. The service was friendly. But - I ordered at the counter - the poem sausage with homemade pickles. I paid and I sat at the window counter. After a long enough wait, the lady I ordered from told me that they had no more of the pork hot dogs left. She sounded like she had known this at the time of ordering but had just forgotten to mention it to me. This is fine, but I had been waiting a while before this. I ordered a different meal that I wasn't nearly as excited about. She offered me a free drink because of the mistake. The homemade pickles came some after. I finished them and a while later my replacement hotdog arrived. Obviously would have been nice to have eaten them together.
author: Kitty S.

description: Great service, beer list, and prices.  I didn't eat, but my friend said his snack was very good too.
author: Brian B.

description:
I'm happy to give Hogwash  a well deserved 5 stars. 
I thought I had reviewed this place on my last visit but apparently it was just afterglow for a while so here is the official review.
On my first visit a few months ago they had a beer that was very hard to find in the City. I believe it was Nelson by Alpine. They actually had an Alpine rep in who I chatted with for a bit and if memory serves they had something else from Alpine that blew my socks off but for the life of me I can't remember what it was. I also ordered the brat tasting platter, which far exceeded my expectations for tasty brat with my beer. The accompanying mustards are just perfect.
Tonight was my second visit in as many months. One thing I noticed is how genuinely awesome the staff is. The host is a genuinely nice guy who tries very hard to accommodate and make sure you're happy. The bartenders are really superb individuals. You can't fake it at some point, and the staff is all very high quality.
Tonight, after some deliberation, I opted for the chicken habanero sausage sando and a few beers (they had the revered Cosmic Dust and Duet by Alpine which pleased this IPA aficionado). The sando was just incredible. Bursting with flavor and fresh, it is why Germans go nuts over brats and beers, simply put. Squirt a bit of the fresh mustard on it and you have a real party in your mouth. Hogwash is A-OK in my book and I look forward to my next visit.
author: Matt H.

description: The sandwiches at Hogwash seemed reasonably priced. Howeve, they turned out to be 6 -7 inches long and we were terribly disappointed by the small portion. Fortunately, they were quite filling. I had the All Day sandwich which had a sunny side-up duck egg over the home made pork sausage. It was very good. The beers were reasonably priced. However, I don't like beer. This place is really a place for beer lovers.
author: Grace S.

description: Cool environment, and I like the idea of a sausage and beer place. We only had a couple beers, but the food looked good.
author: Benjamin R.

description: We heard about this place from my friend's brother who lives in the City and frequents this place often. It's pretty new. We had a show to attend at 7 so we swung by here right when they opened at 5pm on a weekend. There were already people inside so maybe they open early. Haha. Anyways, you order and pay at the counter. You can get your beers right then and you also get a number to put on your table and they'll bring your food out to you. There were three of us and we shared the habanera Caesar salad, their special of the month, the Olive Garten sandwich, and curry fries with a fried egg. The salad was a little unique with the spicy dressing. But it wasn't too spicy, which was fine with me. The sandwich has an olive, fennel and pork sausage with pickled peppers, cucumbers, feta, and pesto aioli sauce. Delicious. And the best thing had to be the curry fries. We paid a little extra and got the fried duck egg on top - good choice.  Also they have some cool beers on tap. I had the strawberry sour beer. They were nice and let me try a little bit of it before I decided to get a full glass. It's a super chill place to hang out. Though not very big.  Décor is wooden, modern. There's a mix of seating - bar, high tables, lower picnic type tables, etc. Seems like a cool place to be when in the city.
author: Alison W.

description:
Reminds me a bit of wurst in Toronto, I wish the wursts were better here tho. Small role inconsequential wurst

Great draft selection though!
author: Lukas R.

description: Great place for a pint. The beer selection is well curated and covers a lot of local brewers as well as a few imports. The bar food is very good. Had some of the best roast beets I can remember.
author: Marvin H.

description: The info  about the time they close is not correct. We went there tonight and at 10pm they were closed and told us they could not serve us ... be aware of the time you go there
author: Alessandra F.

description:
First night for the monthly special (Southern Gobbler - turkey & sage sausage with cornbread stuffing) and it was amazing! 

Hubs had the curry fries - I'm not a curry person but he loved them and I had a few with no sauce on them and they were good quality, fresh cut fries...i.e. they were very obviously recently potatoes. 

I also tried a bite of his Abe Froman, which is apparently a gold standard. It was really good, but in the battle of the sausages my gobbler won!

My only caution...I happen to like the music choice (fairly hard core rap/hip hop), but I could see that being a turn off for some folks.
author: Jenny J.

description: Very good draught beer selection, good finger food, cozy tapas bar feeling, better for couples than families.
author: Frederic N.

description: House-made sausages and a fantastic selection of draft beers! Highly recommended! My bartenders, Nebiel and Ryan, made the night a lot of fun!
author: James L.

description: Ordered an all day sausage sandwich with fries which totaled to $18.99. Food was pretty bland, and  it was a small portion considering the price. The sausage was juicy though, and the staff was very friendly. The atmosphere of the place is nice too. But i wouldn't recommend the place because of the overly priced food that doesn't taste that great.
author: Jeannie N.

description: Nice place with good beer and good bartenders.   All the food they have is sausages, which isn't my thing.  I left after having a beer, and I almost said "I didn't feel like a sausage tonight", but then I realized I was in San Francisco so I just left.  Anyway,  it seemed like a nice place.
author: Mark T.

description: I am not a big sausage fan but Hogwash has the best sausage. Their sausage sandwiches are incredible. I tried their habanero sausage sandwich. The toppings included apple which gave it a sweetness that melted in your mouth. The French fries are double fried and had just the right salt. Hogwash is the type of bar/restaurant that brings me the San Francisco. Beer menu had great local choices. They even have a goblet that holds 55 ounces of beer.
author: David P.

description: Great little bar and restaurant. Ryan was our bartender and he was awesome - knew a lot about the menu and area. We enjoyed hanging out at the bar and now look forward to checking out some of his recommendations around town.
author: Allison R.

description:
Holy H-E-Double Hockey Sticks. We came here for a post Sharks-winning-game-7 dinner, so it was around 9ish. We were able to snag a seat at the bar almost immediately. Service was fast, the decor was awesome, and the FOOD. 
I...almost don't have words (except I have a lot). We started with the fried pickles, which are fried in beer batter and I'm assuming crack because we could not stop eating them. Thankfully, as soon as the pickles were gone, our sausages showed up (or I'm SURE there'd have been withdrawals, there was basically a fight for the last pickle.) 
I got the Abe Froman. You know. The Sausage King of Chicago! (If you don't understand this reference, do yourself a favor and download Ferris Bueller's Day Off; you're welcome.) As a native Californian, In'N'Out is important to me and this sausage tasted like if Unicorns made you the best burger from In'N'Out but in a sausage with a freshly baked bun and better secret sauce. I'm serious. Freshly chopped romaine, perfect cherry tomatoes, a little bit of je ne sais quoi which means MAGIC in french (it doesn't actually...) But. I'd eat this every day. 
They also have a giant selection of really amazing beers! 
I'm adventurous, so I went with a Strawberry Sour from Almanac. Which was delicious. My Fiance tried like 7 different beers and then I don't remember what he picked, but he loved it. 
He also go the ALL DAY sausage, that has a fried duck egg on it. He preferred his, I preferred mine, to each their own. 
Basically, it's all super delicious. Go here.
author: Ashley S.

description:
As a pub, 4 stars! As a restaurant, maybe 3.

There isn't too much seating, but our group got seated right away. It's communal seating, which was fine for us but unfortunate for our table-mates, since we had just gotten back from running.

With food, we went all out:
 - curry fries with a duck egg (pretty tasty)
 - vegetable salad (kind of sad looking. A pie pan with an expensive handful of vegetables. But it had a few amazing bites.)
 - fried pickles (very tasty)
My friend also got a sausage, and with 2 beers each, our total between two people was $80. We left mostly full, but it wasn't an incredible amount or especially fine food. 

The beer recommendations were good.

There's a large focus on sausages. Apparently, one was vegetarian, but it could have been labeled better. I overlooked it, and a meat-eating friend accidentally ordered it!

I might come back for a beer and some of those fried pickles, but probably not for dinner.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Visiting San Fran from Austin. Foodie paradise here.  Shopping around Union Square.  Came across Hogwash.  Service was super friendly, met Ryan and Walker. Gave us beer / wine suggestions.  Then the FOOD.  Love this concept, hand made, fresh sausage sandwiches.  I had the lamb w/ pickled cabbage & beer relish... my wife had the chicken habanero with fried avocado (wow) and Harissa aioli. Super complex, layered flavor profiles.  Extensive beer list (I had a Belgium quad, my wife had a french rose). 

This place was a real treat and a great value.
author: Kelly G.

description: Absolutely delicious! I had the Sheepish sausage (yummy lamb) sandwich and my husband got the Olive Garten (mediterranean taste) sausage sandwich which we both enjoyed. We also shared the Kale salad which had a nice light avocado vinaigrette dressing which I loved. The beer selection is also pretty good. Cute atmosphere but you have to order at the bar. The waiter does bring your food to you.
author: Miki D.

description: The wash (beer) is good and the bar staff is knowledgeable.  The hog is really a fairly limited selection of sandwichs and sausages and a couple salads.  I am not really a huge fan of their sausages and have tried all of them.  There is a certain taste here that many might like, not so much for me.  Nice environs.
author: Glenn S.

description:
What an amazing place to hang out with friends and grab great food. The sausages here are delicious!!! There is something here for everyone. What an incredible selection of beers! Oh and did I mention their fried pickles. DELICIOUS! 

Side note- if you can't decide what you want to drink because they have an extensive beer list, then just ask their knowledgeable and friendly staff. Very helpful.
author: Anhthu T.

description:
Just came here for a late night bite after an office happy hour. My friend was all confused and was asking me "what's a sausage sando?". I said it was probably a sausage in a roll. He replied "oh, like a hot dog! Why don't they just say that?".

So yeah, this is a sausage place. Not a lot for vegetarians.

I had some curry fries with a fried duck egg and the fried pickles. The curry fries were just standard chippies with curry sauce. The serving is generous enough. We ordered 2 of the curry fries to share between the 5 of us and for 3 of us it's all we had for dinner. I felt stuffed afterwards. The fried pickles weren't that good. The pickles were fancy cucumbers - should be more briney to offset the deep frying - and flavorless. Also sliced too thin for deep frying.
author: Jean K.

description:
So so so good! I felt like I was cheating on Mikeller a little bit since both places are very similar.

I had the Magnolia Blue Bell and it was crisp and perfect. Not funky but still interesting. The bartender was really spot-on with the recommendation and I liked being able to try  the beer before committing to an entire glass.

We started off with the fried pickles and shared the Burnin' Brock sausage sando which has spicy sausage and fried avocado... Yes FRIED AVOCADO. Who DOES that?!?! This. Place. And it works perfectly. The sausage was actually really spicy and I can handle the heat. Food was delicious and I would come back here just to try the other sausages.

Space is modern and airy. Some low tables and counter height as well. Not a huge space and it started to get a bit crowded by the time we left (around 715 on a Wed Night). 

Definitely adding this to my rotation for date night/happy hour/catch up with friends bars!
author: Semuteh F.

description:
This is a nice little pub. It has a good beer selection of small Brewers and popular ones, interesting takes on "pub" food, like curry fries, and a very young, busy feel. The service was the definite highlight, as the gal handling it was probably one of the best front-of-house people I've ever seen; managed seating people, taking orders, and checking on groups fluidly. It is small but insanely busy, so I was not only impressed with her skills but her friendly demeanor and amazing memory.

Cons: BUSY AND LOUD! Not the place to have a friendly conversation. Food was okay, but could have been better (cold, odd flavor profiles etc)

Enjoyable first stop on a pub crawl. Would return.
author: Kristina M.

description: I got the "All Day" which includes pork sausage and friend duck egg. An interesting but delicious combination. I'm eager to try the other sausage dishes!
author: Gui K.

description: My only complaint is that they don't open until 5!!  LOL!!!  Found this place on yelp and waited the entire day for the to open so we could see what the buzz is about.  Great urban vibe - small space but tables rotate in and out and its worth waiting.  We ordered the abe foreman with a fried egg, French fries, the olive garden and craft beer.  Their craft beer list is great - definitely good rotators / options on there.  I'm a saison fan (which they had).  They had a selection of each genre - always appreciated.  It was definitely a good sandwich but a little disappointing when you have to dissect thee sandwich to find the ingredients that were advertised (black olives), arugula missing, very little cucumber.  The abe foreman was good.  The French fries were cooked to perfection.  Really enjoyed this place.
author: Stephanie I.

description: My boyfriend and I came here on a Friday night and it was pretty busy. I can see why though! They have a very good beer selection and good food. I tried the chicken sausage hotdog and it was really good. Different than anything I had tried before but so delicious. It has a pretty cool ambiance, with a cool picture of Betty Page by the bar. I would definitely recommend this place for anyone looking for a spot to have a few drinks.
author: Ivana C.

description: It was my first experience, i am not a sausage type of girl, but this was super yummy! The special this week tasted more like a gyro than just minced meat in an intestine casing.
author: Leila G.

description: Awesome selection of beers, cool/fresh food and great service. Decoration is industrial hipster but you still feel comfortable there.
author: Tiffany Z.

description: Amazing beer selection and a super fun atmosphere. The staff is wonderfully friendly and make the night such a great time. A must in Union Square.
author: Kyle L.

description:
Wow.  There is simply nothing wrong with this place.  Top to bottom.  Solid.  Great variety of brew.  Liberal with the samples to get you to really taste and enjoy what you are ordering.  I had the Gulden Quad which was full of flavor.  Not many places have local plus international brews On Tap.

The food was also very good.  Sausage.  Very good sandwich bread and loved the crunchy flavor of the pickles, or were they cucumbers.  Great!  I had the Abe Froman.  Amazing.  Another in.my party had the hogless.  Great option for a sausage place to have a meatless sausage.  

Service was superurb.  Super friendly and very knowledgeable.  

This is a real gem if you just want to have a beer, relax.and enjoy some great sausage sandwiches ... or even if you just want a great brew and great service.
author: Brent W.

description:
Lots of variety of beers to choose from here.  I liked how they had light to dark from different areas of the country.  The place was small and also not very well lit.  Good thing that I only wanted to watch the Giants game and just needed about 30-45 mins to finish it before my next engagement.

I saw the guy next to me with fried pickles so I thought why not?  I ordered it with my 2nd beer and I found out that this is almost the perfect snack to go with beer drinking.  It's salty and deep fried and very satisfying.  It's almost like a palate cleanser for your next sip.

Bigger parties of six or more sit on the outside where the smaller groups sit near the bar.  I'll come back again if I'm lucky enough to find a space to park nearby.
author: Ben H L.

description: We came by after a show nearby and had the curry fries with a duck egg and sausage on top. It was fantastic! Also had a Two Rivers pomegranate cider that was dangerously good. Or maybe it was huckleberry? Looking forward to going back and finding out!
author: Charlie P.

description:
Perhaps it was the hunger from having fought through the Chinese New Year parade to get here. Or the cider hitting me on an empty stomach. Or the company I was in. Or, hey, maybe it was actually the food and drink themselves, but, I definitely enjoyed my visit to Hogwash a few weeks back!

My friend, who put up with my one hour late arrival, bless her heart, had already gotten started with the drinking, to tide her over. We ended up ordering:

* Curry Fries with Lamb Sausage - Enjoyable, with a nice crispiness to them, and good, strong flavors. 

* Burnin' Brock - Also pretty darn tasty, with a bit of kick to it, though less than one would have expected from something with habanero inside. I was a little disappointed when I came up on my last bite. 

* Marin Brew Co Blueberry Ale - I'm not really a huge fan of beer, but cider is a different story! While this was more bitter and less blueberry-flavored than I would have expected, given the name, it wasn't half bad either.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - The place is on the smaller side, and was pretty packed, being a Saturday night, so I didn't get a good glimpse of the entire place. From what I noticed though, aside from the communal table to one side, the rest of the venue was bar seating, or high top tables. The communal table itself wasn't the most accessible either, given that the seating was comprised of two long benches on either side of the table. The ends of the table, however, work reasonably well, though one shouldn't expect to be able to scoot under the table.

Bathroom - No comment, since I didn't try them.
author: Johnny W.

description: Always a great beer selection and great brats - I order the Sheepish, and pickles, and fries.... my go-to/fav spot in downtown/union square area!!!
author: Tim T.

description:
Hogwash... Is the antonym of this place.  The irony you of it... 

Fried pickles are the bees knees.  The chicken sausage sandwich was great. 

Couldn't give 5 stars because the bar staff was slightly aloof.  Not bad service,  but not stellar either.  

Overall,  it was a solid dinner with a great beer selection.
author: A T.

description: Sorry folks, I like but don't love this place. Yes, they have an interesting selection of beers, and are really nice, and the space is cool, but the food selection is pretty limited and only a few things are Amazing. Again, not ripping on this place--Will absolutely be back but I just don't think it's as exceptional as the reviews suggest. And IMHO they're a bit pricey for what you get.
author: Paul D.

description:
Great homemade sausages. Nice beer list, too.
Owner is SUPER nice and made my inlaws feel special, whom were visiting in from out of town.

I've been here a few times and always enjoy it. The Wurstfest, (sausage sampler), would be great for 2 people to share. It's a great way to try all the sausages they offer, and it's a lot of food. 
There's also a vegetarian sausage, too!

A little on the pricey side ($12.50 for a sausage, bun and toppings), but everything is tasty. 

Awesome place--and I definitely recommend giving it a try.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
Great place for a mid-evening beer!

Stopped by with a friend for a drink to wash down a very enjoyable meal. The space is modern, with lots of clean lines and simple design. Worked for me!

I went to the bar and began perusing the menu - there were lots of great options and deciding was going to be tough! I asked the guy behind the bar for recommendations but he must not have been a regular bartender as he didn't know the menu well at all. He was more than happy to let me sample a couple of beers before making my decision, though, so that was a bonus! I was pleased with my choice and happily sipped away.

We found a table pretty easily - it seemed quite quiet post-dinner on a weekday, and the noise level was low enough to hold a conversation, but not too silent that it felt awkward!

Definitely a spot I'd return to - I've got to try their sausages!
author: Ayla C.

description:
Four stars for the beers -- an excellent selection and variety (i.e., not all domestic craft IPAs like many places nowadays).

Two stars for the service -- there kind of isn't any. You have to queue at the counter every single time you order anything to eat or drink.

One star for the food -- both the fries and the sausage were very much too salty. Oddly, the curry that came with the curry fries had the consistency of dal, and wasn't spicy.
author: Adam Z.

description:
HOG-TOBERFEST!   This is the tastiest sandwich I have had in a long long time. And I live in Philly (so I eat a lot of sandwiches).   Wild boar beer brat with caramelized onions and kraut on a fresh baked pretzel roll.  Good lord.  

Factor in the 30 craft beers on tap and friendly service. Good night now.
author: Jay H.

description:
The reason to come here is to eat the Burning Brock house made sausage sandwich!!! I would give a 5 stars is just for that sandwich! But I must give a 4 due to the rest of the food being tiers below the burning Brock. I didn't order drinks there and their fries were pretty flavorless. 

The other sandwich I got, the Abe froman was good but not amazing. It's like eating a hamburger but in the shape of a hot dog.

We also ordered the curry fries. It was terrible do not get it.

Anyways back to the important - review of the Burning Brock:
Who knew pickled cabbage could taste so good and that a fried avocado could be so bomb! Those two plus the bread and the sausage were just delicious. I had eaten a full meal before I came here and that sandwich was still so good!

Would definitely come back again for the burning Brock.
author: Derrick C.

description: Food is fabulous.  Try the beets and goat cheese... and the salads are divine.  The beer is great and the service and atmosphere are outstanding.  The guy who manages the crowd is extremely good at his job.
author: Art K.

description:
Totally walked by this place a million times and had been pumped to cruise in and eat for a while. Homegirl and I had grabbed beers there once before and it was a pretty chill atmosphere overall. But I knew after reading the menu this puzzle they call hogwash had been left unsolved in my book.

So we meander over for beers and a sausage. Shit was made in house which made me all the more excited. So we read over the list of sandos and I settle on the OG one, I believe it's called 'all day' had an egg on top that I wish was just a bit runnier and served on a plate so I could use the yolk on the sando, but was instead served on a wax paper. The sando itself was fantastic, but I gotta say my homegirl got the burnin Brock and it was waaaaay better than mine. Completely wish I had gotten that one instead. The ketchup I don't think was house made, actually it probably was considering the mustard and hot sauce were house made. Also I want to note specifically this place carries awesome beers, most notably Altamont brewing, which are by and large fantastic beers.

The atmosphere is cool I think it's really interesting overall and not what you'd expect from a place like this on the outside. Felt like it should be a bit darker inside. I think the music choices were pretty erratic, which could be cool generally but some weird dubstep came on right after the naked and famous and that doesn't beg for much continuity. Still liked most of the jams though.
author: Jim B.

description: Five stars on the beer list and the service for sure. This is a cute little spot with a fab beer selection and friendly staff. I stopped in here for lunch on a Friday afternoon and was pleasantly surprised by the chill but chic vibe. My only knock on this place is that I wish their menu was a bit more extensive. Had the All Day sandwich, I could have done without the arugula on the sandwich but overall it was a pretty unique lunch!
author: Claire M.

description: Came here for date night and Scotty was the best! Helpful with beer selection, excellent service and great conversation! Looking forward to coming back just because of Scotty's service!
author: Alex C.

description: Way cool, so glad we came!! Fresh beer, awesome selection and loved the chicken sausage. Enjoy!
author: Sue W.

description:
Great hearty sausages with a lot of different beer options to wash down those German dogs. 

I got the Burnin' Brick sausage that comes with chicken habanero sausage, aioli, fried avocados (not sure if I'm a fan quite yet, interesting, but I think I prefer them unfried), slaw, apples, and fennel. It was juicy and had a great kick to it. 

Don't remember what beer I got (I think it was something meyer lemon?) but I did get to sample some Almanac sours which were really tasty. 

Definitely a place for meat and beer lovers
author: Alice C.

description: Such a rad place with really good food and a nice selection of craft beers on tap. Highly recommended
author: Jordan F.

description: Great find - would recommend this place to friends and even enemies because I'm nice guy. Great beer selection, great service and top-notch menu. Will return soon....
author: Joe H.

description:
The first time I visited this place, I came strictly to try the beer selection.  They had a wide variety to choose from and the bartender was pretty helpful in giving suggestions.  My only complaint was that I didn't have enough time to try them all.  Unfortunately, I had so much that I couldn't tell you which ones I tried...

After that visit, I decided to make a return for the food, this time bringing my wife and son.  The offer a selection of sausage sandwiches, and even offer a kids menu.  We tried the Abe Froman, and my wife had the Sheepish.  Each had great flavor, a little messy, but well worth it.  Despite seeing the photos on Yelp, it looked like the fried pickles were no longer a menu item.  Being fans of this fried morsel, we were a little bummed.  However, the beer, the rest of the food, and the great customer service balanced that minor drawback.

The place itself offers bar stool seating at the bar, along with a few high tops nearby.  The rest of the dining area was bench seating.  After climbing the hills to get here, I do wish I had some back support, but this alone isn't a deal breaker.

If we make our way back to the SF Bay Area, we will definitely be back to try whatever we didn't get a chance to try.
author: Justin B.

description: The beer selection was good. Fried pickles and French fries were disappointing. The pickles were cut too thin, so it mostly just seemed like we were eating batter with spicy aioli. The fries were very very very salty - and I never thought I could say that! I'd come back for the beer, but I'd skip the food. Also, weird that we had to wait to be seated, but all orders must be made at the bar....
author: Mary Y.

description:
Just returned from a conference in SF and happened to stay at the Rex Hotel, right next door to my new go-to joint on nob hill.  Ended up eating lunch here 3 out of 4 days. these guys do it right.  simple delicious menu.  beautiful space.  great beer.  I rotated through most of the sausages on the menu, but the burning brock took the prize.

do yourself a favor and get here.
author: Adam U.

description: As a vegan, I can usually find a dish to eat at any restaurant. this trip was no exception! I ordered the hogless without the creme fraiche, and it was the bomb. If you're in the mood for an upscale hotdog, Hogwash is your spot to go. Also, their beer selection is more than enough a reason check this joint out if you're into that!
author: Nicole A.

description: Had an impromptu engagement party here as a friend owns the place and we wanted to check them out! LOVED the dogs! Everyone was so excited to eat and try all the variety of beers on tap! They are located in an awesome spot and the service was great even though it was packed! Everyone even people I dont know were having a great time on a weekday!
author: Tracy W.

description:
Beer and sausage are two of my favorite things and Hogwash has plenty of both. 

I was here on a Friday evening after work but before a comedy show at the Marines Memorial Theater (across the street). This place gets crowded and a bit loud. Be prepared to wait but we assured that your patience will be rewarded. 

The staff is very helpful and friendly and kept an eye out for us as we waited. They helped us snag a little table near the bar. There are a couple of TVs to watch a sporting event too. 

I ordered the Burning Brock "sando" because I read that it was spicy and had pickles and it had deep fried avocado. We also got an order of curry fries. 

I loved the Burning Brock. It was perfect. I highly recommend this. 

The curry fries were good but just a tiny bit too crispy and crunchy for my taste. 

You'll notice that periodically the staff will ring a cowbell. This is to announce that someone is  about to drink a glass of beer bigger than your head. Although it's tempting to try and drink that much beer, only opt for this if you have plenty of time and a roomy bladder. My friend ordered this and I ended up having to help. 

Overall, I really enjoyed Hogwash  and hope to return soon.
author: Daisy S.

description: I come here all the time! Staff is super friendly. Beer selection is awesome. Good wine choices. And the sausages are amazing! Try all of the sausages but the burning Brock is my fave!
author: Ben C.

description: Food was good. And food was done quickly. Seems to be a sausage place but get the pretzel roll!! Sooo good... otherwise expected bigger portion, especially of the sandwiches, but hey - it wasn't bad.
author: Zee S.

description: Classy but relaxed setting. Plenty of beer on tap, I got their special "drunken pazole" sandwich and was very pleased. The sausage was seasoned well, and had just the right amount of garnish. Nice complimentary flavors, and the creamy-ish hominy was outstanding! There was lots of good looking stuff on the menu, but I was on my lunch break, so I had to just stuff my face, and peace out. The couple of staff that I met seemed really friendly and cool, and it's clear they like where they work. It's definitely on the recommended list if your looking for yummy eats in union square / theatre district area. I'll be back for sure!
author: Caddy M.

description:
I don't usually go to Yelp to review restaurants, but I really have to let everyone know how great hogwash is... Hogwash is amazing and delivers a great experience in so many ways.

The staff is is amazing... Paula is a complete bubbly smoke show who makes you laugh and feel welcome, Preda will become your boy and has a lot of good local SF recommendations if you are visiting the city, Phil is a total homie that is always down to talk about the beers and surfing. All the bartenders make your time there rememberable. 

I was even lucky enough to meet one of the owners one day when I came in after work. Super friendly dude, he has grey hair but the personally of a energetic youngster who is stoked to have you in! Great man! 

Their beer selection is on point, a ton of taps with something new to try all the time which is awesome. The food is amazing, down with the fried pickles and I have heard "the best fries according to Yelp" okaaaaay hogwash, I believe it! Soo good. 

Now get in and check it out! When you go in, tell the bartender "put it on teds tab" I'd love to see how many people read this outstanding review. 

Please note I will not be picking up anyone's actual tab.
author: Teddy A.

description:
I have been to Hogwash a few times and every time I have had such a positive experience! I met Paula, one of the managers/owner, the first time I was there and since she has remembered me and has been so helpful with beer suggestions. She is very knowledgeable of all the beers and so funny and welcoming. 

I have tried almost everything and its so good! Very fresh ingredients. Anytime I have friends visiting I always take them there because I know it is a guaranteed great experience. 

Highly recommend Hogwash!!!!
author: Katherine K.

description: Great food, great beer.  I am in town for a conference.  I had the Sheepish (lamb sausage sandwich w/ carnage, beets and blue cheese) curry fries, and a couple of stouts to wash it down.  I wish I could come back regularly to try the rest of the menu.  Bartenders were very courteous and quick to respond.
author: Brian B.

description: I like this place, it's casual. Went there for a late dinner/beer. The don't have servers so you order food and drink at the bar and they give you a number then deliver it to your table. This is nice for some occasions. The food was good and the beer selection is on point. I would definitely go back.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Came here for the first time with a few friends yesterday evening and we're already planning to come back for next week's shenanigans! 

No lie this place is the perfect gastropub in FiDi. Delicious homemade sausages (I had the Abe Froman, so good!), extensive list of beers on draft (like 30!), and EXCELLENT service. I decided to try the blueberry ale and it was soooo crisp and refreshing, not hoppy at all which I like. You open a tab at the bar by the way, and that's where you do your ordering as well. The servers will bring your food to the table though which is awesome. 

And the service here is just top notch, I didn't catch her name (she has blonde hair) but she gave some great beer recommendations and had this positive energy about her. It was infectious! Also, I love the communal seating. I'm an avid believer in the spirit of bar comradery and sharing a beer with the stranger next you. As long as you're a beer lover you're good in my book! We made some great new friends. Long story short, plan a visit to Hogwash, you won't be disappointed.

P.S. We were one of the few in the restaurant that went for the Hog-Goblets (55oz of beer), no regrets! They ring a cowbell when you order one haha
author: Evin C.

description: Super delicious place for late night eats!  I had the 'All Day' sandwich (maple and sage park sausage, arugula, sunny side up egg and a fresh roll) simple and glorious!  We also tried the roasted beets with goat cheese and the fried pickles.  I think that the fried pickles were the best part of this calorie fest!  The service was great and there is a large draft beer list. Anyone who has not experienced the 'Swine and Swill' needs to get out to Hogwash stat!!!
author: Amanda G.

description: This place is cool.  Great beer selection ranging from light pils to heavy IPAs.  Quality food to go along with the delish beers.  Always popping so get there early to try to snag a table.
author: Jon H.

description:
Came here after reading a ton of reviews. We were excite to try their curry fries, but trust our luck they were out of all fries. 

Most of their starters are deep fried, even beets!! I dint like that. 

The Veggie (lentil) dog was good.
author: A. D.

description:
I had high expectations since the concept had such promise, but I was let down. You'd expect more than 1 pork sausage option for a place called "Hogwash" with swine so prominently part of the branding. In fact, there's only one breakfast sausage with maple as an option -- so nothing very savory, just sweet. There are 3-4 other sausage options. I did try the chicken habanero but it was overpowered by the pickles.

The curry with fries, duck egg, and sausage was okay. I was expecting something more like Currywurst (hugely popular in Germany) but it was really a gravy like curry with fries. The fries were delicious and the duck egg was good but I found it to be a really weird combination with the pork sausage since it came with maple and therefore tasted really sweet.

The beer selection here is really nice though and staff is friendly. However, the wait time from ordering when they are busy is quite long -- took 25-30 minutes for food that isn't that complicated to make.

The atmosphere is very lively though and seems like a fun place. I just wouldn't come here for the sausages. I'd at best come here for some beer and fries with some pals.
author: Victor W.

description: Great service, fun staff (gave us tips on how to maximize our food selection), nice beer selection and yummy food!
author: May S.

description: They had a great menu, and did a great job giving recommendation and helping us order!  Really friendly bar tenders and staff + great beer selection.
author: Parker B.

description: Seriously the best food and service I've had in a very long time. Amazing beer list as well!
author: Emma B.

description: Dope spot, good food and good drinks. I live in LA but i'd definitely come back here again!
author: Dana P.

description:
Love this place!
Very busy place, you can seat where ever you like, lots of diversity of beer and the sausages are delicious!!! 
It's perfect for any occasion! For big groups to a date night! 
The owner Nick was super friendly and nice! 
Awesome place! Decorations are really cute and really clean! 
Love it! BURNIN BROCK is so good!!! French fries really good.. 
Everything taste good!
author: Kim K.

description:
