Everyone in San Francisco loves delicious sausages and beer.  I mean it feels like this whole place is sausage shops and beer shops to cater to the male techie sweatshirt crowd.  That crowd is generally not my cup of tea, but that's an entirely different story.

What's always struck me about the sausage and beer places in SF is their ambiance, usually kind of divey / broey, and their prices, usually not that cheap.  What Hogwash maintains is the prices ($5-9 for a beer) but substitutes them for beers that are slightly better and more interesting.  The rotating taps have some relative newcomers to the scene, like harmonic a Brewer whom I think is fantastic and not very well known yet.  Hogwash ditches the divey / broey atmosphere for something more up scale, and that's reflected in the food which is a bit pricier ($11-13 for a sausage) but maintains higher depth and creativity.  As an example: the chicken sausage with fried avocado and pickled vegetables was delicious and I would highly recommend.

Would definitely come back for the beer and sausages!  My rating system is a bit complicated, but in general I find San Francisco a bit pricey these days and this place is no exception, so I give it 4/5 stars.  In addition the service was a bit weird and one of our beers was forgotten.  Minor infractions for an otherwise very pleasant experience!
author: Alex H.

description:
Close to JW Marriot! We decided to try. 
Nice bar area low lighting, but not too low. Easy going inviting environment . My bf and I each ordered a different "sub" Idk what they're called. But they come cut in half, so we traded a half. Both were delicious ! 
Service was fast and attentive . 
Water was cold , great selection of beers. 
Absolutely coming again!
author: Tracie G.

description:
Hogwash is a great small local spot with a cool California vibe. The place is nothing special from the exterior but don't let the mellow storefront fool you, what is inside is great!

Hogwash has a variety of in house sausages that are delicious. The menu has a variety of other items that include a fry plate with curry and duck eggs. 

The kale salad is a hit with feta and a great mix of vinegar and beets. The other dudes we had included, what will soon be famous, the fried pickles. The sauce served has a bit of a kick but it is nice. 

They have a massive beer and wine collection and the music is always bumping 80's - at least on our visit. 

The staff are friendly and knowledgeable and you will most likely meet the wonderful proprietors! Tell Paula we said hey! 

Enjoy this fun and funky Sutter street spot!
author: Randy M.

description:
the kitchen has just closed when we got there =(

drank:
strawberry sour
hot chocolate stout nitro
peanut butter porter

i dont like beer but the stout and porter were really tasty! i'll need to come back for the food
author: Raquel T.

description: So the fries where good. But there sausages where nasty as can be and they took super long and we only had 3 orders. We sat there for 40 mins waiting to order.
author: Kurtis M.

description:
It does not disappoint! Normally, I don't like sandwich shops that charge twice as much as delis or small cafes because the quality isn't worth it. But no, the flavor from each ingredient + the combo of the ingredients together was stupendous. 

I had the Breakfast All Day sandwich (I don't remember if that's exactly what it's called) - the sausage had an unexpected sweetness to it and the slightly runny egg was perfectly salted. Also, hard rolls are usually as advertised - hard. But the bread on this sandwich was incredibly soft. Everything together was borderline too big for my mouth to bite into, but it just made the cut. The chip pairing was also not just a standard combo that comes with your sandwich; no, the chips actually made the meal that much better.

Pleasant staff and water bottles at your table so you don't have to wait for refills. Excellent all around, even though it's more expensive than your normal sandwich. Worth it!
author: Christi D.

description:
First night out in San Francisco with wife. Came here due to great Yelp reviews and close proximity to Chancellor Hotel. 

Good attentive service at 930-ish on Saturday night. Friendly staff and bartenders. Comfortable, cool decor and ambience. 

Sold out of vegetarian hog-sandwich but wife chose the arugula and peaches salad. Very fresh and tasty. I had chicken habanero sandwich and side of fries also very good. 

Good experience. Just what we were looking for. Would visit again!
author: John N.

description: We are excited to go here....we had heard good things. Unfortunately, very little of it came true. There was no happy hour, the beer was warm, and the food was just OK. My wife's salad had a vinegar dressing.....just vinegar.  The salad was 97% lettuce with little of what was described in the menu. The redeeming point for Hogwash was the sausage sandwich. It was tasty with solid condiments that complimented the sausage. I can't recommend this place.
author: William S.

description:
Relatively new beer bar/gastropub adjacent to Cantina. Great tap selection and amazingly friendly staff. You guys all get 5 stars!! I really like the layout of this place and the extra time spent into the aesthetics, giving it a refined beer hall/bar/pub feel, whatever they call these places nowadays.

Excellent selection of craft beers, there's plenty to try. But of course you'll be paying a premium for it with beers starting at mostly $7-10. The menu is easy to read and understand what size and pour you'll be receiving but wait! What is this GOBLET thing? 

EYES LIGHT UP.

It's on average 3x the price of the pint version (16oz vs 55oz) of whatever beer you're having, so it' a pretty good deal if you're staying a while. Imagine yourself holding and drinking out of a contemporary, slightly classier take on zee German das boot! It's glorious! They also ring the cowbell for you.

Oh, they also serve food that's related to hogs, whad'ya know? I've had the curry fries and obviously heavy, but I found the fries too crispy to pair well with the gravy. Their signature dish are the $11 sausage sandwiches but I think I'll pass on that.

For a hipster looking bar, the bartenders & staff are incredibly nice, on a completely different level than the typical SF bartender.
author: Steven C.

description: Hogwash gets 3.5 stars so I'll round up to 4.  The sausage sandwich that my girlfriend and I shared was just OK, the beer list is plentiful but didn't give enough information to help a novice choose.  What tips this rating over 3 stars was the french fries.  I don't know how much they cost, but we split a side of fries with our dog and they were some of the best fries I've had.  It was a large portion too - we barely finished half of them between the two of us.  The only complaint is that they had way too much salt on them but that was easily wiped off.  I sat there with a napkin and wiped each fry before eating it and ended up with a pile of salt in front of me, but no pain no gain right?  Best things in life are worth working for.
author: Emma H.

description:
Really love Hogwash... Great addition to the area and I'm happy to live nearby. 
30 beers on tap - going to work through all those. The appetizers are wonderful and the food is amazing. Very hip and lively crowd here all the time. 
My only beef would be that it does get quite loud in there at times. Not a game-changer but worth noting.

Anyways... great place for sure.
author: Chuck R.

description:
Awesome new bar in lower Nob Hill! My friend and I were wandering around the area after checking out another bar and decided to stop in after seeing the stellar Yelp reviews. After all, who can say no to fried pickles (I call them frickles...does anyone else do this? The bartender seemed genuinely perplexed by this but I think it makes perfect sense! It's definitely a thing...)

Unfortunately when we got in around 12:00 am the kitchen was no longer open (closes at 11:00 pm) but I couldn't hold that against them. Especially when I told them that I was on an apple cider kick and they didn't judge me. They also had an especially delicious 5% alcohol cider for me to enjoy! My friend ordered a real beer and that was also very satisfying.

We talked to the owner (Nick?) for awhile and he was a super chill guy, awesome job with the new place.

Here's one last little tip: Don't accidentally walk into Cantina next door. We made that mistake, quickly readjusted and ended up right where we should be, at Hogwash. Will be back for FRICKLES!
author: Christina L.

description:
Incredible experience. The fried pickles are addictive, the sausages are INCREDIBLE, and the service is amazing. It seats first come first serve, which we were nervous about at first, but the owner saw that we were looking for a table, and immediately helped clear out room for our party of 5. Great and interesting beer selection, and the food is probably the best bar food around. On par with many nice sit down restaurants. Friendly staff. I will definitely be coming back!!

Also...get the All Day. It's heaven in your mouth.
author: Nicola B.

description:
Great concept, awesome environment and beer and sausages to die for. The staff are also friendly, cool people. Would totally be a five star review if I hadn't experienced a hiccup which I felt was either the classical case of 'holiday brain' or perhaps a staff that might be a touch too laid back in their 'cool' approach. 

Bartender took time to answer my questions about beer and food pretty patiently, but I noticed him drift off to the kitchen to chat pretty frequently. Probably the new launch of lunch and it being a bit slower than dinner might have just put him on relax mode. I know how being slow can kind of put you in a super chill mode...too chill. I think that chill mode might have been what caused him to make a mistake on which sausage I wanted. Instead of the breakfast one, they brought out the beef/cheddar/bacon, which also sounded AMAZING. The chef said he would make me the breakfast one, but I offered to eat the one he brought. He softly insisted to make the one I really wanted. 

I was SUPER hungry at the time, so I was getting a little antsy about the whole thing. I was very happy that the bartender poured me another delicious IPA from my hometown Berkeley on the house for his mistake. I left buzzy and happy with the yummy duck egg topped maple sausage I did get in the end. On the way out the chef was on a smoke break and said I should try the beef one next time and then sort of scolded himself for not just giving me both. I will admit, it psychologically made me hungry again :) 

I'm gonna go back again and would happily up this to five stars if the service sharpened up just a touch. I'll try the night shift.
author: Matt S.

description: Great beer selection, sausages (largely served as gourmet hotdogs) rich in flavor. Attentive, yet chill staff. Upscale but comfortable pub vibe. Will return to try some of the other awesome -sounding options
author: Ryan H.

description: Can we talk about how modern and sophisticated Hogwash is? It totally shy's away from your normal gastropub. I think what makes Hogwash a meaningful asset to Sutter is the sleek bar set-up. The establishment itself gives off a communal feel. Customer service was excellent! From the minute my guest and I arrived, we were greeted with enthusiasm and provided various selections based on what we liked to drink. Don't pass up on their seasonal beers, given that they house a vast collection of beers, you'll find a variety of things outside the Bay area.  The food menu looked inviting. I had to indulge in some fried pickles with my beer. The aioli on the side was a delicious condiment.
author: Sarin P.

description:
Nice place, good food, friendly service had a very good time there.
They offered to replace an order turned out to be too spicy, very appropriated. Also there are varieties of beers and a nice menu to pick up from.
author: Tal L.

description: Extensive beer selection, plus good non-alcoholic drinks.  I totally enjoyed their curry fries with sausage - you have GOT to try this combo!  Nice, friendly service.  Get here early as it gets packed for dinner.
author: Maile N.

description:
Cool joint especially if you like beer and/or brats. Stumbled across hogwash at 10pm on a Saturday night and the place was packed. Loud, vibrant and welcoming atmosphere with large tables and high tops. 

Unique twists on traditional wieners. Didn't try the beer but they had a great selection of unique brands I'd never heard of. You won't find another place like this.
author: Kade M.

description:
More pub than eatery. Friendly staff. Food is average, though above average for pub grub. Good vibe and alternative space to more formal sit down. Tried the sausage plate. Selection of 4. 2 good, 1 bland and 1 so spicy I had to pass. Bit pricy. Curry fries were nothing like you get in Dublin or London.

Go for the beer and the vibe and you won't be disappointed.
author: Will W.

description:
Great spot for a beer and a snack. I respect the fact that Hogwash concentrates on two things, great beer, and sausage sandwiches.

You get a beer, order your sandwich, and the food is brought out to you. It's good, and affordable.

The food takes a while to come, but why are you drinking good beer quickly anyway?
author: Stephen W.

description:
Good spot.

This place is a great balance - it's nice and clean and cool, but down to earth with good service and great food. It was lively and happening without being too crowded or loud. 

The food, as others say, is pretty great - we wanted something lighter and were able to get two salads for less than $10 each and they were good and fresh.

You can also get a beer or wine for a decent price and bc there is only half service (you order at the bar), all in a meal can be really reasonable.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Great beer selection! Limited menu but all items are delicious. Small but very trendy venue. Would definitely go out of my way to come back next time I visit San Francisco
author: Ron R.

description: Really good atmosphere with decent food, great beer selection and the Russian hostesses was amazing. You may need to share a table with other parties; however, friendly staff more than makes up for it.
author: Kevin J.

description: Great beer selection and great sausage.  Busy and crowded but a very upbeat and friendly vibe.
author: Matt M.

description: Scotty and Dylan were great! So pleasant and kept everything clean. Love their selection of sour beers
author: Chris B.

description:
overall - 4/5
----------------

food - 4.5/5
1) curry fries with duck egg

service - 3.5/5

cleanliness - 4/5

location - 4/5

experience - 4/5

-------------------------------
wait time: 0 (weekday, afternoon)
author: John V.

description:
had a blast on a sunday....the sausage sampler is a pretty good deal compared to ordering the sausage separately. The sampler is like a great steak meal...
Great place except for all the pan handlers around the block... (sanfran police chief needs to crack down on all the panhandlers hitting u up every ten freaking feet) But they make up for it with their excellent service and wonderful food/beer and wine selections! Staff was very helpful with great knowledge of beer menu....
author: Derek M.

description:
This place was fantastic! We came in for lunch after a long trip and was very satisfying. The service is order at the bar but still extremely friendly and attentive even after we got our food. 

I got the venison special and my boyfriend got the All Day. Both were just great. Such a great blend of flavored and best of all, the sausages were not greasy but not dry. We also split the warm olives plate. Overall an excellent spot and we hope to come back for dinner!
author: Laura C.

description: This is a great place to grab some food and few beers after a day at the office. The ambiance is very casual, although a little loud so you may have to scream to hear the conversation at your table. The was delicious, and incorporated just about every cut of pork you could imagine. There are 30 beers on tap, so there's always something to keep you interested. Overall, a great place to hang out with friends.
author: Ho L.

description:
Sausage and beer is the theme here. The Burnin' Brock is a habanero sausage that is quite good. With the toppings to help cool it down, I'd say it's close to hot salsa. On its own, it's hotter but still edible. 
The draft beers include light, dark, hoppy, wheat, local, national, and international selections.
author: Landon C.

description: OMG if you are a fan of amazing sausages and great salads and fantastic beers you have to try Hogwash. I ordered the Kale Salad and Abe Froman sandwich and I was not disappointed. The dressing on the sale was nice and refreshing as an added bonus they have pickled carrots and onions on the side that give the Salad a nice crunch. As for the sausage the spices were bursting through but did not over power the sandwich. Pure yummy goodness. Now for beer a great Almenac Tangerine Sour topped it all off fantastically.
author: Nicole L.

description: This place is awesome--my cousin was visiting from Austin and we both agreed the fried pickles were out of this world. I'm not much of a beer drinker, but I fell in love with their Weihenstephaner Vitas Weizenbock. Trendy place, fun environment, great staff. Will definitely go again.
author: Janna L.

description:
Stumbled across this venue. Was a good find. I had the Hog Cobb salad, $12 which was really yummy!!
My husband had the burn'in brock sandwich with fried avocado for $12.50, which was nice. Great service.
author: Hoboken R.

description:
Seamless experience, and the food was beyond advertised. Really no need for the long story. All the previous reviews came in accurate and had an amazing time at one of the community tables. 

Ordered:
Fried Pickles - A+
Ghost town IPA - A
Burnin Brock Sandwich - A+

Oh, and Great, Great, GREAT service!! 

So glad I stopped in to grab a bite and brew!

I could eat here once a week!
author: Rafael R.

description:
Ok, I am not the biggest beer fan in the world but two words - FRENCH FRIES!
They were the highlight of our time there. I'm not sure what it was but their friends were ah-mazing. Mac n cheese balls were super good as well. Maybe I was just really hungry.

Don't get me wrong, the beer was good too. But, i am the wrong person to ask about that. 

Atmosphere was the typical busy after work crowd with limited tables so stare one down like a hawk and swoop in when possible.
author: Leina K.

description:
My wife and I tried the Burning Brock and it was a perfect match to my Kolsch.  We happened to stumble upon Hogwash looking at reviews for nearby bars and this came up.  We came in and were greeted but it took a little to get to us.  I suppose we're partly to blame since we moved from one table to the bar but none the less the staff including the owner was awesome.  Their selection of beer is supurb and for someone who has been to Koln Germany it was nice to see Kolsch on tap.  Also the bartender was good enough to help me discover a new favorite Japanese beer Hitachino.

Evidently they've only been open 10 days prior to our visit so I'm excited for our next visit to see what else comes of this place.  Great job guys keep up the amazing work.
author: Jerome P.

description: Great new spot!! Very comfortable space, clean open bar. Nick runs a tight ship with excellent employees at his fingertips . Paula is a well of knowledge and knows her Beer. I wanted a Japanese white ale I saw on an old menu which wasn't available anymore but she brought me something even better a beer from Iceland that was so quenching and delish I got two. The food was awesome ! I love fried pickles and the bread for the sausage sandwiches was soft and perfect . Great experience and nice turn out for the Yelp event. I'll be back and I'll spread the word to all my clients , being that I live and work 6 minutes away. Thank you!!
author: Cecilia D.

description:
This place is fun and zesty. Fun vibe, AMAZING meats, tons of craft beers. Love it and have been back 4x.  

I prefer to sit at the bar and get direct access to the bartenders. Faster access to the 55 ounce HOBGOBLET. throw one down and they will ring the cowbell. 

Boom!!
author: Clint S.

description: Possibly the best sausages I have ever eaten in my life (and I've been to Germany)! They have a good variety and they top them with the best pairings based on the meat. SOOO DELISH! Will be back!
author: Brittini S.

description:
Holy shit those fried pickles! No seriously, I think they're the best I've ever had. Great sausage and beer spot. I absolutely will be returning with new recruits. 

Open one in Oakland!
author: Aaron M.

description:
The vibe inside is sweet.
The beer selection is spot on. 
The bartenders, waitstaff and hostess are super friendly and attentive.

We ate the fried pickles, fries and beet salad and definitely would order all 3 again.


They ring a bell (from what I can remember after 4 10.3% epidemic bourbon vanilla stouts) when people order the large goblet which is probably 3 or 4 beers put together. 

I'd give it one more star if they opened earlier! I patiently waited outside for 17 minutes until 5 PM just to quench my thirst with a beer! ;)

Thanks for a great Friday night Hogwash!
author: Jenny B.

description:
This place is phenomenal! The Sausage Sandwiches are great. I recommend the Sheepish and the All Day. The beers are grand, especially when served in the Hog-Goblet. 

If you are in the city, this place is a must.
author: Janus N.

description: Honestly I've never yelped, but OMG. Damn. The burning Brock rocked my world!! Someone in the kitchen is well versed in chicken sausage. And the cute blonde behind the bar knew her shit, offered us all the right things and all the right time. Damn. Get here.
author: Kenny O.

description: First trip to San Fran and we came across Hogwash, we grabbed a beer and ended up meeting the owners. Both couldn't have been nicer, super knowledgable about craft beers and their hot sauce is awesome!! Also loved the decor and vibes this happy hour spot provides.
author: Mollie H.

description:
This star rating is purely based on the food. This place has a good concept & is very trendy right now and has potential to be really good, but they need to work on the food! 

My husband & I ordered the breakfast hotdog, the spicy chicken hotdog, a side of fries & a kale salad between us. The fries were overcooked & really crunchy to the point they hurt our teeth to eat them and they were heavily over salted. They looked like snow capped fries!! The kale salad was heavily doused in the dressing and it was totally overpowering, which made it difficult to enjoy. The hotdogs were so, so.. The chicken sausage had deep fat fried avocado, which meant all you could taste was fried batter, so had to remove it to eat the hotdog. The breakfast hotdog with an egg was the only dish that wasn't too bad. 

There is also no table service here, you order at the bar. Which made it difficult when you had a question about the menu. When I had a question about the veggie option, the passing waiter asked the women behind the bar to come to our table to assist & she then advised they don't actually have the dish available!! 

Unfortunately we walked away feeling very disappointed.
author: Lynsey H.

description: Amazing range of craft beers and delicious bar snacks. Thanks to Scotty for making a jet lagged Australian feel very welcome in San Francisco!
author: Kate J.

description: Great tasty food with a wide range of unique beers on tap. Bizarre twist on dessert which is worth a go. Service is also great the only downside was no highchairs for babies.
author: Pablo M.

description: The Burnin Brock is the winner - full of flavor and just the right amount of spice.
author: Sarah W.

description: The food here is absolutely amazing. I had the Burnin' Brock which is stellar. Extremely spicy, but well balanced with the fresh green apple and fried avocado. Fairly loud fun atmosphere. Great selection of beers on tap. Bring the boys for some serous food and beer.
author: Michael H.

description:
After a solid 60 minutes of hot yoga my body was depleted of all essential nutrients so fueling up was a priority.  Walking east from the financial district I passed many a tempting chain restaurants and suspect Chinese take out joints.  Tired and thirsty my sense of smell located my favorite food ever and drink combination - pork and beer. As the smells filled my nose I turned right on Sutter Street and opened the door of Hogwash - jackpot!  The beer menu, pork  named after the Sausage King of Chicago, and salads (f$&@ it!) #winning!  

Food was great, service was solid, loved the hot sauce at the tables, good tunes, great beer, no broccoli-infused b.s. 

Highly recommend, greatly enjoyed!
author: Larry M.

description:
It all sounded so promising. Beer! Pickles! Sausage! 

But, alas. The only part that was really good was the beer, and everything was overpriced. I mean, $50 for two (less than half pint) beers, one vegetarian "sausage" (aka falafel crumbles in a roll), fries, and pickles. And the pickles were not even of the fermented variety- instead, vinegary, tasting mostly the same, even though there were 6 different veggies represented. 

C'mon. 

Rosamunde kicks Hogwash's tourist-filled butt (ew) around the block.
author: Tania L.

description:
Arrived to Hogwash around 20 min after 5pm. Walking in I noticed the music, A/c, and lights volume were complimenting each other perfectly. My spouse and I were greeted in a welcoming manner and shown to our seats. The wood and the menus had an amazing feel to them. Loved everything about the decor and ambiance. Great service and the curry fries were everything I expected! 

Highly recommended.
author: Joseph A.

description: Delicious food, great service, and great beer.  I went here with a group of 5 others last saturday afternoon and we still can't stop talking about how the sandwiches that we got here were some of the best that we've ever had.  I had the burning brock sandwich and it was awesome, a nice mix of spicy sausage and creamy fried artichoke.  And, I love me some fresh Fieldworks IPAs, which they had on tap.  The service was prompt and friendly.  Will definitely go back when I'm in the area again.
author: Matt D.

description:
Overall I'd say this place was just alright. The highlight was the beef, bacon and cheese sausage sandwich, which was a solid 7.5/10. 

The fried pickles were disappointing - the pickles were bland, which meant that the fried batter was the most prominent element. I've had far better.

The beer was nice but a bit flat. Perhaps when you have so many beers on tap (20+ from memory) you're bound to get a situation where the kegs are on tap for a long time? I'm not sure, but the beer definitely didn't wow us.

The ambiance was probably one of the lower points. The fit-out is really nice, but the uninspiring lighting and the terribly bland electronic music made for an overall surprisingly sterile vibe.

I'd say this place could be worth a visit so you can make up your own mind, particularly if you're into the idea of a beer and sausage gastropub.
author: Gabor H.

description:
I thought it was great until I finished my cider and realized there was greasy food stuck on the bottom of the glass. It wasn't inside the glass, thankfully, but it made me wonder if I'd been drinking from a clean glass. Kind of ruined the whole meal when I started to wonder about how clean their dishware actually is. Gross.

I would've given them 4 stars, but it dropped to two. Gross. Gross. Gross.
author: John A.

description: Hogwash! So fun. I enjoy going to this spot. Last time I was here I tried too many beers and ended up getting something else. Yeah, I'm one of "those people" sometimes. Haha! So many options! What I like about this spot is that their extensive list shows what vessel they will serve your beverage in, as well as ABV and some other things (hoppiness factor?). I'm still learning about beers, okay?! Call me a beer noob, I admit it. Haha. Plusssssss. FOOD. YES. LOVE BARS WITH FOOD. I believe I've just had the fries here--which they do really well. Mmmmmm. Bar food. Beer. Hogwash. Plus if I remember correctly, you can order food from here and take it next door. I'm not sure if they changed that policy, but it was nice having the option! Community ftw! Until next time! :)
author: Mariel A.

description: Fantastic selection...even a gluten free IPA (that tasted like real beer) for my cousin with Celiac. Great service and cool interior. Can't speak to the food unfortunately
author: Sean R.

description:
- Great place for drinks
- Good selection of beer on tap
- Beer and sausage, bring it on!
- Minimal yet spot on food menu to wash with your drinks 
- Great vibe any day of week, trendy
- Must have: Curry fries, add fried egg and sausage
- The owner and bartenders are the friendliest lot,  and try their best to make you a happy customer.
author: Payal B.

description:
This place is amazing! Really ... beer from Europe! Go figure? Lot's of beers that are not IPA's? I remember now ...

Food is awesome! Healthy? I guess it depends on your food chain status? I vote yes! They make their own sausage from scratch ... That Rocks!

Ryan is an awesome bartender! Have a preference, ask! He won't steer you wrong! 

If I review ... I mean it! JMH
author: Jason H.

description:
So, the food is good, the beer is great, the people are nice. So why 3 stars? The 'order at the bar' system sucks. 20 seconds after I got up to get another beer, while I was standing at the bar waiting for service, they gave away my table. Just wiped it down and say someone down. There's literally no way of signaling you're not done yet unless you leave a friend or some kind of belongings on the table.

Talk about annoying. I left without ordering another beer. I don't think I'll be back, there are too many good options in this city.
author: James M.

description:
I read about this place on Yelp, probably while seeking Fried Pickles :)  The reviews on the Pickles here were pretty high, and I love me some pickles.  So, I convinced a group of 9 friends to go here with me after seeing Phantom at the Orpheum.  The walk was about 20 minutes and was reasonably pleasant.  Once we arrived, the placed looked great and we were able to sit at a low long table immediately.  The server came over immediately with the menus and informed us that all ordering was done at the bar.
That worked just fine for me, since as it turned out that's also where you go to try the beers.  And they had a lot of beer options.  I ended up drinking a Rye Ale, and a Blue Bell (I think).  Both of which were very good beers.  My wife got a Blueberry Ale, and she liked it so much she bought it twice.
The food menu was small, about 5 sausage sandwiches, 4 salads, and a few snacks.  Ideal for a Gastropub I think.  Between the whole table, I think we may have ordered pretty much everything.  And nobody had anything bad to say at all.  We even all agreed we would come back.  And as it turns out, those reviews about the pickles, yeah they are true.  Awesome fried pickles.
The staff overall was very friendly, and we even got a visit from the owner.  He was a good sport and took some photos with us.  Then he heard we had some anniversaries at the table and he hooked us up with some free beers.  It was awesome.  He also said he is hoping to add a couple desserts next month, so maybe I have a reason to head to city again.
author: Corey S.

description: I am so excited that they have opened up for lunch now. They have a great selection of beer on tap, especially some good picks for the IPAs. The metal and wood combination decor only adds to the chill vibe of the place. The sandwiches are the perfect portion to fill you up and the house made chips are amazing! Defiantly come here for lunch or just to have some drinks with friends.
author: Ankita C.

description: this place was pretty legit! warm lighting and warm atmosphere, and warm and friendly service!  I love that the owner was working the crowd, and cleaning up tables! we tried two beers at the bar, reasonably priced, and the food looked delicious as well! they also serve beverages in really really large jugs. pretty fun! will be back for sure :)
author: Christina L.

description:
I LOVE this place! The selection of beer is awesome and the ambience totally cool.  The employees  here are excellent at customer service. 
The fried pickles are to die for. I have only tried one sausage on their menu and it was good, but my fried pickles and beer were the BEST. 
Check it out if you haven't, expect to have a fun time but get there at 5 when they open because it is PACKED. Very popular spot, for good reason.
author: Angie S.

description: Yummy lunch spot! Seriously good. And the owner was so friendly. A laid back place to have a beer and some delicious food!
author: Stacy P.

description: Great craft beer and delicious food. It is pricey so I don't go here often but I enjoy myself everytime.
author: Averie C.

description:
I've been here a few times, and it never disappoints! 

-The staff is super friendly, provides great service, and always suggests excellent drink and food choices
-They have an extensive beer and wine selection, so there's something for everyone
-Food wise, I consider my palate pretty refined, and I have loved everything I've tried so far. Personally I would recommend the Wurstfest plate, curry fries, Burnin' Brock sandwich, and fried pickles.

This place is great, I definitely recommend it for a date night or just a mellow night with friends.
author: Karlin Ann L.

description: Found it on yelp cause it was near my hotel and gave it a go for lunch.   Had no idea what to expect and almost went somewhere else when I saw it was really only sausages.   But the food is amazing.  The owner Paula is great and displays a real passion.  Huge beer menu . . .  the food will knock your socks off.
author: Samuel N.

description:
Hogwash is a perfect spot to grab some amazing beer and enjoy a good atmosphere.  Every time I have been here the customer service is excellent.  There is usually a host at the door to greet you, explain the "order at the bar" service and answer any questions you might have.  
The beer selection has something for everyone in your group and the bartenders will often let you have a taste to find something you can enjoy.  The beer prices are about average for the area ($6-$8 for a pint).  I have only eaten here once and not sure if I would try the food again.  I was pleasantly surprised to find a "hog less" vegetarian option for a sausage that I was excited to try.  The flavors were great, however the consistency was difficult to eat, the thing basically fell apart and broke into a million pieces after one bite so that was a bit of a disappointment. However, for the meat eaters, I have heard rave reviews about the house made lamb, pork, beef & chicken sausages on the menu. 
Overall, always a great experience, good beer, great service, and fun atmosphere.
author: Kelsey B.

description: Yet another trendy, "deconstructed comfort / elevate low class dining" type of business.  Their decor signals that this is their exact aim.  Ordered their "All Day", a beet appetizer, and a salad.  Some of their sausages taste like slim Jim's while others taste of day old Thai basil chicken.  They like to dress their dishes with trendy items which sound nice on paper but aren't well executed within the dish. Their fried duck eggs are of low quality and burnt, their beets are exceedingly tart with a blue cheese dip which does not pair well. And their salad is sad at best.  Their hot sauce is bland and watery.  I appreciate that they're trying but I feel if you aim to elevate certain dishes, they should at least taste as the original.
author: TK T.

description: Hogwash has a disappointing beer selection and sausages crafted with a "can I?" rather "should I?" approach.  Quirky flavors, small portions, and myriad San Francisco homeless right outside the door depresses this to a two star rating.  If you are not already there, I'd skip it.
author: George F.

description: Came by after work with hubby for a quick bite. We ordered the sampler but I think we probably would do better ordering a sandwich. The sampler would be better to balance with some bread, too much meat. Lots of beer on tap but no one can make a recommendation to pair with the sausage sampler, kind of surprise to be honest. Good spot to socialize, DJ was on with tech music.
author: Joanna R.

description: Omg! Found this restaurant based off popular reviews. Just traveled from Florida and we're starving. This place did not disappoint. Very cool vibe. Sandwiches had a unique twist and extremely tasty. Had the sandwich with fried avocado. Avocado will never be the same. Super friendly service. Offering great suggestions on where to immerse ourselves in every thing local.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Came here with 5 other friends and we had a great time. The food was awesome. Beers even better. Each one of the sandwiches were fantastic. The Abe Froman was super tasty. The one dish that didn't make much sense to me and just didn't work that well were the curry fries. It was ok but didn't impress me. Other than that, very good.
author: Steve J.

description: Amazing place and Nick the owner was really friendly, generous and concerned about our liking of the food. We are visiting from NY and weren't sure of what to pick, he was helpful and even gave us tips on where to go for cocktails and breakfast. Definitely a chill place, great ambiance and amazing food.
author: Joana D.

description: In our area, they are very decent. Friendly staff. Except that sometimes they are poorly cleaned. But it's only been a couple of times.
author: Emma A.

description:
Delicious food!

Went in on a Wednesday with no reservation and a party of three. We didn't wait for a table, thanks to the family-style seating arrangement.

Drinks were on point, and the sausages were stupendous.
author: Chip N.

description:
Great food, service and atmosphere. Amazing beer selection.
Just don't try to walk uphill after...
author: Jorge B.

description:
Whenever I go barhopping in the city, I always somehow end up at this spot.  They have a good selection of beers at reasonable prices.  They always have a seat available and the staff is super friendly!

The menu is filled with a bunch of sausages, small bites, and salads.  Unfortunately, I've only had a chance to eat their curry fries.  They're very good.  Not overpowered by curry taste.  Make sure to ask for extra crispy fries.  

Next time I'll try their sausages.  I will definitely be back.
author: Eddie F.

description:
A beer enthusiast dream land! 

Over 30 beers on rotating tap, great variety including sours and beers on nitro. Great ambiance, nice decor and good food selection.

I absolutely love the 55 oz Hog-Goblet Option, a huge pour to beer lovers with big appetite ! 

The owner and staff are awesome, Friendly and very knowledgable. Definitely a place worth coming too.
author: Peter L.

description:
OK I showed up at 11pm on a Sunday night and although Yelp says they are open till midnight, they are not. I had hiked up Powell to get there. The proprietor Paula was gracious and fun beyond belief. 

Eventhough the kitchen and register were closed, Paula let me try a Belgian quad which was so creamy it blew my mind. 

5 Stars on gracious service alone. Don't miss this rising star.
author: Paul H.

description: Awesome beer selection, and tasty sausages. The place is pretty casual. Orders are placed at the bar and food is delivered to your table. We did the Wurstfest, which included several sausages and lots of pickled veggies.
author: Mack S.

description:
I wish I could've written a review on the lamb sandwich and curry fries but I left after being seated at the bar for 20-25 minutes without being acknowledged 

Yes my prides hurt but is it justification that I was the minority while the only other couple next to me was getting the bartender/waiters attention. 

Maybe next time I'll go when it's really busy so I'd feel obliged to seek out the waiter for my order
author: Ryan S.

description: Visiting from out of town and have been to a couple different bars, but this place is the best! Great atmosphere, friendly employees, and great service by bartender Ryan! Wasn't sure which beers we wanted, and he went above and beyond helping us pick out the ones we liked. We will be back again!!
author: Larry P.

description: Cool selection of sausages and toppings, and really cool drink selection. It can be a little pricey if you fall victim to getting all the upgrades/toppings, but it's well worth it.
author: Charlie G.

description: Cool vibe, awesome food, friendly staff.  Great selection of local beers on tap.  We had the burin brick and the monthly special.  Both sausages were flavorful and not greasy!
author: Cate R.

description:
Cool place.  Walked in hungry, not understanding what the place was.  Almost walked out, but glad we stayed.

The sausages were excellent, and very nice selection of beers.

And very close to Westin St. Francis, my go to hotel when in town.

Would definitely visit again.
author: Yi S.

description: Comfort food with a delightful whimsical twist. Had a delicious sausage sandwich with fried avocado and pickled cabbage, with potato chips that were perfectly light and crispy, and a habanero cucumber beer. Bartender was friendly, down to earth and knowledgeable about the extensive beer list. The interior is a mix of clean/modern and rustic. We sat in the window and stuffed our faces. Will be back!
author: Amanda D.

description:
Wow!!! Nothing short of incredible. Hogwash offers a plethora of beer options, which compliment their food selection. My wife and I opted for the Burnin' Brock'. Incredible!!

Additionally, the staff was friendly and attentive. The bartender was helpful as I perused the beer menu and decided on my beer selection. Great staff!
author: Terry M.

description:
Sometimes when traveling, you have to put your faith into your fellow Yelpers and try the little shop that shows big promise. Hogwash was that little place last night, and I must thank my Yelp spidey senses for believing the hype: It was DELICIOUS!!! 

I'm not usually a big sausage fan, yet the Abe Froman sausage was the perfect combination of flavors: a beef, cheddar, and bacon sausage on a fresh roll with basically a salad on top (lettuce, dressing, tomatoes, and the signature house-made pickles). It was enough food I couldn't finish, but light enough I didn't feel weighted down. Then the beer list... Love! The tap list was so extensive that everyone surely would find several options to enjoy. 

This place wasn't slam packed when we arrived, we even got a full communal table to our selves. Yet, slowly as the night waned on, the large selection of beers pulled in quite the crowd. The staff stayed friendly and helpful, no matter the crowd size. Good people, good beers, and good food. Believe the hype and get some!
author: Amy H.

description:
I don't get it...

A friend and I ordered beers, "hot dogs", and the curry fries. The beer selection is really great, and the setup is nice. But the food is really nothing terrific...

The "hot dogs" - I forget the name of the food that we ordered; the first item on the menu and the veggie dog - were forgettable (clearly) and for a $9 dog you really could get something better and cheaper elsewhere. Arugula and egg yeah yeah, fancy sausage on a bun - but really nothing spectacular. 

The curry fries appear to be a hot item on the yelp reviews, but it looked so unappetizing! Like barf on a platter! Curry (basically tasted like Japanese curry) was definitely a refreshing touch to a plate of fries, but they also came with carrots (???) and smothered the fries till the fries were mushy... Ok... Also, not an attractive finger food for two.
author: Harrison K.

description: The curry fries with egg and sausage (I had the lamb sausage) was awesome.  I had seen the rave reviews for the Abe Froman, but found it to be too heavy with smoked paprika and salty for my taste.
author: Mike P.

description: Great selection of beer. Delicious sandwiches. Their salads were nice too. Ugh my mouth is watering just thinking about their sausages, ha ha.
author: Andrea O.

description: Great food- a lil pricey but worth it. Ordered roasted beet salad, curry fried. And burning Brock to share- beet salad amazing. Beer selection is great- lots of CA local brews and a couple gems from afar. Definitely recommend.
author: Branna D.

description:
I get why people like this place - impressive beer list and a pig-laden menu? Kind of a no-brainer. I eat my fair share of hog, but just wasn't in the mood for a gut-busting meal when I came here. Appreciated that they had some veg on the menu, but it's slim-pickings if you're not going all in with a sausage sandwich, smothered fries, or fried pickles. 

Fun ambiance and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. One of the bartenders forgot our drink order and never checked back in with us, but another was super friendly and attentive.
author: Brianna M.

description:
Visited after being awake 24 hours from flight over- it's busy even on a Monday night, but the waitress found us a table.

They have an amazing selection of beers, including several excellent IPAs. Food wise, we just had snacks, but can verify that the fried pickles and curry fries are the bomb.
author: Daniel H.

description: We had visited this place on a Sunday about an hour before closing and were turned away.  For some reason we went back a few days later and to try the food and ordered an Abe Froman, a Hogless, and a couple of beers.  The sausage themed sandwiches were ok, service was ok, and the Beastie Boys playlist got old after the sixth song...maybe sooner.
author: Robert H.

description: The owners of Zeki's have done it again. This lovely place pours a massive selection of beer and serves swine on the side as well. This is a wonderful place to grab a casual, yet classy dinner - think duck egg curry fries and gourmet hot dogs with the fixings. If you're coming for a special occasion (or even if you are not), don't forget to order the goblet. it's the only proper way to celebrate.
author: Patricia K.

description: They have the best sausages and curry fries! Excellent beer selection and the staff is super cool. Get the duck egg, a must!
author: Brian C.

description:
4.5 stars for the staff.  
3.5 for the food.  

"Herb Roasted Beets" 
The beets were warm and looked great but were soaked in a potent vinegar that was almost too strong to eat.  Warm roasted beets need no help other than olive oil, salt and pepper.  

Abe Froman
This is a sausage in a bun with various toppings.  
Not bad at all, but seems like something you would get from a food truck.  

The beer was great and the staff was friendly and helpful.  I would come back, but probably just for drinks.
author: Will V.

description: This place has amazing, unique food and an awesome vibe! I work up the street and my colleagues and we often pop in at lunch time and after work! Everything I've tried so far is amazing... plus, their beer list is killer!
author: Lacey L.

description: Damn goods sausage sandwich.  Me and the Jay to the C wanted something that wasn't a hamburger.  Trek 15 minutes to this place.  I ordered the Abe Froman and she got the Burning Brock.  First of all the roll for both is fresh and soft.  I bit into mines, I was impressed.  Beef cheddar bacon sausage with that 1000 island... Guarantee hit. But I tried hers.  It won.  The spicy chicken sausage with that sweet apple fennel.  winner.  If you want a good sandwich with a hipster feel, this is the place, SON
author: Chris P.

description: Good beer and food. Nice atmosphere and very friendly staff.
author: Nehal M.

description:
Craft beer, Artisanal ground Pork products and various tasty sides. Thinking trendy hipster place? If so, you've described Hogwash.

Friendly staff, Great beer and food. Pub has a great vibe when you enter.

Daughter and I shared the "Abe Froman" and the "Sheepish" sausages and enjoyed both.

The French fries, presented pomme frites style were prepared perfectly. The roasted root vegetable salad was tasty as well.
author: Kt G.

description: Great bartenders, great vibe, greAt food. I had a beer from Iceland and Curry fries with sausage. The man had a smokey dark ale. Sit at the bar, you won't be sorry.
author: Robin C.

description: While I'm a a die-hard devotee to Rosamunde's, I have to say Hogwash definitely stands it's ground when it comes to sausages and beer.  They have an extensive beer menu (with even have three sours on tap!), delicious food (loved the chicken sausage, will be back for the fried pickles), and great service.  Hogwash is a pretty awesome addition to the neighborhood.
author: Joanne G.

description:
Well curated beer selection, good vibes.

I tried the lamb sausage on top of curry fries. A little bit disappointed by the food. Curry was that of Glico packaged curry, fries were no better than Sysco fries.
Sausage had good flavor but I would have preferred it grilled with a crust.

Can't really knock the place on one visit. Would definitely try again as the sandwiches look amazing.
author: Charles C.

description: My new favorite lunch spot. Hog Cobb with quail eggs e'ry day.
author: Adam D.

description:
Great selection of beers - encouraged to tastes first. Had the B-fast sausage w duck egg - Amazing. Was offered a few beer samplers during my meal. 
What great experience!
author: Roland F.

description: Awesome collection of beer and the curry fries totally rock !! The bartenders are very friendly and amazing.
author: Palio P.

description: This restaurant has a good concept and has a good beer selection. However, the sausage and other food options are mediocre. I think that if you've been to other places serving housemade sausages, you will be disappointed. Definitely not a place for anyone who has spent anytime in Europe or any other US restaurant serving sausage (and there are tons of places who do and who do a better job at it). Go here if you want a good beer selection but not if you are looking for exceptional food. Service was just okay. A little affected and a little "couldn't be bothered" attitude.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Came here for a late night after hanging around union square. Lots of different sausage flavors. I ordered a peach arugula salad and a side of sausage. Large drink menu. Chill atmosphere, order food at the bar.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Really good sausages and a fantastic beer selection. We ordered the Burnin Brock, Sheepish, pretzel, and fried pickles and thoroughly enjoyed them all.
author: J V.

description: Great food and they have my favorite beer which is always hard to find (framboise) def worth coming to
author: Lindsey J.

description:
Fun and conveniently located.

Lots and lots of beers for beer ppl.  Very limited wine but what they have is ok.

Snacks are yummy (fried pickles dish and beets dish was yum)

Definitely will return!
author: Lev E.

description: Terrible for groups. DO NOT EAT HERE.  The food was definitely not prepared properly, I felt sick all night and the next day.  I may have given more stars if that was the only problem, but on top of that, the bartenders were demeaning and rude to my friend.  Avoid this place at all costs, its a wannabe hipster tourist trap.
author: Megan C.

description: Get the Curry fries, with a duck egg and Lamb sausage. The best thing I've ever had. Also the beer is legit and the staff is actually good. It's my best after work hang out suggestion but classy enough to take a date here.
author: Nick H.

description: This is one of my favorite spots in SF. I love coming here after work and Neibel is my absolute favorite bartender. Best service ever
author: Jalahn W.

description: Hogwash has quite the impressive beer list to say the least. Definitely worth the walk from the financial district/union square. The bartenders are personable and knowledgeable about what's on rotation, and are generous with taste testers before making your final selection. Not as huge of a fan of the food, fries were meh, but the beer and vibe keep me coming back. If you're looking for a bar to catch a sports game, not the right place, but great to catch up with friends.
author: Angelina G.

description:
Came here the other day to catch up with some old friends.

The Wait: Apparently we just dodged a large crowd (6:30ish). We had to wait about 10 minutes before getting a seat. Not bad for a Thursday night during peak hours. The warriors were also playing this night.

Staff: The staff was friendly and attentive. They asked if we were new (we were), and then walked us through the menu and how the ordering worked. 

The beer: I forgot what beer I ordered, but it was the only sour beer on the menu at the time. Solid beer.

The food: We shared the curry fries with duck egg and the fried pickles. These were absolutely delicious and I highly recommend them. I got the Sheepish as well, and it was good. Sausage in a roll with some toppings type of deal. 

Overall: A very laid back casual atmosphere with some great bites to go with your beer. Recommend coming here for your more low key nights with good friends. I hand out 5 stars very rarely, but this place comes really close.
author: Daniel C.

description: We went here on a whim while on a day trip to the city. Awesome tap list. Food is delicious-- I had the Burnin Brock and my husband had the All Day.  They were both soooo tasty. Service excellent- Paula was at the bar and she rules. We would definitely eat here again!
author: Hillary B.

description: Cool setting. Friendly people. Good food. Definitely coming back.
author: An G.

description:
Dj keeps the interest high
Sausages taste good
Long list of beers with several local, national, imported choices
It´s a great place for a casual night.
author: Lorenzo A.

description: Yelp led me here and I was not let down. A beer enthusiast would enjoy the wide selection on tap. I went for the Abe Froman Sausage Sandwich, paired with a Kale Salad with tangy avocado vinaigrette and goat cheese.  Truly amazing.  The bartender was friendly and helpful ( you line up to order food and its brought to you), and the hostess Paula was cool and friendly as she circulated the crowd.  Looking forward to coming back.
author: Tim S.

description: Ok, not great. There were lots of employees walking around, but the only friendly one who actually said something to the customers was the blonde girl. She was great, friendly and offered tastings of various beers. The guys on the other hand need help in the customer service, looking approachable, and friendly department. Sorry, really wanted to like this place but not as great as people say. Also, the curry fries wit the duck egg wasn't as tasty as I thought. Peanut butter porter was bomb though.
author: Briana W.

description:
Visiting from San Diego and My good friend recommended this place. The pork sausage curry fries were on point even my wife who doesn't really like curry enjoyed it. The staff over there are really chill and helpful. 

Highly recommend.
author: Eddie N Christine D.

description: Paula was really helpful and by far did the most work. She greeted me, sat me, and served me. She even had time to talk to everyone on the restaurant. The two guys were terrible at the beginning, and she kept having to tell them to do stuff. The one guy did near the end of my meal ask me how everything was (after he ignored me at the bar for over 30). The other guy never acknowledged me. The food was pretty quick in being made, but the fried pickles and sub weren't anything special. Good beer selection.
author: Wang C.

description: Your typical SF hipster joint. What is it really beyond the hip looking atmosphere?  An overpriced hotdog stand with a pretty limited menu, plain and simple.  Service?  Well it's pretty good from the bartender...which is whom you must visit to place the food order. That's weird, you're seated by a host(ess) and then told you have to get up and order from the bar.  Then a waitstaff brings the food. Want more?  You guessed it, back up to the bar you go...the wait staff can't (won't) take your order.  That shit is not "the jam"; I'm shaving my beard in protest.
author: Chris R.

description:
Popped in after CNY Parade last night after walking by it and both me and the wife go- "oh, that looks cool!" Seating was easy, hostess is like, THE nicest person in San Francisco. Hippy vegan flower eaters are not welcome, If you're a veggie, you're not invited... Ok maybe you can come. Truth is, one of the SIX sausages we had was completely not meat. I dunno, vegan? Veggie? Dirt? Anyway, who cares, it wasn't real meat, and I  didn't  notice, so Damn. Me and this sweet girl split WURSTFEST- just do it, go pickles over curry fries- curry fries way to huge. WURSTFEST perfect for two, maybe even 3 people if they eat like bitches. 

Beer selection, gotta be a dark one, which they have plenty of. Got a nitro stout from Deschutes, who is God-King of my domain right now. 

Go here. Eatering all the snausage. Try not to talk about kale.
author: Hungry H.

description: Nice lineup of beer on tap. I had the Kolsch which was well done in the Kolsch style from Cologne Germany. Sausage sandwich was was fantastic.
author: Tommy Y.

description: This place has fantastic and unique sausages and an excellent, constantly rotating tap selection. Highly recommended!
author: Ethan E.

description:
Impressive beers on tap! Love the 80s jam. 
The french fries were flawless. 
We ordered hogless, of which I wasn't a big fan. But it's a veggie dish, I'll take what I can get. I'd go back again!
author: Jenny M.

description:
I've been a few times with friends, my lame parents, and a contingent of Ecuadorian government officials and everyone has had a blast. GREAT selection of beers and excellent food... which is weird to say about a sausage place (being a vegetarian) but it's legit. The apps and hogless sausage are the balls. Put them in your mouth... do it now!

But enough about balls in your mouth, go to Hogwash already. Everything you could ask for in a beer bar with good food, so expect a wait if you are showing up with a group. Always helpful to call ahead.
author: M M.

description: Hogwash is my new favorite lunch spot!!!! Their beer selection is amazing and the food is delicious.  I also love the vibe at hogwash, the bartender and staff are all really friendly and it always has cute guys in there- tip for all the single ladies.  Hogwash, can't wait to come back!!!!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
I think if I loved beer, then I would love this place. Unfortunately I don't. 
Came in on a Monday night around 7pm. Was quickly explained that it was self-seating and to order at the bar and take a number. I ordered the Curry Fries with Pork Sausage and Fried Duck Egg - I didn't feel like wine this night. My friend got the Caesar Salad and Hogwash Fries, and Mexican Coke. 
Communal seating can be strange as the table is so small, especially with people trying to talk over each other. 
It was crazily crowded and the food didn't arrive until around 8pm. I was almost dying, pleading for the food to come - almost begging them to bring out whatever. At least they apologized and offered a free beer or a drink - but I was just hungry.
My friend's salad and fries came out first. The fries was alright at first, but the more I ate the harder it was to eat anymore. I love crispy fries - but this was on another level - it surpassed being crunchy and almost to the point of rock hard, which was tiresome to keep eating. If the fries were going to be so crunchy, then make them shoestring fries; or if they wanted to keep the thicker cut then at least let them be somewhat soft inside. 
The croutons on the salad was supposed to be parmesan croutons, however I could not taste the parmesan. On the other hand, each bite into the deep fried crouton released an influx of oil that coated my tongue. Maybe they should consider baking these next time - we all know how bread can soak oil. On a positive note, the lettuce seems fresh and crisp. 
The curry fries were whatever - nothing special there. Same hard, oily fries. The curry sauce looked more like gravy and tasted more like almost nothing. The pork sausage was alright but not every piece gets cooked evenly. At least they can fry an egg! Thanks goodness!

The service was a tiny bit strange as you share a water bottle with all the people around you as well as the waiters and waitresses who would occasionally pour themselves a glass without refilling it. Passing a can of utensils and napkins along the bar was also inconvenient and unnecessary - they should just have more of those so customers doesn't have to be bothered.


Anyways, I can almost guarantee that your fries will never get soggy here! Although I'm not sure if the mediocre food was worth waiting an hour for. Maybe I'll come back next year?
author: Châu B.

description: The chicken Cobb salad was excellent.   It was butter lettuce with quail eggs with blue cheese chunks and the best homemade chicken sausage.
author: Edith B.

description: Yep - good as the reviews. Chicken sausage and habanero Caesar salad were amazing, and the midnight death and taxes beer was top notch.
author: Jamie W.

description: What can I say... First of all, they no longer have Lagunitas Little Sumpin' Ale!!! But that's all good, their service & food made up for it. As long as the Hefeweizen is still available then I'm sold! My last visit, I had Burnin' Brock. It was pretty good but it wasn't spicy enough for my liking but overall, I would recommend it to a friend. My main love is the curry fries w/ duck eggs, the amount of curry sauce was just enough and yet, the fries was still crispy. I'd comeback for sure!
author: Kat N.

description: Had some early morning business in the city with my brother and got done early so we decided to look for a craft beer joint with lunch. So many places to choose from, only one that was open at 11am. Hogwash was perfect for us. Walking distance to BART, not a huge menu but great sandwiches served with home fries. We had the Burnin' Brock, it was great. I could eat the fried avacado alone as an appetizer. Also an Impressive selection of craft beer.  Janelle our bartender/ server was fantastic and even bought us a round.  Definitely plan on going back. Only complaint would be that they don't serve the fried pickles that everyone seems to be raving about during lunch. Fix that PLEASE.
author: William K.

description:
Arrived here at 8, seated at 8:45, and got my food at 9:30. The servers and bartenders here are nice, but the service is just way too slow. For some sausages and fries, the wait was way too long. And I don't think it was worth the wait. 

Curry fries that everyone raves about didn't even have much curry sauce on them and they were so hard. They took it belong crunchy into small rock territory. It just wasn't enjoyable and we didn't finish them.

My friend and I both got chicken sausages and another got the lamb. Chicken was okay, but nothing incredible. My bun was only sliced partway and the coleslaw was messily spilled everywhere except in the dog. Bun wasn't very good either; I didn't finish it. The lamb tasted better than the chicken, but again, not that impressed. 

Great beer selection and decent prices. And the bartenders work quickly. 

I do like the atmosphere and the music. I'm a fan of 80s and 90s songs. But later on at night they started playing top 40, which was irritating. Anyway, for the wait, I'd go somewhere else for better food and faster service.
author: Winnie T.

description: Good spot for a beer.  I had a local Peanut Butter Porter from Sacramento.  I love San Francisco for the simple fact that even in a pub called Hogwash they have a lot of good vegetarian options.  I had the kale salad and the curry fries...Delicious.
author: Jessiqa P.

description: Really liked this place. Stopped in for a beer and some snacks with the family. Greeted and seated with a warm welcome. Staff is very welcoming, food was great and the beer list is just about perfect. Wish this was on the east coast! A definite stop for anyone visiting the San Fran area.
author: Jim C.

description:
Pros:
- Great selection of well kept beer
- Excellent chips (fries) and curry sauce

Cons:
- The hot dogs were extremely disappointing. The sausage:bun ratio was all wrong - the sausages were very small, and dwarfed by the buns. The one I had (the all-day) was totally flavourless - it was meant to be a pork sausage with maple and ginger, but there was no evidence of these latter flavours, and the whole thing was totally overpowered by the wildly unnecessary addition of rocket (arugula), which has no place anywhere near anything claiming to resemble an all-day breakfast.
- It was expensive for what you got. The hot dogs were $12.50 without fries ($5 more, or $8 if you get curry sauce), and just weren't nice or adventurous enough to warrant a gastro-pub price.

In short, there should have been more sausage, more taste, less bun, less random experimentation, and a lower price tag.

The chips and beer *were* good, though.
author: Christopher N.

description:
Kinda a wash. I ordered the veggie salad and they gave me the hogless sandwich. When I said it wasn't what I ordered and I pointed at the salad on the menu they said "that's the veggie" and walked off. I had just worked a 12 hour shift and did not want to wait for more food. 

I also ordered the hot olives which was ok, but very oily. Since it came with pesto I don't think the olives needed the added oil. The bread that came with it did not have much flavor to me.

The place was clearly busy and I'm sure the staff had a lot to juggle. As I ate the food I didn't order I looked around and wondered to myself why people enjoy standing elbow to elbow just to drink some beer. 

I tipped 40% anyway because I understand that when it is busy, it becomes difficult to pay attention to details, but I won't be back. They also put a couple of extra beers on my friends tab that they did not order.
author: Travis B.

description: Everyone from Hogwash was SO friendly from the minute we walked in the door!  The prices are reasonable, the food is super tasty...OMG...the fried pickles are awesome!  No worries...about not having enough cold beer and wine was great too.  It's clean and has a great vibe!
author: Amy D.

description: Simple, elegant design without beer taps to confuse you. Just ask the friendly bartender and they'll give you a solid response! Lunch just started this week and I have absolutely recommend it!
author: Jim M.

description:
I like this place, but did not love it. The beer selection was good and the bartenders were super nice when I was trying to decide which one I wanted to go with. They allowed me to sample before committing to a beer to order. I went with a few friends and we got a few things to split -- fried pickles, beets and goat cheese, spicy caesar and the meatless sausage. It was all good but not amazing. Also, the menu is pretty limited, unless you want a sausage you're kinda SOL on food options.

There are a lot of communal tables and it gets pretty crowded after work so if you have a group I'd suggest getting there on the earlier side to ensure you get a table.  Overall I did like the place but still think Hopwater is a better option all around.
author: Lizzy U.

description: GREAT beer selection and delicious simple food. My only complaint is that they don't sell Hogwash merch. I need a shirt with their pig logo on it!
author: Caitlin L.

description: Curry fries and handmade sausages -- with a fried egg on top. Craft beer on tap. What's not to love? Bartenders/waitstaff were super helpful and attentive. I went around 8pm on a weekday and didn't have any trouble getting a seat or ordering right away.
author: Mike M.

description: My roommate and I checked out Hogwash the other night and I was very impressed. I had the kale salad and we split some fried pickles and the curry fries. Everything looked and tasted great. I'm actually fasting from meat for three weeks, so I was unable to try a lot of things on the menu, but my roommate ordered lamb sausage and said it was awesome. I loved the atmosphere of Hogwash too. It's candlelit, welcoming, and laid back. Very cool spot to check out late at night.
author: Andrew L.

description: Just simply great local beer and well made artisanal sausages. Great vibe and fun place to hang out
author: Bryan W.

description:
It's extremely hard to find an amazing bar with equally amazing food. Bar food usually tends to be predictable and mediocre. 

However, Hogwash slaps that stereotype right across the face! SOLID beer and SOLID sausages. Literally, it was a sausage and beer fest in there. The beers are artisan and absolutely delicious. The bartender/waitress was extremely knowledgeable and made some great recommendations when we described what kind of beer we were in the mood for. 

As for the food, our taste buds were more than tantalized! Even if you don't particular enjoy sausages, you will become a convert after trying Hogwash's. I highly recommend ordering what we ordered: 

1. Sausage sampler platter with pork breakfast sausage (my personal favorite), lamb sausage, chicken habanero sausage, and beef & bacon sausage. The flavor profile was so intense and the texture varied from very soft to firmer across all of them. This is an absolute must-order if you're planning on dining here!
2. Curry fries with fried duck egg and sausage of your choice (we had it with lamb sausage). Dear god, so freaking good! This is basically a really fancy poutine and it literally hit all of the right spots. 

On your next trek through the Tendernob, definitely consider Hogwash. The vibe is slightly upscale casual so it's perfect for a sexy date night, night out with friends or a catch up session with a friend. It was ~$75 for 2 of us for our food order and a beer each, so typical SF restaurant-fare, not bar-fare. But it's completely worth it! 

Happy Eating, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description: I absolutely LOVE this place! The dim lights, the great selection of beers and their FOOD is amazing. We had a german sausage with a duck egg on top and some arugula, if I'm not wrong, and it was to die for. Also their fried pickles were delicious. Service was beautiful. This was a suggestion from a local who was walking by and it was GREAT!!!! If you're San Fran, definitely stop by!
author: Laura P.

description: The perfect place to stumble across on a night out in Union Square. Trendy but super welcoming. The beer list is a little intimidating but the knowledgable bartenders are always there to help you find your new favorite beer (not too hard on the eyes either). I had the Burnin' Brock sandwich with a lamb sausage - they have a house made mustard that made it absolutely incredible. This place takes your basic beer and brats and curates it into an art form. Very much looking forward to going back.
author: Ruth F.

description:
Popped in here for dinner during a work trip and had an amazing sausage sandwich and kale salad. The food and beer selection was so rad I came back two more times the same week. All the sausages I tried were great but the roasted root salad are curry fries are pure amazeballs! 

So many good choices in SF but Hogwash just climbed to the top of my list. Great atmosphere and music choices, too. Staff was fantastic....Super friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive. Gotta check this place out.
author: Dan B.

description: This place was a fantastic find. I went with some colleagues to grab a bite and some local beer.  I had the All Day sandwich.  You can never go wrong with a sunny side up fried egg on pork breakfast sausage!  The beer selection was outstanding. The service will fast and friendly. I'm already looking forward to heading back during my next trip in June!
author: Terry H.

description: Yum! I was pleasantly surprised by Hogwash. I stopped by with a group of friends after doing some bridesmaids' dress shopping at Weddington Way.  We ordered the Burmin' Brock, the Abe Froman and the Sheepish, along with fries and beer.  Everything was on point! The Sheepish (lamb sausage, blue cheese sauce, pickled veggies and beets) was hands down my favorite. The portion sizes are also pretty generous for the price. I took half my sandwich home, and fought over it the next day with the hubs (and the dog).
author: Connie S.

description:
Went to grab some beer and a quick dinner with my husband. We were very pleased with the quick service, large selection of beer, and a great menu.

The menu is focused on meat, but I'm a vegetarian and found a few good options. I decided to order the peaches and arugula salad. It was delicious! My husband loved the sandwich he ordered, which had chicken sausage and fried avocados.

For a busy joint on Saturday night, the service was great and the food and beer were delicious. I would definitely visit again.
author: Ashton N.

description:
Love this cute little gastropub!! Convenient location right on Sutter. 

Probably not the best for group seating, but they have small tables in the back for groups of 2-4. 

The drinks are cheap, the bartenders are SO nice, and you can sample anything you want! I was actually so full after my 5 samples (it probably added up to half a glass), that I almost didn't buy anything... but the Monks Cafe Sour is SO SO good. I also had some of the Blueberry Ale and the Belgium Tripel. I was so impressed with all the tastings and each sample made me change my mind. Ended up with a full goblet of the Sour in my hand at the end of the night. 

I didn't get to try the food here - but I know I'll be coming back! Wait for my review update!
author: Sally C.

description:
The story of this five-star review begins with me walking out of the restaurant in a huff.

This was the second place in a row that had seat-yourself seating, with two-people nursing drinks at four-top tables -- you had to have eagle eyes and fast reflexes if you had any hope of sitting down. To make matters worse, this place had more than half the restaurant reserved for a private party. On a Friday night.

I got tired of waiting, and went outside to get some air, and some guy who was just coming in asked me how I liked it. I told him it sucked, that we didn't eat anything and were leaving because we couldn't get a seat and no one seemed to care. 

As it turns out, this was Nick, the owner, who asked me to give him a chance, and a minute to find a table. He asked one party of three taking up a table for six, and they said no. Then he found three empty spots in the reserved section and said we'd have to finish by 7:30 (45 minutes from then), but we'd probably have longer than that. 

The food was great, the beer was cold, and the meal was overall outstanding. Thanks, Nick!
author: Brian P.

description: Hogwash was the perfect spot for my husbands 30th birthday celebration! When Mother Nature brought a rainstorm the weekend we were planning on camping out with 20 friends, we were without a plan and no place to celebrate. I called Hogwash to see if they could accommodate our group, and not only did they save my husbands birthday weekend- they really helped make it a truly memorable night! The food (I had the chicken sausage), beer selection and service was nothing short of incredible! Our friends loved Hogwash too! They even helped with serving the cake we brought to celebrate... went completely above and beyond! :) Thank you so much Nick and Paula for having us and making Brandon's birthday so special!!
author: Court R.

description:
I am not a beer girl -- but make this stop and try at least one beer. The handmade sausages are fantastic! But the secret gem here - order the warmed olives with Arugula Pesto (to die for!). The fries are very good, as well.

The "beer people" in our group tried three different ones and all were excellent. One tried a cider that's very good.  Us girls had a "lunatic lager" which was great and a tiny sized dark beer (last on the menu) which was good also. 

We each had a different sausage "dog" and all were fab - great sides, like beet relish, deep-fried avocado, spicy pickles. 

No reservations here and you'll stand in line to order but it's all worth the effort. I'd definitely make my way here next time in SF!
author: Dawn A.

description: Really enjoyed this gastro pub. Perfect for meeting friend(s) and sharing a diverse selection of beers and tasty and complimentary food. The curry fries with a duck eggs sounds odd but is perfect with an IPA. A bit noisy for an intimate meal with someone special. Tried it on a Sunday nite and there was no wait but I can see this place being really baked on other nites. Will be coming again!
author: D Y.

description: Awesome selection of craft ales, artisan sausage sandwiches. Walk in easy on a Thursday lunch, friendly staff and Johnny Cash was playing on the juke box... 'King marvelous.
author: Piers H.

description: AMAZING. We are visiting from AZ and found this place. If you haven't been, just go already! Unlike that it's a smallish menu and they put love into those sausages! We got the sampler and the curry fries and couldn't finish it all. The beer list is also impressive and they let us try a few before we decided. Excellent service and overall a great experience!!
author: Megan B.

description:
The Roasted Root Vegetable Salad is Awesome!!
Great Beer and Sausage Sandwiches!
author: Joe M.

description:
Stumbled upon this place while looking for a quick bite and a drink before a show. Love the layout and decor. Didn't know what kind of food this place served but was pleasantly surprised when it was sausage sandos. My wife and I shared the "Abe Froman" and a side of fries.  Anyone who references Abe Froman is a guy I want to drink with.   My only regret was not ordering my own. Food was awesome, service was friendly and low key. 

I read some of the other reviews saying "not another Gastropub" or whatever which kind of made me laugh.  Someone even slammed the way they have water on the tables  which both my wife and I thought was really cool looking and convenient.   If SF doesn't want you pack up and move to Burlingame, San Mateo, or San Carlos and watch the money roll in. The people writing those kind of reviews are the same ones that hate anything that is universally loved.  Maybe it's just the St Bernardus talking.
author: Dave P.

description: Didn't eat here but stopped in for some beers.  They didn't have as big of a selection as I hoped but the ambiance made up for it.  Love that they have bar seats next to the windows so that you can people watch while enjoying the beverage of your choice
author: Mr G.

description:
I was a little disappointed. Perhaps, I should have read the reviews or the website a bit better. My expectation was more of a general gastropub and the reality is mostly sausages. That's fine, but you gotta be in the mood for it. My fiancee found the menu a bit limited. 
The beer selection is quite good as is the vibe of the place. Although it is order-at-the-bar we were served at our high top near by. Service was very good and friendly.
