author: Mark C.

description:
Dropped in for food and of course beer on a Tuesday night around 8:30. Place was packed and deafeningly loud. Nice, cleanly renovated space. Due to Union Square location, mix of SF urbanites and drunk business travelers from flyoverland - they're the ones in the cheap sports coats.

Very good, well priced (many pours are $6-7) craft beer selection, both local and imported. Owner is friendly and comes out to chat with customers. 

Alas, my beef-chedder-bacon (at least that's what the menu said, I could discern none of those flavors) sausage on a dreary hot dog bun was inedible. I kept having to spit out big pieces of gristle. No point in making your own sausage if it's going to be worse than I can buy at Whole Foods (great sausages!) or Berk Bowl. Up your game and I'll up my review, Hogwash.
author: Nick C.

description: First time stopping by this location. The staff are friendly and they have a decent amount of beer selections. The food was tasty but not life changing. If you're in the ate is worth a detour but I wouldn't make a special trip.
author: Bronson C.

description:
As a bar/pub, this place's ambiance and food is great. Seating is limited but it's all bar-style with shared tables and such. 

As for food, I really enjoyed the fried pickles (the aioli was unlike any of I've tasted) and the batter itself was flavored well. I also had the Burnin' Brock sandwich, which was good, but not amazing. I thought the flavoring and sauces that were already included weren't that unique or tasty but each table has ketchup/mustard/hot sauce so that helped a bit. There's a huge selection of beers that my boyfriend really enjoyed, so again, as a bar this really is a great place. 

I didn't enjoy the seating system as much - we waited for a while to order our food and then to have a seat to wait for it. The lines to order food + drinks took a bit of a time so even getting water took a bit of time. They were quite busy on a weekend evening, but it just felt a big disorganized. As long as you come in knowing all this, this is a pretty fun place. I can imagine it'd be a great place to meet people at the communal tables you're at.
author: Cissy C.

description:
I can't believe I'm giving a sausage restaurant 5 stars. BUT I AM!

I've been walking by this cute space for some time, but I never had a compelling "I could really go for a sausage dinner" feeling. I wish I could go back in time and kick myself.

Fantastic beer selection, well paired with the creative sausage selection. We ordered the "Burning Brock"  (Hello fried avocados?!), "All Day", and the fried pickles.

 I'm telling you, this meal was NAUGHTY.
author: Haley J.

description: Just happened by this great bar. Went inside to check it out and we were hooked. Great bar with great people. Several beer and wine choices. Just a really good place to hang and enjoy friends. Thank you Nick for the dessert, it was delish. I highly recommend Hogwash. Can't say enough about this place.
author: Julie B.

description: Beers were wonderful. The place was very modern, casual, and comfortable. Too much focus on pigs for someone who doesn't eat meat... makes it difficult to move on from our smart porcine friends and enjoy the evening. Fried pickles were very good. They let you taste the beer first, which is also nice.
author: Shannon S.

description:
The best bar in San Francisco--easy. Ask me why....beer as far as the eye can see and I am talking unique beer (paso robles lager anyone?) . They have a nice selection of bar bites as well, i can only attest to the fried pickles (unreal) but the rest looks amazing. 

Nick and Paula (owners) take great care to make sure everyone feels at home. If you have been to Zeki's on California (if you haven't....shame on you) then you will know what i am talking about. 

Hogwash is just great. Highly recommended
author: Ben K.

description:
Popular so it took time to get a seat. Good beer selection but small food selection. My sausage came cut in half, which made it easier to eat but they cut through the egg and the yolk dripped to the bottom of the basket instead of my stomach.  The wait for the food was slightly on the long side. 

It was hard to know there was someone in charge of seating. No signs, no podium at the front.  

Best if you just go for drinks and don't expect a seat unless you are there at off peak times. I went on a Wednesday night.
author: steven l.

description:
Hogwash was a pretty great experience. WIth that said, here's my breakdown:
1. Family style seating, the hostesses have no reservations about placing you between two people. 
2. Beer selection is grade A, a fantastic selection of German & Belgians.
3. Food: Curry fries were excellent, but the portion size was not great for the price (hence the knock of a star). 
4. Get the lamb sausage, its fucking delicious.

Overall a good experience, and if you like pig, get yo' ass over there.
author: Greg M.

description:
Meh.

The sausage sandwich I had was pretty okay, but was definitely overpriced at $12-13.  Everything besides the sausage was super plain, and the sausage was sort of lost amidst all the other flavors of the sandwich, particularly the standard lubrications Americans need to eat.  Curry fries and fried pickles were oddly the highlight of the meal, particularly the fries, but that calls more to the comfort food person in me.  If I had to actually reflect, both the curry and fries were unspectacular, but putting them together was just what I needed for a winter's night.

The service was on the bad side.  The waiter took my order number stand thing and didn't realize that I had ordered a sandwich in addition to the curry fries (to share, to allay your judgments), but only delivered the latter.  It caused some minor confusion.  They also didn't restock our water, which is generally a huge pet peeve of mine.  The food also didn't come together because of the way they do things (order at the counter), which some people may care about.  It's still mildly annoying when I'm done with my food and my friend didn't get theirs yet.
author: Norman S.

description: We needed a quick late night dinner and found Hogwash just a short walk from The Westin where we were staying. Loved it from the minute we walked in. The place had a great energy and the staff was friendly and got us seated right away. Great selection of craft beers. I ordered a Peanut Butter Stout which was wonderful. We started with Fried Pickles and split a Burnin' Brock and Sheepish sandwich. The habanero sausage in my Burnin' Brock had just the right amount of kick to it. Highly recommend it.
author: Deirdre F.

description:
Best happy hour joint in Union Square. The blonde hostess is such a doll! She was very accommodating and just so sweet and nice. Can't wait to go back!!!!

The Sour beer from Almanac rocks and damn the fried pickles and curry fries rock my world.
author: Jackie P.

description:
We had high expectations for this place as it sounded really cool. I mean, it is a gastro-pub in San Francisco. I was surprised at the service style in this place. We sat ourselves, which is ok, and waited to be greeted. A server brought over two clean water glasses (for the water bottle left on the table from the previous guests) and menus. We reluctantly drank the water and they brought us a fresh bottle later. 

We thought someone would come back to take our order, but they didn't. After waiting for some time I walked up to the bar to place our order. We waited for what seemed like a long time for our food to arrive. The place was somewhat small and not too busy. A gentleman (either owner or manager - who spent more time talking to friends versus working) told us sorry the food was taking long and it would be right out. 

Once the food arrived, the server told us she would comp our food since it took so long. We appreciated that and only had to pay for beers. We had fried pickles which were salty, crunchy, and enjoyable. We had a sausage sandwich (habenero chicken). It seemed disjointed as some of the toppings didn't integrate well (the deep fried avocado). We only ate half of it and quickly paid our bill and moved on. 

The service was strange with average food, but the people were pleasant and apologetic.
author: Ed V.

description:
Came here during SantaCon as a less busy place with a great beer selection. We ended up staying for dinner and loved it all! Fried pickles and pickled veggies are a must. 

Any place with Fresh Squeezed IPA is a place for me.
author: Tyler W.

description: Good beer selection - great sausage.  The curry fries are awesome.  It doesn't purport to be anything else, but some in our party felt the menu was too limited.  Fast friendly service.  It was a little strange to have to order everything from the bar, but it worked just fine.
author: James P.

description: Great service, food and atmosphere.  We had the Burnin Brock, Pineapple Buck and Kale Salad.  All were great and tasty.  We also had the Haromonic Kolsch and Blueberry Ale were was very refreshing.
author: Keith L.

description: Simply outstanding. A small but warm and friendly pub specializing in beer and sausages. Be prepared to share your space with another party. Staff was attentive and friendly. Food was delicious.
author: Chris C.

description:
Very tasty food but I felt it was a little bit pricy. Cozy bar atmosphere. 
They keep your credit card from the time of order until you leave, which I felt was quite strange.
author: Teddy M.

description: 2 words: fried pickles! They were amazing!! Best ones I've ever had sadly I'm from Chicago so it's a long trip to get them again  service was great all the bar tenders were very nice and attentive. The end of the night was slightly confusing because it said that they were open until 2am, but they did a last call at 11:30. Then proceeded to serve drinks until almost 11:50. The drinks were all reasonably priced.  I would definitely recommend this place and I'll definitely be back next time I'm in the area
author: Lindsay F.

description: This place is phenomenal! We were so impressed by the atmosphere, food and beer. My fiancé had two beers and was immediately trying to find where he can purchase them. The sausage platter is a must order! We will be back for sure
author: Brittney G.

description: Love this place. Beautiful bar and really cozy ambiance. Paula, the owner, is extremely friendly and really takes of her guests. The food is phenomenal as well, while the bar offers many delicious beers on tap.
author: Sally P.

description: The yelp review got us to this place.. amazing atmosphere and fantastic food.. The employees are extremely nice, they kept checking around to see if they can get us seated quickly. Overall loved the experience, we will definitely revisit.
author: Akki N.

description: First time here with a great overall experience.  We actually came for dessert which they don't have (please get at least two unique items soon).  But if you like beer (real beer that doesn't come in a can) this is the place.  I had the Ballast Point Sculpin IPA from San Diego and it was great.  My wife enjoyed a Cock n Bull ginger beer and we shared the fried pickles.  We'd be back - assuming they add some desserts.
author: Jeff W.

description:
Do yourself a favor and get yourself to hogwash ASAP. Stopped by around 8 o'clock on Friday night and the place was bumpin'. If you're looking for an intimate table for two, keep hiking. This is the sort of place where you round up all yer friends grab a couple beers and spend the evening swapping stories. 

We snagged some seats at the bar and opted for bites rather than a full blown dinner. GET THE FRIED PICKLES. The fries were tasty as well. The beets were definitely interesting... I'll put it this way:  they're the best beets I've ever had. But I mean, they're beets. Olives were great! 

The beer selection is pretty expansive. Although I was sad to see they only had one wheat beer. Regardless, everyone was able to find a pint they really enjoyed. 

The service was amazing. Very attentive and knowledgable bar staff. Everyone was friendly and accommodating. 

10 for 10 would go again- just sad their isn't a hogwash in my hometown of Austin, TX!
author: Wendi W.

description: I was looking for the perfect spot to celebrate a friends birthday and this was it! The craft beer options were excellent and the atmosphere allowed for a larger group to hang around and order as people arrived. Food was quick and servers were very friendly. Loved the goblet size beer offering.
author: Kenzie S.

description: Wow. Amazing atmosphere and the most knowledgeable bar dudes in SF. Great range of IPAs. Always love coming here. Try the beers before you buy, and go for the great sausage sandwiches. Service amazing. Man City fans especially welcome! This evening I had the Fort Point IPA and the kale salad.
author: Andrew S.

description: It's a nice place, no doubt.  New and a little disorganized in the back (took forever to get a plate of pickles and we were one of maybe 5 parties there at the time).  But, people are friendly, food is good for a pub, and the space is very nice.  It's an odd location but if you're in the hood, swing by.
author: David S.

description: This is the favorite after work go-to spot. Amazing beer list on tap. Fried pickles you remember and crave a few days later. Super friendly bartenders and staff. My number one place to grab a drink anywhere near union square.
author: meaghan r.

description: Such a great place!  The beer selection is pretty extensive and good.  Also, the food is phenomenal even though the menu is a little limited.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting or living in the city.
author: Chris R.

description:
I live around the corner and I was expecting a little more in terms of the menu. I had the sausage sampler and all but the vegan were great. Nice place for a quick bite and a beer. Owner was really wonderful.

Curry fries are legit.
author: Alissa M.

description:
Amazing. See the five stars? Ya i thought so. So many great beers on tap, great ambiance and SWEET tunes. I had the fried pickles which were so good. I can't say enough good things about Hogwash. If you live in the neighborhood then you probably know Zekis, if you know Zeki's you know Nick and Paula know what is going on. 
Do yourself a favor and get down here ASAP before there is a line outside the door
author: Saara M.

description: A little expensive for a fancy hot dog, but good quality and nice staff!
author: Paul L.

description: Had to work a little late and missed the standard dinner hour, so I started searching for great food nearby. I landed on Hogwash and am so glad that I did! Their Burnin' Brock was incredible. I paired it with the curry fries. I was definitely skeptical about how well curry would taste with fries, but it was awesome. Super glad that I tried this local spot. I'll be back again!
author: Dustin L.

description: I love coming here when i visit SF. The food is great, the best beer selection & the staff is always so friendly. The last time my husband and I came here, our server Ryan was super accommodating. My husband LOVES good beer and Ryan gave him the best suggestions!
author: Chelsea D.

description: I took my mother here while she was visiting from the Midwest. We were greeted by all of the friendly staff members when we arrived and we both felt completely taken care of the whole time. I loved the casual atmosphere and how they have water out on the tables. My mother had the Habanero Ceasar Salad, I had the The All Day, and we shared the fried pickles. All three were great, but I would actually rate the fried pickles one star less than the other two though... I had read all the reviews here and maybe had overly high expectations.  The other two meals- perfection. (and my 63-year old mother agrees with my review :))
author: Amber L.

description: Stumbled into this place after work and didn't end up leaving for a few hours. Dozens of beer on tap and a very chill vibe. Great place to catch up with friends or start a night out at.
author: Jenni M.

description: Stopped by this place for lunch one day. I had the Abe Froman and a Diet Coke which came in a bottle. The sausage sandwich was very good but was slightly under cooked the reason for the three stars. It did have a good taste with the condiments that was on it. I would eat there again.
author: Alan G.

description: Amazing food & beers.  I had an amazing Blueberry Sour & a Hog Cobb salad; Delicious!  Paula,(owner/bartender) was a real treat. I will definitely go back to see her sweet face. Get here now you will not be disappointed.
author: Jack S.

description:
Love it!  Most excellent!

Whenever I travel to San Francisco, Hogwash is always a destination.  I am working my way through the menu (all sausages have been great so far!) and the curry fries are must add!

The bartenders are super helpful to guide your selection of beers on tap!
author: Sean D.

description: Food is very good. Noise was average. Not a huge fan of the prices. Someone advertised a happy hour but there was no happy hour. Bar tenders were very nice, attentive, and fast. Most likely will revisit.
author: Tiffany H.

description: The Curry Fries with duck egg were amazing! Also, fried Avacado on anything =amazingness.  Great beer selection.  Definitely a great place to visit when staying at the Marines Memorial Hotel.
author: Anthony K.

description: Fried pickles, fried pickles, fried pickles. Best I've had, but a little rich.
author: Ellen P.

description: Love Hogwash ...was visiting San Fran for only 3 days but hung out at the bar a couple of times thanks to the wonderful beer on tap , delectable bar food  & the lovely owners ...Looking forward to coming back here on my next trip !
author: Justin S.

description:
Rarely do I find a restaurant that does everything so well. Food, ambiance, service, booze selection, greeting, etc. I don't think some places realize just how important that first impression is. My new friend and I (yay for Dreamforce attendees rolling solo!) walked over from our hotel bar to grab some food after I saw the great Yelp reviews here. 

It was a little drizzly and cool outside so when I walked in I must have made some sort of noise indicating I was cold because the hostess immediately pulled us in and asked us how many...while simultaneously ushering us over to the bar where she said we could get a drink and wait for our table. Such a great first impression...already loving this place. 

Then two minutes later she comes over and says we should just sit at the bar if we aren't opposed since some gentlemen had just left. So we cozied up and were introduced to the friendly bartenders. Can we just talk about how few bartenders these days wear a smile? These guys were allllll smiles and jokes and immediately made us feel comfortable. If I inquired about a beer on their extensive list, I got a taster without even requesting it. Top notch service, indeed. I'm from Austin so I'm more used to being scoffed at if I ask about multiple beers on the menu like I'm supposed to be a walking beer encyclopedia and should be ashamed if I'm not. 

I'd heard from the bartenders at our hotel that the fried pickles here were not to be missed. I was so glad for this tidbit when I took my first bite. Beer battered pickle chips with a garlic aioli will now be a part of my last meal should I ever find myself on death row. These things were insane. Perfectly fried, hardly any grease. 

Next we tried an Abe Froman and another of the dogs on the menu. They cut them in half for us so we could both sample them without creating a mess. I really appreciate a restaurant that will do this. 

Every bite was better than the last, and I was almost wishing I'd just gotten a whole one of each just for myself (my stomach thanked me for not!). 

Toward the end of the meal the hostess appeared behind the bar so I asked her a question about the taps. There are no visible markings on them so we were thinking the bartenders were just straight up badasses and had each tap memorized for what it was. She laughed at this since that seems to be the idea and then told us they have it written on the very top. This lead to a conversation about how the hostess, Paula, is actually the owner!!!! I was floored. She can't be a day over 25 and she owns this fantastic gastrobup in the heart of San Francisco. It doesn't get any cooler than that....oh well, except the fact that she still pours her heart and soul into it by being the first face you come into contact with when you arrive. I really really like that about this place. By the time we left I felt like it would definitely be a neighborhood bar that I'd go to on the regular if I lived there. She said they have some people who are in there 4-5 nights a week that have become like family. What more could you ask for?? 

You can tell Paula and the rest of the crew really care about what they're doing here from the smiles to the amazingly delicious food combos. This will be a place that I come back to every time I'm in San Fran from here on out!
author: Emily P.

description: Great beer selection and delicious food, it doesn't get much better than this. Sausage heavy menu as one would expect from the name. I had the All Day (sausage plus egg plus arugula on top of a yummy roll) and it was delicious. Fries were great too. Service was quick and friendly, and so I would definitely come back.
author: Anthony H.

description: My first trip to San Francisco was for the RSA conference.  One of the highlights of the trip food wise was my discovery of Hogwash.   First, the staff was attentive and knowledgeable.   The food, simply amazing.   The curry fries, ridiculously delicious.  My first trip I got the Burnin' Brock, a perfectly prepared chicken habanero sausage dish.  When I returned a few days later, I tried the equally perfect Abe Foreman.  If you find yourself anywhere near this place, go.
author: Jason D.

description: Had the All Day..which is fantastic..pretty cool place to eat, have a drink, and hang with friends
author: LoLo H.

description:
HOGWASH is the bomb. I had been hearing a lot about this new joint and it far surpassed my expectations. Super cool vibe, great food and diverse international beer list.... Not just west coast IPAs here. 

Really enjoyed the Lamb sausage and blue cheese sandwich, but the beets were probably my favorite item on the menu.  Paired it with a Gaffel Kölsch and was happy as a pig in sh#t.  

I'll be back at hogwash soon for late night grub.
author: Danny K.

description: Ordered Hogwash fries.. horrible fries... how can somebody go wrong with as basic as fries.. inedible :(
author: Ekta B.

description: Great food, but the staff was amazing!  The food came quick and was hot and delicious!  We had the fried pickles , Abe Froman, and the All Day!  Yummmmm!
author: Andrea B.

description: It's diggity dope of the dopeness. A solid 5 stars for the food & service.
author: Abigail C.

description: This place is super cool. My coworker and I stopped here before a work event to grab some drinks and food. This place has a super cool look inside. It has this rustic/modern look to it. They have a great selection of beer and just a few wines on the menu, but no liquor. Which I don't mind. I enjoy beer and wine more, but I wish they have more wine options. I ordered the Tangent and it was delicious. My coworker and I also split the curry fries. They were so good and such a unique combination. This is definitely a good place to grab drinks and appetizers before dinner or just to grab some drinks and grub with coworkers after work. The bar tenders are super friendly which is always just a plus after having a long day at work. Check them out!
author: Rebecca M.

description: If you are into sausages, sandwiches and beer this is the place. Had the All Day breakfast sausage with a sunny side up duck egg and it was awesome. Fries were average but the fried pickles we're awesome, we ordered several plates for the table.
author: Chris M.

description:
The sausages and beets are out of this world. Very solid beer list- great picks from a lot of west coast breweries. Good selection of "lighter" beers for those who aren't accustomed craft beer (as if those people exist in California?? Ha!) 

Music and atmosphere are both enjoyable- great crowd and everyone around us seemed to be having a good time.

Will definitely be back any time I'm lucky enough to be in SF.
author: Annie G.

description:
We were lucky enough to stumble upon Hogwash on a Friday night when the surrounding hot spots were too busy (word has it that this one-week old gem has been packed to date already!).  
Food was excellent- beets with goat cheese, fried pickles, spicy chicken sausage on a tasty caesar salad...but the friendly service was even better.  The food took a while (loads of apologies!), but was well worth it- and we got to talk with the owner while we waited anyhow.  
Great presentation- rustic, metal, pie-plate style dishes, silverware and napkins on-table, and communal seating.  
Love it- and I am sure that, they too, will always have a line out the door!!!  Heck- we would come back just for that mustard alone :)
author: Gina G.

description: The food and service are amazing. We got the curry fries with duck egg and the chicken sausage sandwich (sorry I forgot the name of it), they were both absolutely delicious. We even amended our order a few minutes after placing it, and the young blonde woman behind the counter could not be more kind! The beer choices were vast as far as I could tell, but it was honestly too loud and crowded to stick around past the conclusion of our meal. Would I go hear again, absolutely, but at some random afternoon hour, because Hogwash is a victim of it's own success; for a Wednesday night there's hardly room to breathe!
author: Jesse G.

description: In town for vacation, staying around the corner. This place was #1 on my Yelp search for restaurants nearby. I was integrated by the beer menu, 30 on draft. I tried a few of the Alpine IPAs, fantastic! After reading over the menu, determined we wanted to stay for a bite to eat. The All Day and Abe Froman were delicious and the Hogwash Fries were a good addition. Sauces are available on the table. Wanting another beer, we ordered the cookies and cream. Fried balls of chocolate with bacon and vanilla ice cream, obviously not how it's described on the menu yet yummy! Communal tables, tables for two or sit at the bar. TVs we're on to ESPN, seems like a fun place to hang out and watch a game. The staff was incredible friendly and attentive, order at the bar. A cozy gem of a place! Would highly recommend.
author: Maggie S.

description: Service and atmosphere were great.  Food was OK.
author: Kevin R.

description: My husband and I are visiting San Francisco from Boston And stopped in hogwash was a drink after lunch. Ryan the bartender was great! Lots of knowledge about the beers and even let us know about San Francisco's beer week which was going on during our visit.
author: Marie B.

description: I don't give 5 stars ever. But I'll give it to hogwash because it had the right balance of everything. Welcoming staff. Amazing lovely vibe. Delicious DELICIOUS. Carefully curated menu. I got the chicken and lamb dogs. Roasted vegetable salad was DEVINE. roasted beets. Curry fries (5.5/10) not that great. But I loved everything and definitely recommending this place.
author: Bashayer A.

description: Great food and beer. Customer service could be a bit better but overall awesome place to go. Cheers!
author: Andrew G.

description: Busy Saturday night, but the hostess was able to accommodate us. The service was great the food was amazing.  They had a pretty extensive beer list and some wines as well. I had the hogless and my husband had the Abe Froman. We also ordered fries and asked for a side of the aoli  sauce. The sauce was a bit spicy for me, but on point for my husband.
author: Cinthia L.

description: I found this place by using Yelp and I'm glad I did.  It's very casual but classy inside with a excellent craft  beer list.  They also do Tap Takeovers which is an added bonus.  The bar staff was very attentive and friendly.  I got to speak to the owner and it's always great to support a small business that is serving up delicious food and brew.  I hope they stay around as Hogwash is not Hogwash!
author: Tom R.

description: Wow! What a sandwich! Half doused with beer mustard and hot sauce, and half saved purely for the savory goodness that was a carefully crafted ingredient list, my only wish is that I had room for another. Bravo!! Good vibe and superior service! ...and don't forget dessert. Order it with a vanilla bourbon ale and pour a bit in the bacon/Carmel-laden ice cream. Wow again!
author: Aaron R.

description: Hogwash made me thankful that I gave up bread for lent because now I can try their sausages and not crave a bun!
author: Wuran Y.

description: Such a great vibe!  Old school hip hop playing in the background - not too loud - just enough but can still have a conversation.  Excellent service.  Great selection on beer.  And the goblet - wow 55 oz is unique.  The owner Paula and her bro Phil were so nice.  You gotta try the curry fries with the fried duck egg and sausage - mmmmm.
author: Carmelita B.

description: Small place, like most downtown. Right in the heart of Union Square. Mostly communal seating if you don't mind mingling with others. My brother in law got the $28 sampler but there wasn't anything describing what the sausages were. Sausages were good though.
author: Gina I.

description:
Good menu, the beer is great along with the pork.

A must if you are in the area.

We will be back :)
author: Forrest D.

description: Really tasty pub food and a great assortment of beers. We went there before a show and were the oldest people by about 20 years. Then we went over to ACT where we were the youngest by about 20. Can't wait to go back for some more fried pickles.
author: Bruno B.

description: Everything I wanted, needed and more. The sandwiches are more than amazing, the sausages are made and cooked to perfection. I highly recommend you to go if you want to have a great meal in a casual and friendly place.
author: Fernando G.

description: I could've gone without. I was having more fun at a random place up the street and the manager here sucks.
author: Colin L.

description: Smaller place near Hopwater, would make a great double visit.  I thought the homemade sausages were great, the beer selection was quite good (but not as large as elsewhere) and the staff was young and helpful.  I would undoubtedly stop in for a sausage and beer if I was nearby.  Even the prices were relatively decent for this area of SF.
author: Mike W.

description: The fried pickles definitely seem over rated, the dipping sauce which is a harissa aioli was alright, but the value definitely wasn't there. The environment was nice however. Not the best place for large groups either, the seating situation is limited so make sure your whole group is present.
author: Michael D.

description:
Beyond greatness lies Hogwash. A place people know has great food, vibes, beer, and a few small touches that make it one of the best places in the city to bring anyone you want to impress. 

I have been twice. Once by myself, and once on a date. Both visits resulted in nothing short of a foodgasm, and while the menu is short it makes decisions easier and service faster. Don't substitute anything, and just eat it as it was designed by the professionals.

They have a bunch of beers from all over, and I was not sure which to choose the first time I arrived, but the bartenders were absolutely a class act. They used their experienced intuition and a few questions to help me select a great beer for my current mood. 

My second visit with the date went flawlessly as the bartender remembered me, my beer, and helped her choose a beer she was very happy with. We skipped the fried pickles and went straight for the All day? and the spicy one at the top of the menu? I don't remember what they were called but they were the 1st and 3rd items on the sandwich menu. They were both good, but we agreed the spicy one on the top was muuuch better. The perfect spiciness and added condiments to tone it back down.

Wow. What a find!
author: Shane W.

description: I was in town for a work conference and found this place really close to our hotel with pretty good reviews. I agree with every five star review. An excellent place to eat near Union Square. Ordered the Abe Froman with a side of roasted beets. The beets were well seasoned and had a ton of flavor. The sandwich was just as enjoyable and very filling. Don't let the size fool you. Service was fast and friendly even during the dinner crowd.
author: Curt N.

description: Not a bad place. A vast array of beers on tap. Really good beer I might add. Only place I know that carries Einstock Icelandic Ale on tap. I would come here again.
author: Benjamin R.

description:
Disclaimer: the owner had free beer shots with us after we complimented her on the place.

That said, I don't usually go out of my way to give compliments -- but in this case they were warranted.  Great food, great beer selection, chill vibe, music is loud enough for the place to be fun but still quiet enough to have a conversation... I would definitely visit again when I'm back in SF.
author: Vadim M.

description:
This place is honestly unimpressive. Bland food, overpriced, and terrible service. They literally forgot my order, so my food came as all my friends were finishing up. 

I don't think I'll be returning, but some better veg options and actual customer service would go a long way.
author: Jackie G.

description:
I want to give this place 4 stars, I like the atmosphere, the concept the taste of the food, but so many little things added up and erode away a good time. 
It starts with a question "Do you want to start a tab?" I was seated ordering dinner, so no, I don't think that was necessary. Then the follow up... "Oh, you have to..." Then why ask me? Just start a tab and quit wasting my time. 
I asked for curry fries with the curry on the side... Didn't happen.
The group next to me asked for separate tabs, and got a "So you're saying you want me to run separate checks" spiel. 


If they didnt ask needless questions, they'd be able to run a tighter leaner ship.
author: Andy H.

description: Stopped by for a quick dinner and was very happy that I did. Sadly they were out of the pretzel rolls but the fried pickles were a great appetizer. They were thinly sliced, perfectly fried and came with a spicy mayo type dipping sauce. For dinner, I had a chicken habanero sausage which hit the right balance of flavorful and spicy.
author: John R.

description: Just had the Abe Froman.  Amazing.  It was lunch so I didn't get to sample the beers but it looked like an awesome selection.
author: Brian K.

description: Amazing selection of beers, delicious sausages and friendly, knowledge and attractive staff! One of my favorite places to hang out downtown!
author: Naomi R.

description: Delicious food!  Our group had the Hog Cobb Salad, Burnin' Brock, Abe Froman, and herb roasted beets and everyone was very happy with their food!
author: Jason S.

description: Great date night ! He had the habanero chicken with fried avacado and I had the curry fries with a duck egg. Both were awesome!  Everyone was friendly and even with the community tables the ambience was classy and easygoing. Loved it!
author: Tara M.

description: Upscale/hipster sausage and beer spot. Solid tap list and pretty tasty food.
author: John V.

description: Trying a bit too hard, and the food was only decent. I will say that I didn't try the sandwiches, I had the curry fries with sausage and a duck egg and a salad. The fries tasted like they had been left out a little too long and the sausage was only so-so. They also seemed confused about how to seat two people.
author: Russ L.

description: Not often in this part of SF, but this place might make me come by more often.  Vegetarian "Hogless" dog was tasty.  Really great beer selection (20-30 taps, all special, many local, from sours to IPAs).  Friendly, attentive staff give you the impression they are stakeholders and want you to leave happy.  We did!  Had the impression this place might be new, hope it sticks around...
author: Damian E.

description: I like foodie beer pubs.  This is one of the best I've visited.  The atmosphere is open and the space is well lit.  Energetic music pleasantly pervades, but you can still hear yourself think and others talk. The service was fast and friendly. But the food... Oh the food.  I had a hard time choosing, everything sounded great.  In the end, I went with a lamb sausage sandwich platter and it did not disappoint.  I highly recommend this establishment.
author: Jessica C.

description: Order at the counter. Has tv for games. Good selection of beers. We ordered 2 orders of curry fries. One was significantly smaller than the other. Portion consistency is off.
author: Steven B.

description: We got here about 15 minutes after opening and grabbed the last 2 seats available at the bar. This place fills up fast! Either arrive early or plan to wait for a seat. It is well worth the wait. I had a couple of IPA's and the swine burger. It was by far the best sausage I've eaten. The bartenders were all very friendly and personable.
author: Alicia S.

description: We ordered a chicken sausage and the famous curry fries and a $8 beer. We paid over $30 for it. It is a bit pricy given that we basically ordered fries, "hotdog" and one glass of beer. The deco is nice and comfy. But value for the food, so so.  I understand that it is Union square. Deserve 4,5 yelp review star? Probably not.
author: April W.

description: First time out in San Francisco, and if you're in the Financial District then you have to stop here. The vibe of the place is very welcoming and the beer even better. The tap list is ridiculous, they have a beer for any palette. Also the food is killer, it compliments the beer perfectly. I was being helped by a gent named Phillip and he had recommended a great sandwhich. Lastly I topped off the order with a set of fried pickles which were bomb. The pickles are dipped in this batter that is infused with Anchor Steam, so you know you can't go wrong. This place is on the come-up and will be around no doubt. A must see in San Francisco.
author: Kyle G.

description: Incredible beer selection including beers unavailable at most of Sf's diverse bar scene. Food was very good. Stand out was the Sheepish, but next time want to try the All Day. Staff was super friendly, attentive, and food arrived quickly. Place was pretty small but we were seated immediately due to the community style seating.
author: Lindsay T.

description:
My partner and I happened upon this place by chance on a pre-theater night. Based on the simple concept (order at counter, get a number) and small menu (very few things on offer) we figured we'd have plenty of time here, but we barely made the show.

The kitchen was incredibly backed up; it took 35 minutes to get the food we ordered, and oddly, warm things were cold, like they'd been sitting a while--particularly the fried pickles. I think everything would have tasted better and been more enjoyed if brought to us when ready (and sooner than 35 min).

BUT the staff could not have been friendlier, more apologetic, and more accommodating about it. I think I recall them offering to comp everything, even! (But we had already prepaid when we ordered in hopes of saving time.)

Anyway, in this age of service not mattering, it was really a pleasant surprise.

Also, the tiny menu is well curated and they make HOMEMADE VEGAN SAUSAGE! How cool is that?

We had the vegan sausage sandwich, the kale salad (a creamy and delicious salad slathered in probably too much goat cheese), and the fried pickles. The food was worthy of coming back for, though not amazing, and the 30 or so beers on tap would please any beer aficionado. There's a decent wine list too; I enjoyed a Cakebread Sauv.

Although we're unlikely to make this a destination, we would definitely come back when in the area.
author: Stephanie P.

description: After two weeks in SanFran and eating out every night - this is easily my favorite restaurant now. I actually chose to eat here because the food looked good online and seemed to be reasonably priced. My experience exceeded my expectations. The food was amazing. I couldn't decide between the Abe Frohman or the Burnin' Brock... so, I had both. The beer selection only compliments the food.  Each brew is rich in flavor and not at all watered down which has been an unfortunate experience of mine at some gastropubs. I think I'm going to eat here for the next couple days. I know I should try other restaurants, but this place is too good to be true!
author: Greg W.

description: Yummy food! Not overrun by tourists. Great beer list. Only recommendation would be to order the curry sauce on the side of you order the curry fries. Amazing flavors! The lamb sausage, Burnin Brock style was out of this world.
author: Tiffany B.

description: delicious sausage, great chips, good beer selection.  I came mid-afternoon and it was pretty quiet, which was really nice!
author: Wes S.

description: Ate here with my former college roommate before going to a concert. I got the hot dogs with fried pickles on it, and a light wheaty beer whose name I don't recall. We didn't stay too long because of the concert, but the meal itself was just the right size.
author: Simon C.

description:
Wow, what a great place.

Super friendly and helpful staff, excellent/diverse beer menu, tasty foods (esp the fried pickles the chicken habanero sausage, and the Hogwash fries.

I'll definitely be re-visiting!
author: Jon B.

description: *This review is purely based off the beers* Great beer selection ranging from sours, to lagers, to IPAs, and porters. Bartender was sweet and manager looking dood was attentive and seated us quickly. I would have loved to try out the food but we had plans for dinner.
author: Karen S.

description: Very nice well constructed sausage sandwiches.   We had a special thanksgiving turkey sage and a merguez, both very nice.  Extensive tap beer list is nice though somewhat narrow in profiles.  Overall almost perfect.
author: Eric S.

description: Delicious expensive wines by the glass - not a big beer drinker so I'll refrain from any lengthy irrelevant comments.  Very solid fried pickles and sausages.  There is basically nothing else so if you are in the mood to eat pickles and partake of sausages that even Abe Froman, the sausage king of Chicago, would be proud of then this place should be your jam.
author: Asaf P.

description: Did you just stumble upon the best bar in the city? Why yes, you did indeed. Great beer, awesome food and the nicest staff. I love this place. Do yourself a favor and get the fried pickles to go with your goblet(54oz of goodness). That or anything else on the menu, all great. If you are visiting San Francisco, or just looking to have a few beers with friends, your search for a bar can stop here.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: A draft beer list that is inspired and great sausage sandwiches, I couldn't ask for anything more! Prices reasonable especially for San Francisco, Friendly and attentive staff, nice décor. Great fries too. Actually I could ask for one addition to the menu that would just make this my own special slice of heaven, a good mussels pot option on the menu to go with the fries, something simple and fresh with a Belgian white ale, garlic, butter and herbs would be perfect to go along with a roll of bread. Still gets 5 stars just for the tap list alone. Sorry to non beer snobs no PBR or Coors light on tap here for you.
author: Brian M.

description: First time here tonight, brought the Wife and my brother was babysitting the kids tonight. My brother said he could stay the night and watch the kids .
author: Krunal R.

description: Pretty good food. Tried their most popular item with the chicken habanero sausage. Def try the place out if you're in the area.
author: Johnny C.

description:
This place is legit.  It's a classy joint with serious beer and a jovial vibe.  The sausages are really, really good which I was surprised about since I had "beer hall" in my mind.  The chicken habanero has a ton of flavor with this amazing chipotle aioli.  Couldn't decide if that was my favorite or the lamb sausage with blue cheese ... but I have a thing for blue cheese.  

Service was friendly and hospitable, and the beer was clearly awesome.  I'll admit I'm nowhere near cicerone level, but the Saison was a complex, delicious beer that paired well with the food.  

Hogwash is great and I love hanging in this hood ... I'll be back!
author: Ashley C.

description: Best sausage I've ever had. Plus good beer. Hogwash for the win!  The fries and sauces are a great touch as well.
author: Sean D.

description:
5 Stars for Creativity on every item. 
They also have every beer you could think of. 
It will be a once and a while place for me, it's all good but not for everyday.
author: Leonard H.

description:
Hogwash is exactly what I was looking for. I wanted  
a place with a strong beer collection and good, hearty food. The curry fries are AMAZING!! It was super crowded due to a private event but the staff was great in helping us to find a table whenever anything was available.
author: Sophie A.

description: Cool vibe and good downtown brew and brat spot. Too hip to be in this location , but really good for all types of groups. Great selection--around 30 beers, wines and many types of sausages.
author: Bethany D.

description: Very interesting menu and overall concept.  I really enjoyed the seasonal Turkey sausage sandwich.  I would go back.
author: Amy A.

description: Pretty good place, but could be better. Positives: cool digs, great beer selection with many unique micro brews, good sausages and attentive staff. Bad: beer a bit pricey and sausages way too small. The bun and other fillings (slaw, beets, etc) overwhelm the sausage which you barely end up tasting. A bit skimpy on the amount of chips that come along with a sausage too (although they are good). Overall a cool concept that just needs a bit of refinement. Definitely worth a try.
author: Alex P.

description: Cute little bar/pub. Good eats and hella beer on tap. Angel was awesome. He answered any questions we had about the menu and ensured our food came out quickly and delicious. He was great!!!! Would definitely comeback!!
author: Angie B.

description: Great great place. Quality beers, with lots of local options. We ordered a platter with selection of sausages and the curry fries. The food was to die for.
author: Vinay K.

description: My boyfriend and I were in the city last night to visit a comedy club, and after we left, we came across hogwash. From the outside, we could see a ton of taps which immediately drew us in. We sat at the bar and the service was phenomenal. The owners and bartenders were super friendly. I asked the bartender to choose between two of my favorite beers for me and he made me a blend that I loved (fresh squeezed IPA and headlands hill 88 double IPA which are both awesome). While I didn't get to try the food (the kitchen was closed), the menu was appealing and I would definitely eat here. I can't believe this place is brand new. I would have thought they've been there for a while. Great place! Great ambience, beer, and service. Will definitely be back!
author: Taylor M.

description: Awesome place to grab a bite and a couple beers. They have a huge beer selection. The fries are amazing. I go with the Abe Froman and my wife opts for the vegetarian hogless. Super friendly bartenders snd overall really good vibe.
author: Pat D.

description:
Very cool spot. Bartenders were awesome. Selection of beers were great. Love the Decore. Food was yummy and I loved it they had healthy options (as well as non healthy!)
Definitely a great spot for one-on-one or groups.
author: DENISE W.

description: The Walker Texas BBQ special sando is worth the traffic jam to get here. I am coming back tomorrow.
author: Paul G.

description: Good Selection of beers, casual setting. mediocre foods..the place was an ok. not really impressed.
author: Ryan H.

description: Great sandwiches and amazing beer. Their curry fries are a must try. I didn't get it with the fried duck egg on top, however, I have some deep regret about that!
author: Eric L.

description: Fantastic food and beer. Great staff. Awesome. Good for groups of 4, not 8+.
author: Christopher V.

description: If you're looking for something quick, delicious, fresh, laid back, hip, including craft beer, this is the spot. I had the Burnin' Brock and it was absolutely incredible. I could eat this sandwich everyday if given the opportunity. The fries are on point-not too crunchy not too soft. Great place to go if you're on your own because of the community tables and bar. I was told by the staff that all the sausages are made daily. Definitely recommending to friends and hope that one day a place like this will exist where I live! 5 stars all the way.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Came here a week ago for a friends birthday (let's call it her 30th). The staff couldn't have been nicer. We sat at one of the large picnic-style tables and had the best time. Pickle plates, sausage plates, curry fries, salads -- great for sharing, good for girls who can sometimes be picky, and also those who are down to eat anything. 

We weren't limited to beer (although that's my jam) -- they served wine and champagne too. We will definitely be coming back.  Great spot. Warm atmosphere. Awesome food. Killer music.
author: Rebecca R.

description:
This place is the truth. It has quickly become *the* bar. Great place to grab a beer, eat, or watch a bay area sports game. Take that long lost childhood friend who's visiting the city for two days and needs a good bar, you won't be disappointed. Flowing pints during the week, and on the weekends you'll see more of the 50-something ounce Hog Goblets filled with your choice of brew.

Food you ask? I crave the Burnin' Brock during the week, chicken habanero sausage and fried avocado... yes please. Fries are incredible on the side or just by themselves (or with curry, sausage and duck egg yuhssss), and don't get me started on the fried pickles. I rarely crave a salad but when I do, the Kale Salad with the chicken sausage is perfect if I'm feelin' leafy. 

Probably the best bar menu in the city, it's constantly changing but some of my favorites stay as regulars. Ask the bartenders and they'll give you a sip no problem, always something new to try and good good good pours. 

Be warned, if you visit here you may become a regular.
author: Thomas D.

description: Nice place by my flat to visit.  Friendly faces, lost of nice Belgium beer.  Service was fast and accommodating.  The vibe was laid back.  Ryan was so nice.  I want to die here.  twice.   Really really awesome food... omg.. food was good.
author: Cem S.

description: Went here a month ago, food was just ok; Small portions and overpriced. The hostess was the sweetest though; had good customer service from everyone.
author: Shell A.

description: Beer was delicious! Family style tables which didn't bother us. Food was good but wish it came with something on the side.
author: Jessica S.

description: Awesome spot. The beer & food was on point. Got to my girl & I quick. The employees were nice & prompt. Next time I'm in the city I'll stop by again
author: Gonzalo M.

description: Food was pretty good. nothing to write home about in my opinion, but it's good.
author: Michelle E.

description:
limited menu, not much seating if you want/need a back to your chair
this place is a friendly un-fancy place for a quick bite, but not what you want for a full lunch or dinner
author: Nancy M.

description: Came in for a quick bite and was blown out of the water by the food, staff, and beer selection.  We sat at the bar with Ryan, who pointed us to the quad beer, which was AMAZING!!  The Southern Gobbler was a lighter, better version of Thanksgiving dinner, and if you don't order it, you're making a huge mistake!  We will definitely be coming back!!
author: Christen R.

description: The chicken sausage sandwich with fried avocado was d.e.l.c.i.o.u.s.  Staff was friendly and atmosphere stylish and laid back
author: Josh T.

description:
This place is exactly as advertised - pork sausages washed down with excellent beer. Great beer selection. We tried their sausage platter and fried pickles. Both were really good. The white sausage was surprisingly spicy so be careful if you don't like spice. Fried pickles were great but I wish there were more of them for the price :). 
Came on a Saturday evening and had no trouble getting a table. We were there from around 5:30 to 8:30pm and it was lively but not too crowded the entire time.
author: J. K.

description: Stumbled upon this place while walking near union square and definitely glad I stopped!! Though it was pretty crowded with what seemed like a diverse and fun crowd the staff helped us arrange some stools to get 4 seated together at the bar. Immediately I was pleased with the friendly knowledgeable staff as I asked for a few samples of the beer. I liked that they had a lot of micro brews from the area and other west coast states. Got the Abe Frohman, a delightful chicken sausage sandwich that came on a soft hoagie with fresh veggies and pickles, beer battered pickles, and an assortment of pickled veggies(Can ya tell I love pickles?!? Lol). The pickled veggies were my favorite! Again, pickled anything is my fave. Fresh veggies with a light pickling that I could probably eat all damn day! My friend and I split all three items and it was definitely more than enough food along with a couple beers. Would highly recommend this delightful little gastro pub and will hopefully be back someday!
author: Libby P.

description: I was so surprised at the quality of sausage.  It was mediocre at best.  I am from Texas and we have very good sausage there.   The reviews are so good on this place and if that is what y'all call good sausage you need to come to Texas. You have been missing out.
author: James C.

description: Found this place after finding the golden gate tap room to be a bust...I loved it! Cool atmosphere, friendly and approachable staff, and good drinks! The layout is small and narrow. Don't recommend for a large group. Great music and artwork!
author: Ashield C.

description:
I had mixed feelings about this place. The food was great and the beer selection was definitely good (having lived in North County San Diego where the beer scene is excellent), but it was very pricey considering the fact that after ordering three sausage sandwiches (the sheepish, the burning Brock and the beef and cheddar) and the fried pickles, my husband, 7 year old son and I left still a bit hungry. I'm the kind of person that eats just until I'm not hungry anymore, not until I'm stuffed. It would've been great had they included any kind of small side with their sausage rolls, or priced the sausage a little bit lower so it was more feasible to order sides. Sure, you're paying for quality and location, It's definitely a good bet if you want to try some great sausage, and are either not a big eater or don't mind spending a fair bit in order to have sides as well. 

Also, the wait was long, which on a Friday night was to be expected. The staff were very accommodating and helpful!!
author: Morgan S.

description: Had a great time here! The food is incredible- especially the pretzel, fries, and hogs! The bartenders (Scotty and Ryan I believe) get along so well it's hilarious to watch as well as interact with them. Brought a great experience to a fantastic one. Would highly suggest!!!
author: Diane G.

description: I flew in from New York and this place was by my hotel so I wanted to check it out.  I walked around for a bit, which is a hard thing to do in San Francisco, and got here with a half hour to kill before it opened since everything opens at 5pm on Sundays.  The wait was worth it.  I was greeted kindly and totally ignored the order at the bar sign and took a seat.  Upon realizing my mistake, a kind worker took my order anyway after giving me a beer suggestion and even let me sample the two I was debating.  Blueberry beer, award winning fries, and the Abe Froman (beef, cheddar, and bacon sausage made on site!) were all amazing.  Cool, laid back ambiance.  And the price isn't bad!  THIRTY BEERS ON TAP. I mean come on!  Totally bringing my coworkers here later this week!
author: Maria T.

description: We managed to nab seats at the bar in just about 10 minutes on a Saturday night. The bartender was great and recommended a delicious Icelandic beer. The food was great too! All in all a great experience!
author: Lindsey D.

description: Amazing food, great beer selection, awesome service! We ordered the sausage platter and curry fries... perfect!
author: Karen V.

description: I ordered the highly recommended Abe Froman and was not disappointed. It's one of the best sausages I've had, although it was slightly overcooked. The beer selection was also good, though not quite comprehensive enough to compare to other five star gastropubs in the city. The herb roasted beets are a tasty appetizer, but they could have been less greasy. I do highly recommend Hogwash overall.
author: Brett D.

description:
I'm pretty much too lazy to leave reviews so the fact I am writing this is an endorsement in itself. This place rocks!  They serve a great selection of sausages (where else do you find that?). The Abe Froman is fantastic. The roll is just right. Not too bready but still substantial to go with the meat.  Usually fries are just fries to go along with a meal. These are literally the best fries I've ever had.  Oh, and they have a fantastic beer selection, too. 

I am pretty cheap and everything in San Francisco seems really expensive to me. This place is pretty reasonably priced to boot!
author: Jeremy C.

description: Amazing beers and the habanero sausage Sammy was incredible. Met the owner and was a great guy......support these guys!!!
author: Brian H.

description: Excellent service, sausage and swill!  Recommend Harmonic Rye Old Fashion paired with Burnin' Brock - soooo good!
author: Denny S.

description: The fried pickles are better than what everyone says!!! 5 stars!!! Great beer selection, incredible menu, good staff... What more can you ask for?!
author: Cynthia S.

description: Love this place! Quality drinks, food and service.  Good crowd, even on a week night. Owner is super cool too!
author: Anmarie H.

description: Simply Amazon every time. Is it bad to say that i come here for the fries. If the fries are good then everything else must be..... Of course! Crispy!!!!!! Yummmmmmmmm
author: Joamel G.

description: Wandered in because of the swine-centric name and beers on tap. I was happy to see the beer menu was big enough to explore but small enough that the bar tenders actually had something insightful to say about all of them. They were great guides on the beer and the food which was just what I was in the mood for in a gastropub. Fry something well, the pickles, and serve great cased meat, in my case the lamb sausage in the Sheepish sandwich. Big thank you to Paula and Preeda for helping guide me tonight and the recommendations for the rest of the weekend.
author: J K.

description: Had the Burning Brock for lunch last week and it was excellent.  Didn't have a chance to try any beer, but looks like a great selection.
author: Peter N.

description: The beer selection is great. The sausage selection is, well, disappointing. I had the platter with all sausages and pickled veggies. The sausages aren't any recognizable style, so you can't really compare them to any you've had before. They do indeed have taste and spice, but are just kind of strange. The service is above average, but I won't be going back.
author: Eric D.

description: Very flavorful sausage.  Sausage places usually make you feel like you overpaying, but this only made me feel like I was slightly overpaying.  The toppings were very good, and the sausage was juicy and flavorful.  Decent beer selection as well.  Good curry fries.
author: Zachary S.

description: If you like IPA, try the Deschute Fresh Squeezed IPA from Oregon! Amazing! Make sure you get the fries - they crunch like potato chips! So tasty! One star off for the bar service. Went there Friday around 8pm, wasn't very busy but the bar staff weren't very attentive. It was hard to order a drink even when we sat at the bar. Their eyes kinda just glance over you, we had to wave our hands many times to get their attention.
author: Lianne M.

description: Nice atmosphere and good beer. We also ordered the sausage sampler. It was a welcomed change from bar food, and it was yummy. Glad we went there, fun place and the bartenders were very attentive!
author: Gina J.

description: This place was amazing. Would definitely recommend the burnin brock. Just wish i had more time in San Fran to taste the rest of the menu!
author: Leon T.

description:
Nice and fun place for a great beer and terrific bar food. We had help from Martha selecting the right beer. 

Very casual. Sit at the bar if you can.
author: J V.

description: Awesome. The ratings don't lie. Sausage with egg plus fried pickles. Amazing. Bartender was very helpful.
author: Ken M.

description: Love this place! Great after work hangout spot for meeting up with friends or chilling with coworkers. Beer menu is outstanding as is the small menu of bites. Curry fries with duck egg is amazing! Preeda and Morgan did a fantastic job with this place. Great vibe, great food, great prices.
author: Brittstar Stella Noir T.

description: Loved this place!  My husband and I went there for an event a couple of weeks ago and were blown away.  The space itself is wonderful and the selection of wines and beers is fantastic.  I literally feel like I received an education in beer that evening from one of the owners.  She discussed with a group of us the different components of beer and gave samples of several so that we could actually taste what she was talking about.  I would highly recommend this spot to anyone who is a wine or beer enthusiast or is interested in becoming one!
author: Robbi S.

description: Delicious and filling! Truly a unique spot to grab an easy bite to eat. Beet selection is more than adequate and everything I tasted was delicious.
author: Kate S.

description: If you enjoy the meats, and you know you do, the Wurstfest is a great share. Fries and fried pickles are a strong add.
author: James M.

description: This is my idea of the proper execution of a "gastropub"--a truly formidable on-tap beer list, and a limited, unpretentious menu focused on house-made sausage sandwiches and sides. Had the "Sheepish" towards closing time and enjoyed it immensely. Recommended.
author: John A.

description: Definitely the place to go in this neighborhood for quality beers. The large tables and counter ordering make it great for after work things with coworkers. The menu is small but tasty. I had the curry fries and they were tasty but not spicy. I tried two different sausages and they were both good.
author: Lauren T.

description: Cool, unique experience.  An incredible assortment of beer, great wine & tasty food (the fried pickles were amazing and so was the sausage).  The atmosphere and staff were awesome as well.  I can't wait to head back with friends.
author: Leo S.

description: Really good food.  Fun place.  Nice beer selection and knowledgeable staff.   Crowded on a Tuesday which is a great sign.
author: Fran C.

description: I had the Burnin' Brock, a thin link chicken habenero sausage, on a plate with fried avocado and pickled cabbage. It was fantastic...juicy and some of the best I've had. The beer selection is similarly excellent, largely featuring brews from up and down CA. The atmosphere is well appointed and relaxed.
author: Matt S.

description:
This place is unbelievable. I knew it would be great, knowing Nick and Paula and they're attention to detail and knowledge of what people want before they know they even want it. And it's  true, I didn't even know I liked fried pickles. But now I have dreams of them almost every night (both the fried pickles and Paula and her babe of a brother Phil who you can find behind the bar most days.) Upon walking in you're greeted with sky high ceilings with beautiful lights. Long community tables with attractive people laughing and drinking lead you back to the bar area. The large magnetic wall boasts messages like HOT SEX and FRIED PICKLES and COOKING HAPPENS IN HERE. Everyone always looks to be having a great time, every time. Now let's get to the beer. As a girl who has been a craft beer drinker for a decade and worked years in the industry, I'll admit, I judge a place by their beer menu. Especially one that has made beer such a big part of the scene. I will say Hogwash has the best beer selection in the city. Sure, they may not have either Pliny, but they definitely have something for everyone. And the menu is ever-changing. Start the night with a light Pilsner, and take your pallet for a ride moving up to a Dale's Pale Ale, and end with a dry-hopped IPA that finishes with a touch of jalepeno. Too much to drink? Need a bite? Order the Abe Froman. You trust the Sausage King of Chicago, don't you? Also their fries are maybe the best I've ever had. Wait, did I mention all of their bartenders are total babes and not the snobby kind? Want a sample of a beer? Of course you can have one. They're just overall very friendly and passionate about beer. How refreshing!

Overall, wow. Bravo, you two. I can't wait to go back to Hogwash. This time I'm definitely ordering the Hobgoblet.
author: J G.

description:
Great food (mostly sandwiches & sides)...great beer.
This place doesn't try to be anything it's not.
It doesn't overcomplicate things.
author: Leslie B.

description: Sausages were pretty good.  The seating area is very comfortable, with both high and low tables.
author: Alf O.

description: Eh. I've had better. The curry fries are literally frozen fries with Trader Joes curry sauce on top. The Abe Froman were apparently delicious (says the husband). The menu is random and could use some focus (think bacon Mac and cheese and dishes like that). The beer selection is legit (and that's coming from a San Diego girl). The vibe is super chill and welcoming. The girl behind the bar gets major props for complimenting me (and essentially my husband) on my engagement ring. Overall, it's alright. If they get focused and centered around the pig theme it will be steady.
author: Sarah R.

description: Don't come even slightly before they open, otherwise they will kick you to the curb and say "Sorry, come back in 15 minutes". No thanks. I will take my business elsewhere to people who will at least make me feel welcome.
author: Benjamin B.

description: The bacon cheddar sausage and lamb sausage were both insane. Good fries and outstanding beer selection. Sat at the bar, very friendly bar tenders and whole place has a great vibe. Loved it so much went back a few days later and ordered the exact same thing.
author: Chad S.

description: Really awesome place with great employees, who pay attention to your Needs, and aren't douchey. My bartender Phil, who looks like jake johnson, made my experience at hogwash comfortable and memorable! Great people, great food, and TONS of beer
author: Anonymous T.

description: Hogwash was a little smaller than I expected, but I loved the atmosphere. It was very trendy. They have a lot of beers on draft and the fried pickles were fantastic!
author: Emily D.

description: Great beer selection and food.  I've tried fried pickles and Hogwash has the best i've had so far.  They had a quad beer that was so strong it nearly knocked me on my ass!  Which, you know, is a good thing for a drink :D
author: Jon D.

description: An excellent place for lunch with a great selection of microbrews and savory sausages.
author: Rob K.

description: Great if you like spicy food. They have a vegetarian option as well! I absolutely recommend the curry fries
author: Madeline A.

description: I would just like to say I'm really sorry to the blonde girl who thought I was criticizing her when I checked to see if they were all aware we had been waiting for a table right after she sat a table. She did in fact seat a table who arrived after us while we were waiting by the door, but the food is great and obviously she is so good at her job it was insulting for me to inquire.
author: Christopher J.

description:
I visited San Francisco for the first time a couple weeks back and this was the first place we happened upon after checking into our hotel in the Nob Hill / Union Square area of town. We chanced it as not only being an extremely new place, but also that there are SO MANY staples in SF we were told to try. I am so glad we made our own decision. 
It was VERY busy on a Friday night and a little chaotic at first in the whole dynamic of seating. (No real wait list, just grab a communal table when you see a party getting up) Smaller space, a little awkward staring people down and eyeing their spots, BUT literally the only low point. A really nice gentleman guided us through the process, aquatinted us with our surroundings, and checked in on us while waiting and also came to chat with us once seated. He ended up being the owner, hard at work, running bussing and helping the whole dynamic, while being very accommodating!
Both food and beverage is ordered at the counter/bar after grabbing a seat and figuring out your order... You get a number, they give you your food. It's pretty great, especially with the communal seating. The bar seemed to be bustling with many just in for beverage too.
The beautiful menu of homemade sausages (veggie options too!), various side salads (beer, kale, potato), pickle plates, fried pickles etc. were very pleasing options and the four sausages/four sides we sampled were all delectable! I loved the kale salad and vegetarian (squash!) sausage. 
There was also a beautiful amazing draft beer list of 20+ mostly local beers coming from a beautiful line of identical steel taps. Oh yes, the place was gorgeous! High ceilings, warm lighting, lively atmosphere! Very welcoming. Wish I didn't live so far away. Hogwash, you'd be a regular dining/drinking spot!
author: Caitlin T.

description:
Very nice ambience and great food ! Very nice owner
 With good service ! good choice especially for Friday night and Saturday night if you want to hang out with friends in a chill atmosphere while enjoying a good meal.
author: Alireza K.

description: Worst service. To start the hostess barely acknowledged my 2 friends and I walked in. She finally asked how many and we told her 3 and she sat us telling us over her shoulder we needed to order at the bar. About 5 minutes later she walked up to our table and slid a bottle of water across our table put some cups down and walked away without saying a word. We then orders and waited...and waited and waited FOR 45 MINUTES!!! For 3 HOT DOGS!!! We watched 2 other tables get served as no one acknowledged us at all as the waiters walked past us with other people's food. And the hostess did laps from the door to the bar not acknowledging that we've been patiently waiting for our damn hotdogs, but she did however have time to talk to other tables. After about 35 mins my friend got her hot dog. So we waited for 35 minutes -while people who came in after us got served their food- for one out of 3 of our hot dogs. Not a full meal-but an uppity hipster-dog. After about 45 minutes the cashier came up to us and asked us if we were still waiting for food...UMM YEA! You took our money of course we are waiting for food!!!!! Maybe he forgot what we looked like because we waited so long. Oh and the best part is when he asked, he scoffed as if it was a funny coincidence we were just sitting there almost an hour waiting!! That made me so mad I couldn't believe it. He then gave a half hearted "oh sorry.." As we asked for a refund for the rest of our food. So no sincere apology, no offering to comp us, not even a stupid coupon. This place is a joke. Maybe if you dress like a hipster they'll notice you and maybe care about your order, that seems to be the dress code there of everyone who got served. Maybe it had something to do with the fact we were the only non Caucasians there. Who knows. But unless you want to wait almost an hour for a pathetic hot dog (my friend who got the privilege of actually getting her food showed us her hot dog which was a skinny hot dog full with 90% lettuce-basically a salad with a side of hot dog) and you fit in with the crowd- STAY AWAY.
author: Nicole M.

description:
My wife and I came here a couple weeks ago, while staying near there. 
They have a lot of beers on tap, which is nice. I got the Burnin' Brock sausage, and my wife got the All Day sausage. Both were incredible. We also got an order of curry fries with a duck egg on top. So good! Also, the staff was friendly, and willing to answer questions.
author: Don M.

description: Came for the pretzel bites (they don't have anymore) stayed for the Abe Foreman. Sausage was great but they could have dressed that pig up a bit more.
author: Brenna H.

description:
Traveling from Atlanta, I ended up here based on yelp reviews. Glad I did. For dinner I had the "burning Brock" - awesome. It included fried avocado- who would have thought. :)

I also had the fried pickles. Delicious!

Local  beer on tap and service was great.
author: Kellie J.

description: Their beer selection is awesome! I loved their chili double IPA and their fresh squeezed beer. They also have great sausages. I have tried their Burnin' Chicken and their lamb sausage and they were both great! Friendly service and overall great spot to go to with anyone!
author: Gisele M.

description: Good beer, good food, great service. The burning brock was an awesome new experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful with patrons with not so much experience with craft beer. I'll definitely come back here.
author: Francisco S.

description: Great gourmet sausages, fun vibe, busy on weekends but got a shared table in 5 mins.  Had two of their recommended sausage sandwiches and a kale /grilled peach salad!  All good. Tip: you order drinks and food at the bar counter only.  Food is brought but no "traditional" servers.
author: Kathleen L.

description: We live a block away so we wanted to check this place out since it just opened. We met one of the owners, Nick, and he's a knowledgable  and nice guy. Excellent beer selection on tap and Nick mentioned that they will be expanding the wine list soon. Great atmosphere and we now have a favorite local bar!
author: LG M.

description: Amazing selection of beers on tap...probably best in the area! The fried pickles are the best I've ever had. My bartender, Phil, was extremely friendly and helpful! I would definitely recommend this place to friends and visiting tourists!
author: Bryan A.

description: Best staff. Super friendly and down to earth, no pretentiousness and very attentive to customer service. Love the beer selection... A favorite spot for me....food is a winner... can't go wrong with HogWash
author: Peter A.

description: O.M.G. My husband and I came here right as the kitchen closed and they accommodated us late night post-show diners. We ordered the Sheepish sandwich and curry fries - best food in a LONG time! The Sheepish is well-balanced and the fries are insane. Not only that, the service is upbeat and sublime. Definitely coming back!!
author: Kristina H.

description: Had a couple of Moonlight lagers and their chicken sausage sandwich. Loved it and looking forward to returning. I just wish I could just order from the bar instead of getting back in line at the register.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I was looking for a good place for lunch while visiting for the weekend and found this gem. Food, beers and service were all exceptional. I Highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Chris R.

description: Loved it!!!! Had the Wurstfest. It was excellent. Also had the herb roasted beats. Loved them. Different that I had ever had beats (one of my favorites sides) and their version was great.  Beer and atmosphere (great bartenders and wait staff, music, overall ambiance.).   Visited while on biz travel (dined by myself) and felt very welcomed and had a great time.  Highly recommend it:)
author: Eloisa C.

description: Stumbled upon hogwash and so happy I did! Best beer selection in SF hands down. Great service and friendly staff. DEFINITELY coming back!!
author: Michaella M.

description: Everything was amazing ... The swine cookies and cream was to sue for . Almost has my husband in tears
author: Stephania D.

description:
service=great
bathrooms=clean
atmosphere=welcoming and cozy lighting

we had a few beers here on their first night open to the public.  great beer selection.  we had the fried pickles and they were tasty.  i am a sucker for beer battered anything;)  we would definitely go back if in the area.
author: Annmarie K.

description: Great food and decent service.  Got the sausage with the duck egg.  Sausage was great egg tasted like any other egg.  Service was decent not too bad.   Communal seating though and you have to order at the bar but yet they have a guy roaming around asking if we need anything?   Can get crowded ordering.
author: Jamie S.

description: Oh my yum! So much inventive food and it tastes incredible! Great atmosphere, check it!
author: Natalie O.

description: We just had a birthday celebration for my husband here. Paula the co-owner was so helpful in making the reservation for our large party, and everyone there was super friendly. Plus the beer selection was amazing, and the food was delicious! Love the fried pickles and the lamb sausage in particular. Also, the music selection was A+--classic Michael Jackson, Al Green, etc. Great new spot.
author: Krista W.

description: Went there for lunch and was disappointed that they do not have the curry fries at lunch. Enjoyed the Burnin Brock sausage sandwich and side of herb roasted beets. Hope they add fries to the lunch menu soon!
author: Nancy L.

description: Like another poster, I wish I could post on their food, which sounded great, but I cannot. Due to their poor management and customer service, our party opted to go elsewhere (we ended up at 4505 Burgers & BBQ, which was fantastic). Due to the long wait, we were told we could wait at the bar next door and have a drink until we were seated. We did so. I learned when I went to the ladies room, that bar and Hogwash share one single sink and toilet for all patrons of both establishments. When our table was ready, we closed out at the bar, grabbed our drinks and went next door. A woman immediately accosted me, told me my cocktail was going to cause her to lose her restaurant then was sent back to the bar to either dispose of or finish my drink. Initially, the guys with beers were told they were ok to be seated but then were also approached by a nervous fellow and told they had to leave with those too.
