Seemed like nobody knew what their "policies" were. Until they can figure out how to run this place and maybe get the other toilet in service, forego it for one of the many great eateries nearby.
author: Pamela M.

description: This place was awesome in so many ways. We were personally welcomed by the host, later identified as the owner. He apologized for not having a table available and said we would only have to wait a short amount of time. The bartenders were exceptionally nice and gave great advice on both food and beer. The sausages were great, the beer was awesome. I can't say enough good things about this place. We went to the Masonic for a concert after and it was great.
author: Heather W.

description: Loved the beer, pickles, the Caesar salad, and ALL of the sausages!  Enjoyed it thoroughly for a laid back dinner.
author: Kathryn C.

description: Few but amazing good options.  Great beer menu, a good portion from San Diego. Got a sausage with arugala and a Duck egg.  Very friendly owner lady who made great suggestions. Really you could pick random items and be happy.  It was Saturday night and they were doin good business and at the same Time it wasn't too packed and service was just right.  I'll bring a friend next time I'm in the city
author: Gordon R.

description: What a venue! A perfect combo of casual and posh, 30 AMAZING beers, and bartenders who know their shit (and are pretty darn cute, especially this one named Phil :). I definitely recommend  the Old Rasputin or Deschutes Fresh Squeezed IPA, but anything is good even for the most particular palate. One of the most welcoming crowds so come solo or with a group.  Haven't tried food, but it smells like heaven. Definitely a homey environment that I plan to return to.
author: Jocelyn M.

description: Great spot for protein in a casing!  A lot of choices to wash it down with. Had dinner here. Service is great.  Staff was knowledgable and would do tastings on beer. Sausages are exceptional. Great beer selection. Wine available too.  The digs have a groovy vibe. Would go again.
author: Beast Of G.

description: Quit Hoggin!! Cant get enough pork product and beer (God Bless America)... The dude with the Brad Pit from Fury hair cut is awsome, and hot blondie greets you with a smile at the door and checks in on you all night.. Is that a sunny-side up egg chillin on top of a sausage sandwich?!? Uh. Yeah im comin back for more. HOG tie me and WASH me down with the 30 beers on tap. Me Like-e.
author: The J.

description: Came here with my brother who was visiting from out of town, excellent selection of unique beers. The bartender was extremely friendly and knowledgeable, making good recommendations. We also got to sample a few things before deciding :)
author: Kristen A.

description: This place is very new and right next to the fabulous cantina. I just have to say that this place is my new favorite bar. Awesome food, a huge beer selection all on tap, not to mention Belgium beers!! Southern tastes meets SF beer aficionados. Loved the atmosphere, community tables and the new ownership who were elated to have me and 8 friends just drink and eat, no reservations no worries. Thank you for everything!
author: Karisa C.

description: Great spot if you like beer and can grab a stool at the bar, or can snag a table with friends.  The beer selection is awesome if you like trying some local, national, and international beers.
author: Michael P.

description: This bar is fairly new, and you can tell. It gets very crowded for a bar that has a focus on the food. Hard to get a table and with a lot of beers on tap, it would be nice to have space to enjoy. The food is great, we got the fried pickles - hard to go wrong. They also have a large table in the front that you can reserve for parties, looks like it seats a lot of people, maybe 14? Maybe I'll try going back in a few months.
author: Wendy K.

description: Came here on a Thursday night around 7pm - place was packed but we managed to snag a table. We had the Curry Fires with Duck Eggs and the Sausage samplers which was pretty good but the IPA (My favorite)  The place is loud but what do you expect, it's the new spot to be!!
author: DVS A.

description: After spending the evening at Crissy Field and taking lots of pictures of the Golden Gate Bridge. We decided to take Lyft to this highly rated place to see what it was about. It's got a pretty rad setup but their menu was definitely unique. We ordered the burnin brock, abe froman, hogwash fries and a couple of beers. They have an extensive list of beers on tap, which is always a major plus. It all came out relatively quickly, tasted really good and had pretty good service - I'd give it two thumbs up!
author: Christian D.

description: Sausages were pretty good, fries were great. Decor looked great but it's really noisy towards the bar. Like others, getting seated was a challenge. Staff were nice. Worth checking out for something different but I probably wouldn't go back.
author: Julia B.

description: We had an awesome time last night! Great selection of beers, a simple menu and the owner Nick is who I want to be when I grow up. He was busting the tables, made sure everyone was taken care of. Love the vibe and crowd too. Great for groups and date nights!
author: Jessica V.

description: Well two nights since moving to San Francisco I have walked out of restaurants either due to poor service or bad food. I was really glad that I found this restaurant. The window seats were fantastic for people watching while enjoying one of the many beers offered and the sausages were absolutely fantastic. On top of good food and drinks the hostess was positive and upbeat adding to a great time out.
author: Michelle K.

description: Really enjoyed this place. Friendly, attentive service from the time we walked in until we left. Very knowledgeable about their beer and the fried pickle chips were some of the best I've had, and I've had many a pickle chip. That aioli sauce they come with would make an old shoe taste good! Close proximity to cantina was a huge bonus too, keep up the good work!
author: Chris V.

description:
Very good, check into our hotel, walked around the corner and wandered in.
Delicious and the hostess was bad ass dealing with the wait list. 
Warmed olives, fried pickles, a sausage sandwich and beer!
author: Jerry S.

description: Fast service, the fried pickles were yummy -and the chicken sausage was spicy and a cool combination of flavors!
author: Sarah H.

description: Paula and the crew at Hogwash are amazing! If you are in to cool, new places, you need to come here! Try the fried pickles while you are at it too! Best NEW place in SF! Come be someone at Hogwash!
author: Justine H.

description: Not that great... Maybe I thought it was going to be different.  I'm just not that into all those sausages
author: amy w.

description: We had a couple beers, two sausage sandwiches, the curry fries (YUM) and the kale salad. So yummy! Pretty busy and seat yourself but worth the wait. Amazing beer selection.
author: Haley P.

description: Limited menu and seating. Got there just in time before started an early evening backup. Mostly just sandwiches and drinks, but food was fresh and good. Both on-tap selections were good. I would return.
author: The R.

description: Went here for lunch while visiting the City from out of state. Was greeted with a friendly smile and immediately felt welcome. The sausage was outstanding, and the bun was melt in your mouth delicious. The atmosphere of the place matches the quality of the food. Great beer selection to wash down the amazing food.
author: Justin M.

description: Came here for the first time last week & loved it! Had some quad Belgium beer that was awesome & the sausage sandwiches are so good.
author: Laura P.

description: We arrived around 10 pm and the place was packed.  We missed the host and went to the bar- apparently a no-no.  But they were still very accommodating and gave us table promptly and then brought us a surprise no charge BIG beer when we told them we were celebrating 25th anniversary.  Spicy sausage was simply incredible!
author: John M.

description:
Shared a sausage platter, curry fries with duck egg and sausage, as well as the pickled veggies.  There were three of us and each of us got a beer.  The total was $28 per person (including tip).  Went at 7PM on a Wednesday and there was not wait for a table.

The food was pretty good.  Definitely recommend the curry fries with all the trimmings.  I wasn't a huge fan of the lamb or chicken sausages, but the pork was really good.  Pickled veggies were good too, a nice variety with green beans, beets, radish, oyster mushroom, cucumber.  

Atmosphere was casual and staff was nice.  They had a pretty good selection of beers on tap too.  I got the blueberry ale and liked it a lot.
author: Chuck P.

description: I rarely (almost never) do reviews. If you've found Hogwash as an option let me assure you. You will not be disappointed. Have the curry fries, add a sausage, and then add a fried duck egg. You will not regret it. If I have one complaint. Even though they have an enormous beer selection. They are short Amber and brown ales. None. I've run in this before and I don't understand it. We are in the age of IPAs and other exotics. They should keep at least one Amber and one brown ale on tap. Nevertheless, the service and playlist was fantastic!  I shall return and I will bring others with me.
author: Christopher M.

description: Live around the corner, finally made it over to grab a drink and a bite after they opened only recently in December. Let me just say this: there's a reason why every time I walk by it's packed. The service was impeccable, my bartender was more than willing to let me taste various brews before ordering a full one. I ended up with the Clown Shoes Double IPA, fries and fried pickles. It was so good I had to get a Belgian Tripel for dessert. The owner really cares: she was adamant about getting feedback on how the food, beer and service held up. I will be back soon, that's a promise.
author: Jonathan R.

description: Great chicken sausage on a roll "Burnin Brock", fried pickles and unique beers on tap. The beef and bacony sausage at the bottom of the list is bit firmer and saltier than the chicken, if that's to your taste. Service is very attentive once they know you're there.
author: Dennis W.

description: Great casual place with a nice selection of beer and amazing sausage sandwiches. The staff is ultra-friendly. The bartender spent ten minutes with us describing the choices and letting us sample a few we weren't familiar with. They had the Warriors game on the TV.  Not fancy, but a terrific low-key spot to get your evening started. I will definitely be back.
author: Rob P.

description: Amazing food and even more amazing customer service. It was a Saturday night and crowded. But we were still treated as if we were some of the only guests in the place. Super kind staff as well. Highly recommend to anyone that's seeking a solid experience after a long day of shopping around Union Square. Thanks guys!
author: Ryan D.

description: Went with a friend after hearing some good reviews. However, when we got there, the place was swarming with people. The waitress/hostess took down my friend's name and we were put on the waiting list. It took about 45 mins to get seats. When we were seated, we ordered our beers and hot dogs (sausages). It took about almost an hour to get our food.I got a lamb sausage and my friend got a pork, she a lager and I a golden ale. Beer selection was nice (hence the additional star) the food was not anything remarkable. Also got the curry fries which were definitely not up to our expectations. Super crunchy and curry seemed like a cheap Japanese powdered mix. We only stayed to get a couple more beers.
author: Dennis L.

description: Sandwiches made with pork sausages. Could do a lot more with hogs. Many micro brews, some in $6-7 range,  some higher.
author: Lan N.

description: The olive "snack" was unbelievable. Warmed olives with olive oil, pesto, and warm bread. Yummy!
author: Kevin B.

description: The beer is great! Good selection and the food smells amazing...I'm coming back later tonight!
author: Cecilio M.

description: This place is amazing! We began with the roasted beets, which were perfectly cooked. Next the Hog Cobb and Burin' Brock sausage sandwich.  The flavors blended nicely. They have lots of beers on tap, from lighter beers to heavy stouts. . We loved the casual atmosphere. The prices were good and we would definitely come back.Yummy!!
author: Suanne S.

description: Stopped by while walking around the area.  Had the chicken sausage sandwich and upgraded to the barley salad side.  Both were excellent.  The fried avocado on the sandwich was a wonderful topping.  The $3 coke was just a tiny bottle (European style serving), which I would pass on if I had known. Good casual lunch.
author: Paul K.

description: Our hotel was right around the corner so we thought we'd give this a try. Coming from the land of Hot Dougs in Chicago, I'm a sucker for exotic "encased meat".  We ordered the Sheepish and Burnin'Brock.  The Sheepish was pretty tasty but a bit spicier than I anticipated. I'm a big baby when it comes to spiciness. The spiciness didn't outweigh or take away from the flavor which is what matters to me.  The Burnin' Brock of course was also spicy but damn the fried avocado was amazing. It was lightly fried.. tempura-like.  Very good. I didn't have an issue with the order at the bar system, but we were seated at the bar.  Cute place. Very tasty. I'd come back.
author: Emily M.

description: The best beer selection I have ever seen, not just quantity but really interesting choices.  Food is solid and was served fast on a busy Friday night.  The staff and the owner Paula are all super friendly, they make you feel right at home.  I would recommend this place and will definitely be back.
author: DK K.

description: I was visiting SF and had a bunch of friends meet up at Hogwash. It was the perfect spot! the curry fries with duck egg are off the hook. Incredible beer selection. Great owners and staff who are all super helpful, super knowledgeable about beer and food selections and finding a spot to hang. I was there on a Friday night and there was a great crowd, and service was still really quick and friendly. We ended up staying all night and the party raged! Can't wait to go back the next time I'm in the Bay Area.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Great new addition to Nob Hill/Union Square area.  My office is right around the corner so it's been a great place to let some steam off after work.  So many beers to choose from.  Definitely try the Golden Ale....my favorite.  Food is amazing too.  Favorite is the lamb sausage and roasted beets.  

Nick, Paula and Phil are super friendly and provide a great experience.  Check this place out!
author: Jeani F.

description: Breath of fresh air, and tasty eats...did I say awesome beer?
author: fred b.

description: I love this bar! It has a cool vibe and it's really inviting. Absolutely love their choice of beer and the food is really great too! The sausage tastes like heaven. Definitely my favorite bar in downtown.
author: Janina B.

description: Hip little bar that has good sandwiches and a great array of beers. Friendly staff. Will be back.
author: Tod P.

description: This tiny place is a great beer bar. We ordered curry fries, mind you it was spicy as hell but really delicious. We loved the choice of beer he had. So coming back.
author: Madhuri D.

description: Man food! Arrr! I had a great sandwich with a pork sausage here, and very tasty fries with curry sauce. They have at least two dozen beers on tap. The menu is limited to variations of pork sausages, but a great spot to hang out, have some beer and chow down some tasty food.
author: Adrian V.

description: After reading all of the other reviews, I really had high hopes for this place.  I ordered the hogless and the curry fries, while my dining companions had the platter.  The fries where old and dry, despite being drenched with curry.  I asked for a fried duck egg on top of my hogless, which came out both cold and underdone.  I sent it back and they just put another egg on top (the raw egg had already soaked into the sandwich).  Total bill was close to $100 for barely any food, two cokes, a glass of wine and a small beer.  Only saving grace was that I enjoyed my beer from iceland.  Save yourself some $ and go elsewhere.
author: Laura D.

description: Small place, great selection of beers on tap. Satisfying but nothing exceptional. Worth the visit but make up your own mind if your coming back.
author: Tom F.

description: Hogwash has undoubtedly set a new standard for craft beer bars in SF. The libations are exquisite, the sausages are outstanding, and the staff is friendly and quick to respond. Great atmosphere and an awesome crowd. A plate of the curry fries (divine) and a pint of their finest Kolsch shall quickly become a new Monday night staple.
author: Paul A.

description: Neat place.  Fried pickles are great and I usually detest pickles.  Friendly staff.  CLEAN.  Not a great deal of seating.  Arrive early and often.  Limited menu, however, everything we ordered was very good.
author: Tim D.

description: I wasn't really in the mood for what was on the menu, but gave it a chance and was very happy that I did. Had the lamb sausage, and with the blue cheese it tasted slightly like a gyro, which was great. The fries were okay, maybe in whatever type of oil a little too long; great beer selection.
author: Kate O.

description: Good bar food.  Beer selection was good but if you're into Bay Area beers you've probably had most of them.  Restaurant was reasonably empty but they made us sit at the stools next to window because we were two. Uncool.
author: A V.

description: Good sausage!  Great beers!  Friendly service!  Cool space!  We came here for lunch because it was close to our hotel and sounded fun. We weren't disappointed. It's not a large menu, but what they do, they do well.
author: Bob Z.

description: Awesome food and great scene! Same owners as the great nob hill bar, Zekis. I have tried all of the sausages and all were delicious. My favorite is the hot link. The fries are absurdly good. Incredible beer list also - the blueberry ale is a must-try!
author: Eric S.

description: Decent food, average service. I thought everything we ate was really uniquely flavored, different but not good enough to to suggest going back. It was expensive for not including fries with the sausage. Fries were very salty.
author: Sara M.

description: Very good food and selection of beer. Fried pickles are the best I've had. The pesto is a bit boring but the olives with it are awesome. Otherwise, everything great.
author: M C.

description: Amazing! We are visiting from ct went to look up a lunch place. Awesome service, even though you order at the bar the staff is great! Very friendly, food was Amazing!! Would come back next time in San Fran. Highly recommend!
author: Kristin E.

description: This place sucks. Their beer is mediocre and definitely don't deserve the 4.5 rating review on yelp. Beers taste very washed down. The ambience is OK. Food is high priced and not sufficient for a 12$ meal, even in SF. Finally, the beer.
author: Abraham V.

description:
Perfect place to share some pints and an early bite. A ridiculous beer selection and delicious + unique tubed meat* are a killer combination. Can get crowded for sure... which is a good sign in my book. 

*aka craft sausages.
author: Pedro S.

description: I'm mad at myself, bought two dogs , $12 bucks a piece, aughhhhh. Bleh on the taste. Curry fries could be crispier too...
author: sam h.

description: The sausages we ordered were tasty and the beer selection was fantastic.  However the sausage portions were quite small for the price and the service was rather slow.  It cost over $40 for two small sausage sandwiches and two beers.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Loved this place. Small space, great ambience with personable staff and a fantastic craft beer selection. The fried pickles were outstanding.
author: Laura K.

description: Well ok, not a bad place, but didn't knock my socks off either.  Arrived Saturday around 5:30, nice sized crowd, sat at the bar.  Beer heaven, yeah it is, great selection, knowledge and efficient staff who knows their brews.  Be advised, these are smaller pours at pint prices, but the beer is good.   Issue was with the food.  Got the Curry Fries with Lamb sausage and the lamb sausage sandwich.  The sausage was ok...one of them was dry but decent flavor, other was the correct moisture, but bland.  They are quite thin, so their flavor gets lost in the dish.  This is not a place I would return to, since I like both my beer and food to be memorable.  However, it is at least worth trying once to see if you like it.
author: John A.

description: The lamb sausage sandwich is amazing.  Nice decor. Very worthwhile and unique casual place!
author: C C.

description: The roasted beets were one of the best things I've ever eaten.  Everything else was good also.  Friendly service, you order at the bar and they bring out the food.
author: R S.

description: Good selection of beers and the sausage was pretty tasty as well. We split the sausage platter which was not enough for a full meal for two, but enough to be lightly satisfying.
author: Ashley W.

description: This place is a must visit.  Everyone who works here is a genuine intelligent person. Erica is one of those rare combinations of funky and awesome.  The owner Paula is smart and radically cool.  Be here.
author: Brian D.

description: This place has potential, but $50+ for two average sausage sandwiches, a very small side of fried pickles, and two beers is not going to keep me coming back.  They also have a sort of strange and disorganized communal seating situation.  I might give it another shot on a less crowded night in hopes of being able to enjoy my meal and actually hear the person sitting across from me, but for now this place just didn't impress me enough to justify the prices.
author: Riley D.

description: I absolutely love this place. Some crazy beef cheddar and bacon sausage sandwich. Had one beer. A little pricy on the beer so I had one. Also had the fried pickles and the sauce on the side was something that was made for the gods. Well, fitting for me as I am somewhat of a god; so I've been told by no one.  Anyway, I might actually give this bunghole city a solid 3 based on the exceptional food here and the burger bar. The guy hanging outside of the establishment with his face covered in the paint he was huffing added that real San Fran feel!
author: Robert B.

description: The place was always packed so I decided to try it myself, it serves several dozen artisan beers but he issue is the food. They are lots of rave reviews of the food which I don't agree with it was not great. I ordered the beer, chicken sausage and fried pickles and the sausage was not appetizing and the pickles didn't stand out, which I didn't finish. If you want artisan beer but with good food go to Hopwater Distribution instead.
author: N A.

description: the bestest food i had in town , u should be here definitely for one time atleast
author: Randy O.

description: According to my girlfriend, "It's a super place to pic up hot chix." And they have killer saugs and beer selection.
author: Casey M.

description: Went here after a Giants game on a Saturday night. Had trouble finding a decent place for a late dinner as most places close around 10:00 p.m. Got served by the Owner, Nick. He was totally cool, offered some beer samples so we could start off with something we liked. Ordered and devoured the fried pickles. The YELP reviews highlighted them and they were delicious. I had the Abe Froman sausage sandwich and it was amazing. I drank three different kinds of beer, my favorite being the Weihenstphaner Vitus Weizenbock from Germany (11% alcohol). It was ice cold, smooth and delicious. Nick checked on us the whole time. I ended up downing about seven beers with the ones purchased, the samples and the bartender gave us a pallet cleanser after I paid the bill. I would recommend this place to any and everyone. Outstanding service (we even received a comp desert), great food and great beer! I tried a good sampling - two appetizers (pickles and fries), three different beers, one sandwich and the desert - all were spectacular!
author: Tony M.

description: Cool vibe good list of beers.  If you like sausage than you will love this place. Good hangout. Good music.
author: Joe S.

description: Great place for a beer and delicious food.  Favorites are the Abe Frohman and  fried pickles.. The dipping sauce is superb!   Friendly and attentive service, always ready and willing to make a recommendation on either food or beer.    Will make this my new, go-to place after work, or when I am craving a good beer and some great food..
author: Dani C.

description: Fantasitic place. We hosted a birthday party here for 20 people and I couldn't think of a better place in the city to have done it. Great food. Great atmosphere. And all at a very reasonable price.
author: Jonathan K.

description: The buzz is so great and you walk in and it just feels alive and fun. And by the way, the food is off the charts delicious. What a great addition to the Union Square area!
author: Sabrina E.
